original: de la 'dus byas la mi mthun par bden par smon pa las ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas la mi mthun par bden par smon pa las ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is established from the wish for the truth of conditioned things to be inharmonious.

original: 'dus ma byas mya ngan las 'das pa la smon cing yang dag par mngon par dga' bar 'dzin pa las ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas mya ngan las 'das pa la smon cing yang dag par mngon par dga' bar 'dzin pa las ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The concentration of signlessness is established from the wish for and the grasping at the true cessation of suffering to be real.

original: med pa kho na'i dngos po gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: med pa kho na'i dngos po gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: With regard to any non-existent thing,

original: byang chub sems dpa' smon pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' smon pa'am /
translated: the bodhisattva should neither wish for it nor

original: mi smon par mi bya bar de med pa kho nar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mi smon par mi bya bar de med pa kho nar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
translated: not wish for it, but should see it just as it is, as non-existent.

original: lta ba de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: lta ba de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With that view as the basis,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: the concentration of emptiness should be understood as established.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gsum po 'di dag la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gsum po 'di dag la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Thus the bodhisattva applies himself to these three concentrations,

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: and thus, as they are established, he knows them just as they are.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa gang dag la nyan thos rnams slob cing /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa gang dag la nyan thos rnams slob cing /
translated: What other aspects do the śrāvakas train in?

original: yang dag par 'grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul la 'jug pa dang / sgom pa'i tshul la 'jug pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul la 'jug pa dang / sgom pa'i tshul la 'jug pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They understand correctly the three meditative concentrations that are cultivated and accomplished, by engaging in the way of presenting them correctly as they are and by engaging in the way of cultivating them.

original: chos kyi mdo bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are four summaries of the Dharma.

original: de dag ni sems can rnams rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag ni sems can rnams rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ston par mdzad do //
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas teach these in order to purify sentient beings.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag go zhes bya ba chos kyi mdo dang 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba chos kyi mdo dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba chos kyi mdo dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba chos kyi mdo'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag go zhes bya ba chos kyi mdo dang 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba chos kyi mdo dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba chos kyi mdo dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba chos kyi mdo'o //
translated: All formations are impermanent is a Dharma verse, All formations are suffering is a Dharma verse, All dharmas are selfless is a Dharma verse, Nirvana is peace is a Dharma verse.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can rnams la de dag dang ldan pa'i don gyi @146b chos phal cher ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can rnams la de dag dang ldan pa'i don gyi @146b chos phal cher ston te /
translated: The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas teach beings the Dharma which is endowed with these verses, for the most part.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni chos kyi mdo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni chos kyi mdo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called Dharma verses.

original: dus rtag tu 'byung zhing 'byung ba'i phyir yang thub pa thugs zhi ba snga ma rnams kyis rtag tu brjod cing brjod pa'i phyir yang mdo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus rtag tu 'byung zhing 'byung ba'i phyir yang thub pa thugs zhi ba snga ma rnams kyis rtag tu brjod cing brjod pa'i phyir yang mdo zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called sutra because they are always occurring, because they are occurring, because they are always spoken, because they were always spoken by the former tranquil Buddhas.

original: 'di ni 'byor ba chen por 'gyur ba dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i gong du 'gro ba'i lam yin te de'i phyir mdo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor ba chen por 'gyur ba dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i gong du 'gro ba'i lam yin te de'i phyir mdo zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called sutra because they are the path which goes to the summit of existence, because they are the path which goes to great prosperity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par ji ltar yang dag par mthong zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par ji ltar yang dag par mthong zhe na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas see all conditioned things as impermanent?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas 'du byed thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid rtag tu med pa kho nar dmigs nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas 'du byed thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid rtag tu med pa kho nar dmigs nas /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas, having observed that the inexpressible nature of all conditioned things is always non-existent,

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par mthong ngo ;
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par mthong ngo ;
translated: see all conditioned things as impermanent.

original: ; yang brjod du med pa'i dngos po nyid yang dag par yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ; yang brjod du med pa'i dngos po nyid yang dag par yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, due to not fully understanding the very inexpressible thing,

original: yongs su ma shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa dmigs nas /
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa dmigs nas /
translated: having observed arising and destruction that arise from the cause of not fully understanding,

original: brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yang dag par mthong ste /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yang dag par mthong ste /
translated: they see all conditioned things with an inexpressible nature as impermanent.

original: des 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams ni skyes nas 'gag par yang dag par mthong la /
analyzed: des 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams ni skyes nas 'gag par yang dag par mthong la /
translated: They see that past conditioned things, having arisen, cease,

original: de dag gi rgyu dang / ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu dang / ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: but they do not observe their cause and nature.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni rgyu dang ngo bo nyid kyis kyang yod par yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni rgyu dang ngo bo nyid kyis kyang yod par yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, they are seen to exist by way of cause and intrinsic nature.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams ni skyes la ma 'gags par yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams ni skyes la ma 'gags par yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: Present formations are seen as arisen and not yet ceased.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni mi dmigs te /
translated: Their cause is not perceived,

original: 'bras bu skyed zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect has already been produced.

original: ngo bo nyid ni mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni mi dmigs te /
translated: Their intrinsic nature is not perceived,

original: ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have not yet ceased.

original: de lta bas na de dag ngo bo nyid kyis yod par yang dag par mthong gi rgyu las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ngo bo nyid kyis yod par yang dag par mthong gi rgyu las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are seen to exist by way of intrinsic nature, but not by way of cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams ni ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams ni ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par mthong ngo //
translated: Future formations are seen as not yet arisen and not yet ceased.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni dmigs te /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni dmigs te /
translated: Their cause is perceived,

original: 'bras bu ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect has not yet been produced.

original: ngo bo nyid ni mi dmigs te ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni mi dmigs te ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their intrinsic nature is not perceived, because they have not yet arisen.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu las ni yod par mthong gi ngo bo nyid las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu las ni yod par mthong gi ngo bo nyid las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas see them as existing by way of cause, but not by way of intrinsic nature.

original: des de ltar dus gsum du 'du byed kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug par mthong nas 'du byed kyi skad cig pa re re la 'dus byas rnams kyi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum mthong la skad cig gi 'og tu 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi pa
analyzed: des de ltar dus gsum du 'du byed kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug par mthong nas 'du byed kyi skad cig pa re re la 'dus byas rnams kyi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum mthong la skad cig gi 'og tu 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi pa
translated: Having seen that the continuum of the stream of formations operates without interruption in the three times, he sees the three characteristics of conditioned states in each moment of the formations.

original: yang dag par mthong ngo //🔽de la 'du byed kyi skad cig pa dang po la ngo bo nyid zhig ma thag tu snga nas med pa'i 'du byed kyi skad cig @147a * //
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ngo // de la 'du byed kyi skad cig pa dang po la ngo bo nyid zhig ma thag tu snga nas med pa'i 'du byed kyi skad cig @147a * //
translated: He also sees the fourth characteristic of conditioned states immediately after the moment.

original: gi ngo bo nyid 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni skye bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: gi ngo bo nyid 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni skye bar mthong ngo //
translated: In the first moment of the formations, he sees the arising of the intrinsic nature of the moment of the formations that did not exist previously, immediately after the intrinsic nature of the formations is destroyed.

original: skyes zin pa de nyid kyi tshe na ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par mthong ngo //
analyzed: skyes zin pa de nyid kyi tshe na ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the endurance of that which has arisen at that time, without destruction.

original: sngar 'gags pa'i 'du byed kyi skad cig gi ngo bo nyid sngar 'gags pa de la ltos nas skyes pa de gzhan nam gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rga bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngar 'gags pa'i 'du byed kyi skad cig gi ngo bo nyid sngar 'gags pa de la ltos nas skyes pa de gzhan nam gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rga bar mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the aging of that which has arisen in dependence on the intrinsic nature of the moment of the formations that has ceased previously, as being different or becoming different.

original: skye ba'i skad cig de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi skad cig 'byung ba de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig par mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye ba'i skad cig de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi skad cig 'byung ba de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig par mthong ngo //
translated: The momentariness of that very entity of the moment of formation that arises after the moment of birth is seen as destruction.

original: des 'du byed kyi skad cig byung ba de'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par mthong ba gang yin pa de'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang / rga ba yang de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des 'du byed kyi skad cig byung ba de'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par mthong ba gang yin pa de'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang / rga ba yang de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
translated: The momentariness of that very entity of the moment of formation that arises is seen as birth, duration, and aging.

original: de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par mthong ngo //
translated: It is seen as the entity of those, not as something else.

original: skad cig de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi skad cig gi ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang skye ba la sogs pa de dag gi yang de nyid yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: skad cig de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi skad cig gi ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang skye ba la sogs pa de dag gi yang de nyid yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: The non-existence of the entity of the moment of formation after that moment is also seen as the entity of those, birth, etc., just as it is.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi po de dag bsdus na 'du byed rnams kyi gnas skabs ni mdor bsdu na gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi po de dag bsdus na 'du byed rnams kyi gnas skabs ni mdor bsdu na gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: When those four characteristics of the conditioned are summarized, the states of formations are, in brief, distinguished by two:

original: yod pas rab tu phye ba dang / med pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: yod pas rab tu phye ba dang / med pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: It is distinguished by existence and distinguished by non-existence.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gcig tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gcig tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The Blessed One has established the existence of conditioned phenomena as the first characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gnyis par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gnyis par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: He has established their intrinsic nature as the second characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'du byed de dag gi yod pa de ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag gi yod pa de ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: The existence of those conditioned phenomena is distinguished by the fact that they are subject to change from their abiding state.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One has established that as the third characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du byed tsam ma gtogs par de'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa rtag tu ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du byed tsam ma gtogs par de'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa rtag tu ma mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva does not see any real substance that is the arising, abiding, aging, or impermanence of conditioned phenomena apart from the conditioned phenomena themselves.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: des 'du byed tsam zhig 'byung bar dmigs par zad kyi /
analyzed: des 'du byed tsam zhig 'byung bar dmigs par zad kyi /
translated: He observes only the arising of conditioned phenomena.

original: de'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa gzhan ni ma dmigs te /
analyzed: de'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa gzhan ni ma dmigs te /
translated: But the arising, enduring, aging, and impermanence of formations are not observed apart from formations.

original: 'du byed tsam kho na zhig gnas pa dang / rga ba dang 'jigs par dmigs par zad kyi de'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid ni ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed tsam kho na zhig gnas pa dang / rga ba dang 'jigs par dmigs par zad kyi de'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid ni ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only formations are observed to endure, age, and perish, but their arising, enduring, aging, and impermanence are not observed.

original: rigs pas dpyad na yang byang chub sems dpas skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag rdzas su mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad na yang byang chub sems dpas skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag rdzas su mi dmigs so //
translated: When analyzed with reasoning, the bodhisattva does not observe these arising, etc., as substantial entities.

original: 'di ltar dpyad na @147b mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dpyad na @147b mi dmigs te /
translated: When analyzed in this way, they are not observed.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed ma gtogs par skye ba'i chos gzhan zhig yod par gyur na ni de gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed ji skad bdag nyid kyis skye ba de bzhin du de yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed ma gtogs par skye ba'i chos gzhan zhig yod par gyur na ni de gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed ji skad bdag nyid kyis skye ba de bzhin du de yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: If there were an arising of a phenomenon apart from the formations such as form, then just as the formations such as form arise by their own intrinsic nature, so too that arising would arise.

original: de lta na ni 'du byed kyi skye ba gang yin pa dang / skye ba'i skye ba gang yin pa'i skye ba gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'du byed kyi skye ba gang yin pa dang / skye ba'i skye ba gang yin pa'i skye ba gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be two arisings: the arising of the formations and the arising of arising.

original: de la 'du byed kyi skye ba'i skye ba de las gzhan ma yin pa zhig gam gzhan zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi skye ba'i skye ba de las gzhan ma yin pa zhig gam gzhan zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: In that regard, is the arising of the arising of formations not different from that or is it different?

original: gal te gzhan ma yin na ni de ltar na skye ba rdzas su yod par don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan ma yin na ni de ltar na skye ba rdzas su yod par don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not different, then in that case, the substantial existence of arising is pointless.

original: skye ba gzhan zhig rdzas su yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: skye ba gzhan zhig rdzas su yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo ;
translated: It is not tenable to say that another arising substantially exists.

original: ; ji ste gzhan yin na ni de lta na 'du byed kyi skye ba ni skye ba yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ; ji ste gzhan yin na ni de lta na 'du byed kyi skye ba ni skye ba yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is different, then in that case, the arising of formations would not be arising.

original: 'du byed kyi skye ba la skye ba zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi skye ba la skye ba zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the arising of formations is called arising.

original: skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / 'jig pa yang rgyas par de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //🔽gal te 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i chos ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa zhig yod na ni de yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / 'jig pa yang rgyas par de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o // gal te 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i chos ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa zhig yod na ni de yang skye ba'am /
translated: Just as with arising, you should understand that enduring, aging, and ceasing are also to be understood in the same way in detail.

original: 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is a phenomenon called “cessation” that exists due to its own intrinsic reality, then it would arise or it would cease.

original: gang gi tshe 'jig pa skyes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jig pa skyes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When cessation arises,

original: 'du byed thams cad 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: All formations would cease,

original: de lta na ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa ltar tshogs chung dus sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa ltar tshogs chung dus sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and like one who has entered the meditative attainment of cessation, the mind and mental factors would not function with little effort.

original: 'jig pa de 'gag par 'gyur na ni 'du byed 'gags zin pa de dag kyang yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig pa de 'gag par 'gyur na ni 'du byed 'gags zin pa de dag kyang yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that cessation of destruction were to cease, then those formations that have already ceased would arise again,

original: de dag gi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir 'jig pa skye zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de dag gi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir 'jig pa skye zhes bya ba'am /
translated: because their destruction would not exist.🔽Therefore, it is not tenable to say that destruction arises or

original: 'gag ces bya bar mi rung ngo //🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'gag ces bya bar mi rung ngo // rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: that it ceases.

original: rigs kyi bu mo rdzas su yod pa dus thams cad na yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa yang ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub par mthong ba'i skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo rdzas su yod pa dus thams cad na yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa yang ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub par mthong ba'i skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that a son or daughter of noble family who sees substantial existence as existing at all times and imputed existence as essentially established would become disenchanted, become detached, and become liberated.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rung ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rung ste /
translated: The opposite of that is tenable.

original: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽yang byang chub sems dpas de ltar 'du byed kyi rgyun gyis 'jug ste /🔽mi rtag pa de dag sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum po 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi @148a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu shes so // yang byang chub sems dpas de ltar 'du byed kyi rgyun gyis 'jug ste / mi rtag pa de dag sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum po 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi @148a * //
translated: In these ways, the bodhisattva accurately understands that all conditioned things are impermanent.

original: gnas kyi dngos por mthong ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi dngos por mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva sees that these impermanent conditioned things are the basis for three kinds of suffering: the suffering of conditioned existence, the suffering of change, and the suffering of suffering.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpas 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpas 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva accurately understands that all conditioned things are suffering.

original: yang byang chub sems dpas 'du byed dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpas 'du byed dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva accurately understands that all conditioned and unconditioned things are devoid of self in two ways:

original: gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: the absence of a self of persons and the absence of a self of phenomena.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med pa de ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med pa de ni 'di yin te /
translated: The selflessness of persons is as follows:

original: 'di ltar chos yod pa 'di dag ni gang zag ma yin la chos yod pa la ma gtogs pa'i gang zag gzhan yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod pa 'di dag ni gang zag ma yin la chos yod pa la ma gtogs pa'i gang zag gzhan yang med do //
translated: These existing things are not persons, and there is no person apart from existing things.

original: de la chos la bdag med pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la chos la bdag med pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The selflessness of things is as follows:

original: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad la brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad la brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad med pa ste /
translated: All things that are verbal entities do not exist as things that are verbal entities.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad bdag med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad bdag med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva knows accurately and completely the selflessness of all things.

original: yang 'du byed de dag nyid kyis rgyu sngar yang dag par chad la phyis ma lus par med par gyur nas de las gzhan pa rnams kyang gtan du mngon par mi 'grub cing /
analyzed: yang 'du byed de dag nyid kyis rgyu sngar yang dag par chad la phyis ma lus par med par gyur nas de las gzhan pa rnams kyang gtan du mngon par mi 'grub cing /
translated: Moreover, when those very formations are completely severed in the past and later become nonexistent without remainder, and other things do not manifest at all,

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: this is called nirvāṇa.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba dang / sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhi bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba dang / sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhi bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as peace because the afflictions and secondary afflictions are pacified and suffering is pacified.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ma dag pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ma dag pa'am /
translated: The bodhisattva who has not purified his superior intention

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa bden pa ma mthong ba ni de ltar re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa la mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa bden pa ma mthong ba ni de ltar re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa la mos par 'gyur te /
translated: or the śrāvaka who has not seen the truth is, for the time being, devoted to nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes de skad kyang zer mod kyi /🔽'on kyang de ni mya ngan las 'das pa de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes de skad kyang zer mod kyi / 'on kyang de ni mya ngan las 'das pa de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'am /
translated: He says, “Nirvāṇa is peace.”🔽However, he does not understand that nirvāṇa as it is in reality

original: ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: or engage in the vision of the wisdom that sees it as it is.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de ni yod de /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de ni yod de /
translated: That proper mental attention exists

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: in this way.

original: dper na rgyal po'i bu'am /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i bu'am /
translated: For example, it is like the son of a king

original: khyim bdag gi bu yang rung ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu yang rung ste /
translated: or the son of a householder.

original: rgyal po'am / khyim bdag gi khyim gyi nang du bskyed par gyur la byis pa gzhon nur 'dug pa de la rgyal po'am /
analyzed: rgyal po'am / khyim bdag gi khyim gyi nang du bskyed par gyur la byis pa gzhon nur 'dug pa de la rgyal po'am /
translated: He is raised in the king’s palace or in the house of a householder.

original: khyim bdag des bcos ma'i ri dags kyi shing rta'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag des bcos ma'i ri dags kyi shing rta'am /
translated: The king or the householder gives him a toy deer-cart,

original: rta'i shing rta'am /
analyzed: rta'i shing rta'am /
translated: or a toy horse-cart,

original: glang po che'i shing rta byin la rgyal po'i bu'am /
analyzed: glang po che'i shing rta byin la rgyal po'i bu'am /
translated: or a toy elephant-cart.

original: khyim bdag gi bu de yang de dag gis rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu de yang de dag gis rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
translated: The king’s son or the householder’s son plays with them, enjoys himself, and amuses himself.

original: bcos pa'i @148b ri dags de dag la ri dags kyi 'du shes skyed cing bcos ma'i ba lang dang / rta dang glang po che de dag la glang po che'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bcos pa'i @148b ri dags de dag la ri dags kyi 'du shes skyed cing bcos ma'i ba lang dang / rta dang glang po che de dag la glang po che'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: He thinks of the toy deer as real deer, and he thinks of the toy cows, horses, and elephants as real cows, horses, and elephants.

original: de nas re zhig na /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na /
translated: After some time,

original: rgyal po'am khyim bdag des bdag gi bu cher skyes shing dbang po yongs su smin par gyur pas /🔽yang dag pa'i ri dags kyi bsngags pa brjod cing /
analyzed: rgyal po'am khyim bdag des bdag gi bu cher skyes shing dbang po yongs su smin par gyur pas / yang dag pa'i ri dags kyi bsngags pa brjod cing /
translated: the king or the householder sees that his son has grown up and his faculties have matured.🔽He praises real deer,

original: yang dag pa'i glang po che'i bar gyi bsngags pa brjod par byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i glang po che'i bar gyi bsngags pa brjod par byed de /
translated: up to and praises real elephants.

original: rgyal po'i bu'am /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu'am /
translated: the son of a king,

original: khyim bdag gi bu des kyang bsngags pa brjod pa de thos nas 'di snyam du sems te /🔽rgyal po 'am khyim bdag 'di ni bdag la ri dags kyi shing rta rnams nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu des kyang bsngags pa brjod pa de thos nas 'di snyam du sems te / rgyal po 'am khyim bdag 'di ni bdag la ri dags kyi shing rta rnams nas /
translated: or the son of a householder, having heard that praise, thinks like this:

original: glang po che'i shing rta'i bar 'di dag gi bsngags pa brjod do snyam mo //
analyzed: glang po che'i shing rta'i bar 'di dag gi bsngags pa brjod do snyam mo //
translated: “This king or householder is praising these deer-drawn chariots up to elephant-drawn chariots for me.”

original: de nas dus gzhan zhig na rgyal po'am /
analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na rgyal po'am /
translated: Then, at another time, the king or

original: khyim bdag des bdag gi bu khyim gyi phyi rol du phyung ste /🔽de la yang dag pa'i ri dags bstan cing /
analyzed: khyim bdag des bdag gi bu khyim gyi phyi rol du phyung ste / de la yang dag pa'i ri dags bstan cing /
translated: householder takes his son outside the house🔽and shows him real deer,

original: yang dag pa'i glang po che'i bar du bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i glang po che'i bar du bstan te /
translated: up to showing him real elephants.

original: des de dag mthong nas /
analyzed: des de dag mthong nas /
translated: When he sees them,

original: de'i tshe bdag nyid kyis so sor rig pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du skyes te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag nyid kyis so sor rig pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du skyes te /
translated: at that time, the correct understanding arises in himself just as it is:

original: bdag gi phas yun ring po zhig nas gang dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa'i ri dags kyi shing rta nas /
analyzed: bdag gi phas yun ring po zhig nas gang dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa'i ri dags kyi shing rta nas /
translated: “The deer-drawn chariots, up to

original: rgyas par glang po che'i shing rta'i bar de dag gi yang dag pa'i don ni 'di dag yin par lta zhig na /
analyzed: rgyas par glang po che'i shing rta'i bar de dag gi yang dag pa'i don ni 'di dag yin par lta zhig na /
translated: The correct meaning of these is as follows.

original: bdag nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don de lta bur bcos pa tsam gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba tsam de la mos par gyur to snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don de lta bur bcos pa tsam gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba tsam de la mos par gyur to snyam ste /
translated: I have been merely imagining that I am such a false object, a mere appearance, a mere reflection.

original: sngon gyi mos pa des ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mos pa des ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I am ashamed of my former imagination.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i khyim gyi nang nas skyes pa bsam pa ma dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos bden pa ma mthong ba bu dang 'dra ba rnams kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i khyim gyi nang nas skyes pa bsam pa ma dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos bden pa ma mthong ba bu dang 'dra ba rnams kyang /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattvas whose thoughts are impure, and the sravakas who have not seen the truth, are like sons born in the house of cyclic existence.

original: pha lta bu'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / sa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du gzigs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos de dag gi mdun du ji ltar gzigs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsngags pa brjod la de dag gis kyang
analyzed: pha lta bu'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / sa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du gzigs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos de dag gi mdun du ji ltar gzigs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsngags pa brjod la de dag gis kyang
translated: Buddhas who are like fathers and bodhisattvas who have entered the great levels and have directly perceived nirvana praise nirvana in the presence of those bodhisattvas and sravakas in accordance with what they have seen.

original: / mya ngan las 'das pa de yon tan las sgra tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i blos yun ring mo nas mos la /
analyzed: / mya ngan las 'das pa de yon tan las sgra tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i blos yun ring mo nas mos la /
translated: Those bodhisattvas and sravakas have long pursued the mere sound of the praises of nirvana with a mind that is not directed to its qualities.

original: gang gi tshe de dag gi tshogs yongs su smin cing 'phel bar gyur pa na ni /🔽bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos bden pa mthong ba rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon sum @149a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag gi tshogs yongs su smin cing 'phel bar gyur pa na ni / bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos bden pa mthong ba rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon sum @149a * //
translated: But when the accumulations of those bodhisattvas and sravakas have fully matured and increased,

original: gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the intention of pure beings, bodhisattvas and sravakas who have seen the truth, will give rise to direct knowledge of nirvana.

original: de'i tshe de dag gi so so yang dag par rig pa yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag gi so so yang dag par rig pa yang /
translated: At that time, their individual correct knowledge

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is the correct, just, and true arising.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gang zhig bsngags pa brjod pa de ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gang zhig bsngags pa brjod pa de ni /
translated: It is the one praised by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.🔽It is the nirvāṇa of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'di yin pa lta zhig na bdag gis ni sngon byis pa'i shes pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mos par ma gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'di yin pa lta zhig na bdag gis ni sngon byis pa'i shes pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mos par ma gyur te /
translated: But I, in the past, with childish understanding, did not have faith in it as it really is.

original: de lta bur bcos pa de yang yod la /
analyzed: de lta bur bcos pa de yang yod la /
translated: But that fabrication exists.

original: snang ba tsam yang yod do snyam ste /
analyzed: snang ba tsam yang yod do snyam ste /
translated: And mere appearance exists.”

original: phyi ma'i yang dag pa ji lta ba'i mos pa la brten nas /
analyzed: phyi ma'i yang dag pa ji lta ba'i mos pa la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on later faith in the way things really are,

original: snga ma'i mos pa des ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //🔽dper na mi nad kyis thebs pa la la zhig la sman pa chen po la la zhig gis de la yod pa'i nad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma'i mos pa des ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro // dper na mi nad kyis thebs pa la la zhig la sman pa chen po la la zhig gis de la yod pa'i nad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he is ashamed of his former faith.🔽For example, a certain person who is afflicted with an illness

original: de dang mthun pa'i sman dag gis rim gro byas nas /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i sman dag gis rim gro byas nas /
translated: is treated by a great doctor with medicines that are appropriate for that illness.

original: mi nad pa des sman de dag yun ring por bsten pas /
analyzed: mi nad pa des sman de dag yun ring por bsten pas /
translated: The sick person has taken those medicines for a long time.

original: de dag la mos shing de dag la dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la mos shing de dag la dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is devoted to them and delights in them.

original: de dag nyid la snying por 'dzin par gyur la /
analyzed: de dag nyid la snying por 'dzin par gyur la /
translated: He considers them to be the essence.

original: de nas mi nad kyis thebs pa de'i nad snga ma de yang sman bsten pa des zhi bar gyur pa'i 'og tu de ma yin pa'i nad snga na med pa'i sman gzhan dag gis gso dgos pa zhig byung la /
analyzed: de nas mi nad kyis thebs pa de'i nad snga ma de yang sman bsten pa des zhi bar gyur pa'i 'og tu de ma yin pa'i nad snga na med pa'i sman gzhan dag gis gso dgos pa zhig byung la /
translated: Then, after the sick person’s previous illness has been cured by the medicines, a different illness arises that requires different medicines.

original: de nas sman pa chen po de la /
analyzed: de nas sman pa chen po de la /
translated: Then the great physician

original: nad snga ma ni zhi bar gyur la /
analyzed: nad snga ma ni zhi bar gyur la /
translated: knows that the previous illness has been cured

original: phyi ma sman gzhan dag gis gso dgos pa ni byung bar shes nas /
analyzed: phyi ma sman gzhan dag gis gso dgos pa ni byung bar shes nas /
translated: and that the later illness requires different medicines.

original: sman gyi sbyor ba snga ma de btang ste /
analyzed: sman gyi sbyor ba snga ma de btang ste /
translated: He stops the previous medicinal treatment

original: mthun pa gzhan bstan na /
analyzed: mthun pa gzhan bstan na /
translated: and teaches other medicines.

original: byis pa lta bu'i mi nad pa sman snga ma la mos shing /
analyzed: byis pa lta bu'i mi nad pa sman snga ma la mos shing /
translated: The sick person, who is like a child, is devoted to the previous medicines

original: de dag nyid la phan par 'du shes pa de /
analyzed: de dag nyid la phan par 'du shes pa de /
translated: and thinks that they alone are beneficial.

original: sman pa chen po gang gis sman snga ma de dang phyi ma de dag bstan nas /
analyzed: sman pa chen po gang gis sman snga ma de dang phyi ma de dag bstan nas /
translated: The great physician teaches the previous medicines and the later ones.

original: des mngon sum du sman snga ma de dag ni nad phyi ma la mi phan no zhes de skad du yang ston pa de la yid ches par mi byed cing /
analyzed: des mngon sum du sman snga ma de dag ni nad phyi ma la mi phan no zhes de skad du yang ston pa de la yid ches par mi byed cing /
translated: They will not believe what he says, namely that the previous medicines are not helpful for the later illnesses.

original: de'i tshig la mngon par dad par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i tshig la mngon par dad par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: They will not have faith in his words.

original: byis pa lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byis pa lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, you should know that immature bodhisattvas and śrāvakas are like that.

original: mi nad kyis thebs pa lta bu nyon mongs pas zin pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: mi nad kyis thebs pa lta bu nyon mongs pas zin pa de dag kyang /
translated: They are like people afflicted with illness, who are seized by the afflictions.

original: sman pa chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa bla ma las kyang ches bla mar gyur cing /
analyzed: sman pa chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa bla ma las kyang ches bla mar gyur cing /
translated: The teachings of the Tathāgata, the great physician, are even more exalted than the teachings of other teachers.🔽They are even more exalted, very exalted.

original: shin tu bla mar gyur pa gsal ba bas gsal zhing /
analyzed: shin tu bla mar gyur pa gsal ba bas gsal zhing /
translated: They are clearer than the clear,

original: zab pa bas ches zab pa shin tu zab pa /🔽dma' ba bas rgya che la ches rgya che shing shin @149b tu rgya che ba /
analyzed: zab pa bas ches zab pa shin tu zab pa / dma' ba bas rgya che la ches rgya che shing shin @149b tu rgya che ba /
translated: more vast than the vast, very vast.

original: yang dag par bstan zhing /🔽gtams te rjes su bstan pa la mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan zhing / gtams te rjes su bstan pa la mi 'jug cing /
translated: They are perfectly taught.🔽They are revealed and explained.🔽They do not engage with them.

original: ma mos te /
analyzed: ma mos te /
translated: They do not have faith in them.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos khong du mi chud do //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa'am /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos khong du mi chud do // de la byang chub sems dpa'am /
translated: They do not understand the Dharma that accords with the Dharma.

original: nyan thos dad pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa gang la yang yid gnyis dang ; som nyi mi skyed pa de ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dad pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa gang la yang yid gnyis dang ; som nyi mi skyed pa de ni /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva or the faithful disciple does not entertain any doubt or uncertainty about anything taught by the Tathāgata.

original: cang shes dang ldan pa'i shing rta yan lag dang / nyid lag dang yo byad thams cad dang shin tu ldan pa dang 'dra ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos kyi shing rta de la zhon nas /
analyzed: cang shes dang ldan pa'i shing rta yan lag dang / nyid lag dang yo byad thams cad dang shin tu ldan pa dang 'dra ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos kyi shing rta de la zhon nas /
translated: Like a well-equipped chariot with all its parts and accessories, he mounts that Dharma chariot taught by the Tathāgata.

original: kha lo pa mkhas pa bzhin du des sa ji srid bgrod par bya ba dang son par bya ba der mi bul bar myur ba myur bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las /
analyzed: kha lo pa mkhas pa bzhin du des sa ji srid bgrod par bya ba dang son par bya ba der mi bul bar myur ba myur bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las /
translated: Like a skilled charioteer, he proceeds quickly and without delay to the place he wishes to reach.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi le'u ste bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi le'u ste bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the seventeenth chapter, on the aspects of enlightenment, in the Treatise on the Stages of the Bodhisattva, called “The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / sdom ni /
analyzed: // / sdom ni /
translated: The summary verses:

original: ngo mtshar ngo mtshar ma yin dang // snyoms pa'i sems dang phan 'dogs dang // lan du phan 'dogs de bzhin smon //
analyzed: ngo mtshar ngo mtshar ma yin dang // snyoms pa'i sems dang phan 'dogs dang // lan du phan 'dogs de bzhin smon //
translated: altruism, and likewise aspiration.

original: sbyor ba 'bras bu yod pa nyid //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'bras bu yod pa nyid //
translated: And application that is fruitful.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi theg pa la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi theg pa la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These five should be known as the marvelous and wonderful dharmas of the bodhisattva who trains in the vehicle of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rgyu med par sems can thams cad la mnyes gshin pa dang / sems can rnams kho na'i don du 'khor ba na sdug bsngal dpag tu med pas mi mjed pa dang / sems can nyon mongs pa shas che zhing gdul dka' ba rnams kyi gdul ba'i thabs shes pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu med par sems can thams cad la mnyes gshin pa dang / sems can rnams kho na'i don du 'khor ba na sdug bsngal dpag tu med pas mi mjed pa dang / sems can nyon mongs pa shas che zhing gdul dka' ba rnams kyi gdul ba'i thabs shes pa dang /
translated: They are loving kindness toward all sentient beings without any cause, patience with the immeasurable suffering of samsara for the sake of sentient beings alone, knowledge of the means of training those sentient beings with strong afflictions who are difficult to train,

original: mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba'i de kho na'i don la 'jug pa dang / mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba'i de kho na'i don la 'jug pa dang / mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: engagement in the meaning of thatness which is most difficult to realize, and inconceivable power.

original: lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos te /
analyzed: lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos te /
translated: These five are the bodhisattvas’ marvelous, wonderful qualities,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: not shared in common with any sentient beings other than them.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin la gang dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin la gang dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: There are five things that are not marvelous for a bodhisattva, but when a bodhisattva has them, they are called marvelous, wonderful qualities.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la phan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bde ba'i bdag nyid kho nar gyur nas gzhan la phan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal zad par nyams su len te /🔽de ni byang chub sems dpa'i @150a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la phan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bde ba'i bdag nyid kho nar gyur nas gzhan la phan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal zad par nyams su len te / de ni byang chub sems dpa'i @150a * //
translated: A bodhisattva, for the sake of helping others, takes on the very essence of suffering and experiences the suffering that arises from helping others.

original: ngo mtshar ma yin pa dang po ste /
analyzed: ngo mtshar ma yin pa dang po ste /
translated: This is the first thing that is not marvelous for a bodhisattva,

original: de dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but when a bodhisattva has it, it is called a marvelous, wonderful quality.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa shes shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan yang shes bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa shes shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan yang shes bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva knows the faults of cyclic existence and also knows the virtues of nirvana.

original: sems can yongs su dag par dga' zhing /
analyzed: sems can yongs su dag par dga' zhing /
translated: He delights in purifying sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyis bde ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis bde ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes one whose nature is happiness through that very [purification].

original: sems can yongs su dag par bya ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas 'khor ba nyams su len te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su dag par bya ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas 'khor ba nyams su len te /
translated: Taking into consideration only the purification of sentient beings, he takes up cyclic existence.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin pa gnyis te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin pa gnyis te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is the second marvel of the bodhisattva, as before.🔽Moreover, the bodhisattva, knowing the experience of happiness through the way of silence, delights in purifying sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni mi smra ba'i tshul gyis bde ba'i nyams shes bzhin du sems can yongs su dag par dga' zhing de nyid kyis bde ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni mi smra ba'i tshul gyis bde ba'i nyams shes bzhin du sems can yongs su dag par dga' zhing de nyid kyis bde ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes one whose nature is happiness through that very [purification].

original: sems can yongs su dag par bya ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas sems can rnams la chos ston par sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: sems can yongs su dag par bya ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas sems can rnams la chos ston par sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Taking into consideration only the purification of sentient beings, he applies himself to teaching the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin pa gsum pa ste /
translated: This is the third marvel of the bodhisattvas.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is the third marvel of the bodhisattva, as before.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can yongs su dag par dga' zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can yongs su dag par dga' zhing /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva delights in the purification of sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyis dga' ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis dga' ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: He is delighted by that very thing.

original: sems can yongs su dag par bya ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: sems can yongs su dag par bya ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: He is completely dedicated to the purification of sentient beings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad la bsam pa thag pa nas yang dag par gtong la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad la bsam pa thag pa nas yang dag par gtong la /
translated: He is completely dedicated to the roots of virtue that are gathered by the six perfections for all sentient beings.

original: yang dag par gtang ba de'i rnam par smin pa yang mi 'dod de /🔽de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin pa bzhin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par gtang ba de'i rnam par smin pa yang mi 'dod de / de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin pa bzhin pa ste /
translated: He does not desire the evolutionary development of that dedication.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is the fourth marvel of the bodhisattva, as before.🔽Moreover, the bodhisattva does the work of others as if it were his own work.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi bya ba bdag gi bya ba nyid du byed cing gzhan gyi bya ba'i don byed pa thams cad snang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi bya ba bdag gi bya ba nyid du byed cing gzhan gyi bya ba'i don byed pa thams cad snang ste /
translated: He is seen to do all the work that needs to be done for others.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin pa lnga pa ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar ma yin pa lnga pa ste /
translated: This is the fifth marvel of the bodhisattvas.

original: de dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Endowed with these, the bodhisattvas are said to have the marvelous and wonderful Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa lngas sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa lngas sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par rig par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas have an attitude of sameness toward all living beings in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i smon lam gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i smon lam gyis 'gyur te /
translated: The first is through the prayer of generating the intention to become enlightened,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi don la snyoms par sems de bskyed pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi don la snyoms par sems de bskyed pa yin /
translated: because the bodhisattvas generate that intention with an attitude of sameness toward the welfare of all living beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la snying @150b brtse ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems snyoms pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la snying @150b brtse ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems snyoms pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattvas have an attitude of sameness toward all living beings with a mind that is full of love.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du sdug pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems snyoms pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du sdug pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems snyoms pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattvas have an attitude of sameness toward all living beings with a mind that loves them as much as if they were an only child.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la sems can zhes bya bar rig nas sems can gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yin no zhes chos mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa'i
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la sems can zhes bya bar rig nas sems can gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yin no zhes chos mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa'i
translated: Bodhisattvas, knowing that all sentient beings are dependently originated compounded phenomena, consider them to be sentient beings and, with a mind endowed with the sameness of phenomena, which is the sameness of the reality of one sentient being and that of all sentient beings,

original: sems kyis sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par gnas pa yin /
analyzed: sems kyis sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par gnas pa yin /
translated: they rest in a state of mental equipoise toward all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar sems can gcig gi don kun du spyod pa bzhin du thams cad la yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gcig gi don kun du spyod pa bzhin du thams cad la yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as they pursue the welfare of one sentient being, so it is for all.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' don byed pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' don byed pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par gnas te /
translated: Thus, with a mind that is engaged in benefiting sentient beings, bodhisattvas rest in a state of mental equipoise toward all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la sems snyoms pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la sems snyoms pa yin no //
translated: In these five ways, bodhisattvas have a mental equipoise toward sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba thams cad ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba thams cad ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The helpful action of the bodhisattvas for sentient beings should be understood as fivefold.

original: lnga gang zhe na /🔽yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ston par sgrub pa dang / don dang ldan pa'i bya ba mi mthun pa dag la mthun pa ston par sgrub pa dang / mgon med pa sdug bsngal ba bkren pa /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ston par sgrub pa dang / don dang ldan pa'i bya ba mi mthun pa dag la mthun pa ston par sgrub pa dang / mgon med pa sdug bsngal ba bkren pa /
translated: What are the five?

original: rten med pa rnams la mgon yod par byed pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam ston par sgrub pa dang / theg pa gsum ston par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: rten med pa rnams la mgon yod par byed pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam ston par sgrub pa dang / theg pa gsum ston par sgrub pa ste /
translated: They are the establishment of the teaching of right livelihood, the establishment of the teaching of harmony in the face of discord in regard to meaningful activities, the establishment of the teaching of protection for those who are unprotected, who suffer, who are poor, and who have no advocate, the establishment of the teaching of the path leading to good destinies, and the establishment of the teaching of the three vehicles.

original: sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba ni lnga po de dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba ni lnga po de dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The helpful action of the bodhisattvas for sentient beings should be understood as this fivefold activity.

original: rnam pa lngas sems can dag byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs 'dogs pa la lan du phan 'dogs par nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas sems can dag byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs 'dogs pa la lan du phan 'dogs par nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Sentient beings repay the bodhisattvas’ helpful action in five ways.

original: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: bdag nyid yon tan rnams dang yang dag par sbyor ba dang / gzhan gyi yon tan bskyed pa la sbyor ba dang / sems can mgon med pa sdug bsngal ba bkren pa rten med pa rnams la stong bar byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid yon tan rnams dang yang dag par sbyor ba dang / gzhan gyi yon tan bskyed pa la sbyor ba dang / sems can mgon med pa sdug bsngal ba bkren pa rten med pa rnams la stong bar byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byed pa dang /
translated: It is to be endowed with good qualities oneself. It is to apply oneself to generating the good qualities of others. It is to be a refuge for sentient beings who are without a refuge, who are suffering, who are poor, and who are without support. It is to make offerings to the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos kha ton du byed pa dang / 'drir bcug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos kha ton du byed pa dang / 'drir bcug ste /
translated: It is to recite the Dharma taught by the Tathāgata and to have it written out.

original: 'chang zhing de la mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chang zhing de la mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: It is to keep it, to make offerings to it, and to make offerings to those who keep it.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub pa'o //
translated: These are the five.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpas rtag tu smon par bya ba @151a * //
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpas rtag tu smon par bya ba @151a * //
translated: “There are five things that the bodhisatvas should always aspire to.

original: yin te ; lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: yin te ; lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas de dag nyid las pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ma nyan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i mthu yod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas de dag nyid las pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ma nyan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i mthu yod pa dang /
translated: to have the power to bring sentient beings to full maturity in every way,🔽to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba dang / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba dang / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
translated: and, having fully awakened to perfect buddhahood,

original: nyan thos dang mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: to be in accord with the śrāvakas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la don bya ba'i sbyor ba ni rnams la don bya ba'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa lngas 'bras bu yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la don bya ba'i sbyor ba ni rnams la don bya ba'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa lngas 'bras bu yod par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ application to benefiting sentient beings is fruitful in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na ;
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na ;
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas

original: thog ma kho nar sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde bar 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde bar 'dod pa yin /
translated: first of all wish to benefit and bring happiness to sentient beings.

original: phan pa dang bde ba de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin /
translated: And that benefit and happiness is known as it really is.

original: blo phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: blo phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: It is unmistaken understanding.

original: 'di lta ste mchod pa dang / brten pa dang / tshad med pa'i le'u las sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mchod pa dang / brten pa dang / tshad med pa'i le'u las sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: It should be understood as it was taught above in the chapter on worship, service, and the immeasurables.

original: // / sdom ni /
analyzed: // / sdom ni /
translated: The summary verses:🔽Correct application, decrease,🔽and likewise, progress,🔽counterfeit qualities,

original: yang dag sbyor dang 'bri ba dang // de bzhin khyad par 'gro ba dang // yon tan 'dra bar bcos rnams dang // yang dag rnams dang de bzhin 'dul //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor dang 'bri ba dang // de bzhin khyad par 'gro ba dang // yon tan 'dra bar bcos rnams dang // yang dag rnams dang de bzhin 'dul //
translated: and the genuine, and likewise, training.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad ni /
translated: All the correct applications of the bodhisattvas

original: sbyor ba rnam pa lngas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam pa lngas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: should be understood as being included in five kinds of application.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rjes su bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyor ba dang // so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyi sbyor ba dang // lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sbyor ba dang // nges par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyor ba dang // so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyi sbyor ba dang // lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sbyor ba dang // nges par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of protection, the application of non-transgression, the application of the power of discernment, the application of pure superior attitude, and the application of certainty.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni rjes su bsrung ba'i sbyor pas yid gzhungs pa bsrung ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni rjes su bsrung ba'i sbyor pas yid gzhungs pa bsrung ste /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva protects his intelligence by the application of protection.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i shes pa des chos rnams myur ba myur bar kho nar 'dzin to //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i shes pa des chos rnams myur ba myur bar kho nar 'dzin to //
translated: By that innate knowledge, he quickly and rapidly grasps the teachings.

original: dran pa srung ste dran pa des ni blangs pa'i chos rnams 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa srung ste dran pa des ni blangs pa'i chos rnams 'dzin par byed do //
translated: He protects his memory, and by that memory he retains the teachings he has received.

original: shes pa srung ste shes pa des ni gzung ba'i chos rnams kyi don la nye bar rtog go //🔽yang dag pa'i shes pa srung ste /
analyzed: shes pa srung ste shes pa des ni gzung ba'i chos rnams kyi don la nye bar rtog go //🔽yang dag pa'i shes pa srung ste /
translated: He protects his knowledge, and by that knowledge he investigates the meaning of the teachings he has retained.🔽He protects his right knowledge, and by that right knowledge he penetrates the meaning of the teachings he has investigated.

original: de ni yid gzhungs pa dang / dran pa dang blo 'grib pa dang / mthun pa'i gzhi yongs su spang ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'phel ba dang mthun pa'i gzhi so sor brten pas so sor rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni yid gzhungs pa dang / dran pa dang blo 'grib pa dang / mthun pa'i gzhi yongs su spang ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'phel ba dang mthun pa'i gzhi so sor brten pas so sor rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is understood through the avoidance of the basis of the decrease of intelligence, memory, and understanding, and through the cultivation of the basis of their increase.

original: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa ni rang gi sems kun du @151b bsrung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa ni rang gi sems kun du @151b bsrung ngo //
translated: The restraint of the sense-faculties is the protection of one's own mind.

original: legs par gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par 'jug pa ni gzhan gyi sems kun du bsrung ngo //
analyzed: legs par gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par 'jug pa ni gzhan gyi sems kun du bsrung ngo //
translated: The agreeable behavior is the protection of the minds of others.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva's application free from reproach is

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la phyin ci ma log pa dang / 'bar ba lta bu dang / tshad med pa dang / rtag pa dang / byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la phyin ci ma log pa dang / 'bar ba lta bu dang / tshad med pa dang / rtag pa dang / byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'o //
translated: the non-erroneous practice of the wholesome dharmas, the practice like a burning fire, the practice of the immeasurables, the practice of the constant, and the practice of the dedication to enlightenment.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyi sbyor ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste thams cad las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyi sbyor ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste thams cad las blta bar bya'o //
translated: The application of the power of discernment is to be seen everywhere in the stage of action out of faith.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the pure will is

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sa dang / sbyor ba sgrub pa'i sa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sa dang / sbyor ba sgrub pa'i sa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: The stages of superior intention and the stage of accomplishing application should be understood.

original: nges par gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: nges par gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of certainty is

original: nges pa'i sa dang / spyod pa nges pa'i sa dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa las blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i sa dang / spyod pa nges pa'i sa dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa las blta bar bya ste /
translated: the stage of certainty, the stage of certain practice, and the stage of arriving at the ultimate.

original: de ltar na sbyor ba lnga po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyor ba lnga po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Thus, all the bodhisattva's correct applications are included in these five applications.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'bri ba dang mthun pa'i chos yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'bri ba dang mthun pa'i chos yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These five should be known as the qualities that are contrary to the bodhisattvas' increase.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: chos dang chos smra ba la ma gus pa dang / bag med pa dang / le lo dang / nyon mongs pa la sten pa dang du len pa dang / nyes par spyod pa la sten pa dang du len pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang dpog par byed cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa dang /
analyzed: chos dang chos smra ba la ma gus pa dang / bag med pa dang / le lo dang / nyon mongs pa la sten pa dang du len pa dang / nyes par spyod pa la sten pa dang du len pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang dpog par byed cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa dang /
translated: Disrespect for the teaching and its expounders, heedlessness, laziness, and the tolerance of the afflictions, the tolerance of faulty conduct, and the tolerance of the pride that comes from comparing oneself with other bodhisattvas.

original: chos la phyin ci log tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos la phyin ci log tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'o //
translated: It is the overweening pride of misapprehending the Dharma.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams khyad par du 'gro ba dang mthun pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams khyad par du 'gro ba dang mthun pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These five are to be understood as the bodhisattvas’ virtues that are conducive to progress.

original: de dag kyang nag po'i phyogs lnga po de dag nyid las go rims bzhin du bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang nag po'i phyogs lnga po de dag nyid las go rims bzhin du bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And they are to be understood as the reversals of the five dark factors.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan ltar bcos pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i skyon yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan ltar bcos pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i skyon yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These five are to be understood as the bodhisattvas’ faults that are counterfeits of their virtues.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sems can ma rungs pa tshul khrims 'chal pa dag la gzhi des gnod pa byed pa dang / tshul 'chos shing spyod lam phun sum tshogs par byed pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig rnams dang / mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos dang ldan pa dag gis shes kyi khe thob cing /
analyzed: sems can ma rungs pa tshul khrims 'chal pa dag la gzhi des gnod pa byed pa dang / tshul 'chos shing spyod lam phun sum tshogs par byed pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig rnams dang / mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos dang ldan pa dag gis shes kyi khe thob cing /
translated: They are harming evil beings who have broken their ethics; hypocrisy; having a perfect demeanor; obtaining gain and honor through knowledge of the treatises of the Lokāyatas and the tīrthikas; and not being ashamed to do anything for the sake of gain and honor.

original: mkhas pa'i grangs su chud par byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la lhag par spyod pa dang / dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa rnams la sred cing ston la rnam par 'jog pa'o //🔽lnga po 'di dag ni @152a * //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i grangs su chud par byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la lhag par spyod pa dang / dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa rnams la sred cing ston la rnam par 'jog pa'o // lnga po 'di dag ni @152a * //
translated: They are: to be counted among the wise; to engage in the virtues of generosity, etc. which are not subject to reproach; and to be devoted to, to teach, and to establish imitations of the true teaching.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan du rig par bya ste /
translated: These five should be recognized as the true virtues of the bodhisattva.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sems can ma rungs pa tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la lhag par snying rje ba'i sems dang / rang bzhin gyis spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i lung khong du chud pas shes kyi khe 'thob cing mkhas pa'i grangs su chud pa dang /
analyzed: sems can ma rungs pa tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la lhag par snying rje ba'i sems dang / rang bzhin gyis spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i lung khong du chud pas shes kyi khe 'thob cing mkhas pa'i grangs su chud pa dang /
translated: They are: the attitude of superior compassion for wicked beings who are immoral; natural perfection of conduct; acquisition of the profit of knowledge and being counted among the wise by understanding the scriptures taught by the Tathagata;

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byed pa dang dam pa'i chos ston cing dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byed pa dang dam pa'i chos ston cing dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa rnams spong ba'o //
translated: They practice virtue such as generosity that is free of objectionable acts, and they teach the true Dharma and avoid false dharmas that pretend to be the true Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mdor na 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams gnas bcur legs pa kho nar 'dul bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mdor na 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams gnas bcur legs pa kho nar 'dul bar byed de /
translated: In brief, bodhisattvas discipline those who are to be disciplined in ten ways.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?
