original: nyes par spyod pa las dben pa dang / 'dod pa las dben pa dang / nyes par mi spyod cing 'byung bar byed pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / 'dul 'dzi dben pa dang /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa las dben pa dang / 'dod pa las dben pa dang / nyes par mi spyod cing 'byung bar byed pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / 'dul 'dzi dben pa dang /
translated: They discipline them in the avoidance of misdeeds, in the avoidance of attachment, in the avoidance of nonvirtue, in the avoidance of the lower vehicles, in the avoidance of the formless realm, in the avoidance of the form realm, in the avoidance of the desire realm, in the avoidance of the sense faculties, in the avoidance of the sense objects, and in the avoidance of the sense consciousnesses.

original: rab tu bden par gyur nas rtogs pa ngan pa las dben pa dang / sgrib pa las dben pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa las dben pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len las dben pa'o /🔽// / bam mo bcu drug pa /
analyzed: rab tu bden par gyur nas rtogs pa ngan pa las dben pa dang / sgrib pa las dben pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa las dben pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len las dben pa'o /🔽// / bam mo bcu drug pa /
translated: They discipline them in the avoidance of the obscurations, in the avoidance of the entanglements of the afflictions, and in the avoidance of the negative tendencies that are related to the afflictions.

original: sdom ni / lung bstan par dang nges par zhugs //
analyzed: sdom ni / lung bstan par dang nges par zhugs //
translated: Prediction, definite entry,🔽definite activity,🔽always acting,

original: nges pa kho nar bya ba dang// rtag par yang ni bya ba dang // gtso bor bya ba tha ma yin //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: nges pa kho nar bya ba dang// rtag par yang ni bya ba dang // gtso bor bya ba tha ma yin // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: and acting as the foremost.

original: rnam pa drug gis byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam pa drug gis byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par mdzad de /
translated: In brief, the tathagatas give predictions to bodhisattvas in six ways.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: rigs la gnas la sems ma bskyed pa dang / de bzhin du sems bskyed pa dang / mngon sum du 'dug pa dang / lkog na 'dug pa dang / dus dpag tu rung ba la dus de srid cig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang /🔽dus dpag tu mi rung ba la yang lung ston te /
analyzed: rigs la gnas la sems ma bskyed pa dang / de bzhin du sems bskyed pa dang / mngon sum du 'dug pa dang / lkog na 'dug pa dang / dus dpag tu rung ba la dus de srid cig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / dus dpag tu mi rung ba la yang lung ston te /
translated: They give predictions to those who are in the lineage but have not yet developed bodhicitta and to those who have developed it; they give predictions to those who are present and to those who are absent; they give predictions with a specified time, saying, “In this much time you will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment”;🔽and they give predictions with an unspecified time.

original: dus nges par ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: dus nges par ni mi mdzad do //
translated: But they do not give predictions with a specified time.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par zhugs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par zhugs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is definitely engaged is of three types.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa nyid la nges par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa nyid la nges par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is definitely engaged is said to be of three types:🔽the bodhisattva who is definitely engaged in the lineage itself;🔽the bodhisattva who is definitely engaged in generating the thought of enlightenment;🔽and the bodhisattva who is definitely engaged in not turning back from unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni rkyen dang phrad na nges par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par @152b rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rkyen dang phrad na nges par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par @152b rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when he encounters the conditions, he is certain to attain unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' la la ni /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' la la ni /
translated: Moreover, some bodhisattvas

original: bla med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par sems bskyed de /
analyzed: bla med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par sems bskyed de /
translated: definitely generate the thought of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon pra rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du de las phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon pra rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du de las phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until they attain unsurpassed, complete enlightenment, they will not turn back from it.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob pa ni /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva who has attained power

original: sems can gyi don spyod pa thams cad la ji ltar 'dod pa dang / ji ltar brtson pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yod par byed do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don spyod pa thams cad la ji ltar 'dod pa dang / ji ltar brtson pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yod par byed do //
translated: He makes the result of all his practices for the benefit of living beings exist just as he desires and just as he strives.

original: nges par zhugs pa gsum po de dag gi rigs la gnas pa'i nges par zhugs pa dang / sems bskyed pa'i nges par zhugs pa dang / spyod pa 'bras bu yod pa'i nges par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par zhugs pa gsum po de dag gi rigs la gnas pa'i nges par zhugs pa dang / sems bskyed pa'i nges par zhugs pa dang / spyod pa 'bras bu yod pa'i nges par zhugs pa'o //
translated: These three certainties are the certainty of the spiritual gene of the bodhisattva who has entered the certainty, the certainty of the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, and the certainty of the practice which has a result.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nges par zhugs pa tha ma las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nges par zhugs pa tha ma las brtsams te /
translated: The Tathagatas, beginning with the last of these certainties,

original: nges par zhugs par byang chub sems dpa' lung ston pas lung ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: nges par zhugs par byang chub sems dpa' lung ston pas lung ston par mdzad do //
translated: prophesy the bodhisattva who has entered the certainty, by means of the prophecy of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par bya ba ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par bya ba ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are five certainties for the bodhisattva.

original: de dag ma byas na byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ma byas na byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: If he does not perform them, the bodhisattva will not have the good fortune to be fully enlightened into unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dang po sems bskyed pa dang / sems can rnams la snying brtse ba dang / brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang / rig pa'i gnas thams cad la sbyor ba dang / skyo ba med de /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa dang / sems can rnams la snying brtse ba dang / brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang / rig pa'i gnas thams cad la sbyor ba dang / skyo ba med de /
translated: They always apply themselves to all the sciences.🔽They always have indefatigable perseverance.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtag par bya ba'i gnas ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /🔽lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtag par bya ba'i gnas ni lnga po 'di dag yin te / lnga gang zhe na /
translated: The five things that bodhisattvas always do are as follows:🔽They always have mindfulness and introspection.🔽They always give to sentient beings who are unprotected, suffering, and without support.🔽They always make offerings to the Tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtag par bya ba ni bag yod pa dang / sems can mgon med pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / rten med pa rnams la btang bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / 'khrul pa yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtag par bya ba ni bag yod pa dang / sems can mgon med pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / rten med pa rnams la btang bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / 'khrul pa yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: They always understand their mistakes.

original: bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa thams cad la byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtag par bya ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa thams cad la byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtag par bya ba lnga pa'o //
translated: They always have the mind of awakening preceding all their actions, conduct, activities, and mental engagements.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtso bor 'dod pa ni chos bcu po 'di dag yin te /🔽de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchog tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtso bor 'dod pa ni chos bcu po 'di dag yin te / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchog tu 'dzin cing /
translated: These ten are the most important for bodhisattvas.🔽They are the most important for bodhisattvas and

original: mchog tu 'dogs pa rnams la 'dogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dogs pa rnams la 'dogs par byed pa ste /
translated: they are the most important things to which they are attached.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?🔽The bodhisattva potential is the most important of all potentials,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs ni rigs thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / dang po sems bskyed pa ni yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad kyi gtso bo @153a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs ni rigs thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / dang po sems bskyed pa ni yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad kyi gtso bo @153a * //
translated: the first generation of bodhicitta is the most important of all perfect aspirations,🔽effort and wisdom are the most important of all the transcendent perfections,🔽pleasant speech is the most important of all the ways of attracting disciples,

original: yin pa dang / brtson 'grus dang shes rab ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / snyan par smra ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang /
analyzed: yin pa dang / brtson 'grus dang shes rab ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / snyan par smra ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang /
translated: the tathagatas are the most important of all sentient beings,

original: snying rje ni tshad med pa rnams kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa ni bsam gtan thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi nang na ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gtso bo yin pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje ni tshad med pa rnams kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa ni bsam gtan thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi nang na ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gtso bo yin pa dang /
translated: Compassion is the chief of the immeasurables, the fourth dhyana is the chief of all the dhyanas and of the three samadhis, the samadhi of emptiness is the chief.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi nang na ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gtso bo yin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa thams cad kyi nang na ni ji skad bstan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam par dag pa gtso bo yin pa'o /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi nang na ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gtso bo yin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa thams cad kyi nang na ni ji skad bstan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam par dag pa gtso bo yin pa'o /
translated: Of all the meditative attainments, the meditative attainment of cessation is the chief and of all the skillful means, the pure skillful means as taught here is the chief.

original: // / sdom ni /
analyzed: // / sdom ni /
translated: The summary:🔽Designation, likewise seeking the dharmas,

original: gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang // de bzhin chos rnams tshol ba dang // yang dag ji bzhin yongs su shes //
analyzed: gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang // de bzhin chos rnams tshol ba dang // yang dag ji bzhin yongs su shes //
translated: Correctly knowing things as they are,🔽Likewise the immeasurable,

original: de bzhin dpag tu med pa dang // bstan pa yi ni 'bras bu dang ; ; tshe dang theg pa bsdu ba dang // byang chub sems dpa' bcur shes bya //
analyzed: de bzhin dpag tu med pa dang // bstan pa yi ni 'bras bu dang ; ; tshe dang theg pa bsdu ba dang // byang chub sems dpa' bcur shes bya //
translated: The result of teaching, the life, the summary of the vehicles and the bodhisattvas should be known as ten.

original: ming dang gdags pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: ming dang gdags pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same for names and designations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te /🔽de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'am /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa kho na yang dag par 'dogs shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'am / de bzhin gshegs pa kho na yang dag par 'dogs shing /
translated: There are four types of designations established by the bodhisattvas.🔽The bodhisattvas and the Tathagatas

original: rnam par 'jog par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par mdzad kyi /
translated: are the ones who designate and establish them.🔽No one else can do it,

original: lhar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: lhar gyur pa'am /
translated: whether gods,

original: mir gyur pa'am /
analyzed: mir gyur pa'am /
translated: humans,

original: dge sbyong dang / bram zer gyur pa gzhan dag gang gis kyang mi nus te /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram zer gyur pa gzhan dag gang gis kyang mi nus te /
translated: ascetics, or priests.

original: de dag nyid las thos pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de dag nyid las thos pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: This does not apply to what is learned from them.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rig pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rig pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The designation of the Dharma, the designation of the truths, the designation of knowledge, and the designation of the vehicles.

original: de la mdo'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po go rims bzhin du sbyor ba dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag cing bsdebs pa gang yin pa 'di ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la mdo'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po go rims bzhin du sbyor ba dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag cing bsdebs pa gang yin pa 'di ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The classification of the teaching is the twelve branches of the scriptures, such as verse, prose, etc., which are arranged in order and combined.

original: bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam par du mar yod de /
analyzed: bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam par du mar yod de /
translated: The classification of the truth is manifold.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis ni bden pa gcig kho na ste gnyis su med do //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis ni bden pa gcig kho na ste gnyis su med do //
translated: From the point of view of non-error, there is only one truth, not two.

original: bden pa rnam pa gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of the two truths, there are two truths: the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: bden pa rnam @153b pa gsum ni /
analyzed: bden pa rnam @153b pa gsum ni /
translated: From the point of view of the three truths, there are three truths:

original: mtshan nyid kyi bden pa dang / ngag gi bden pa dang / bya ba'i bden pa'o //🔽bden pa rnam pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi bden pa dang / ngag gi bden pa dang / bya ba'i bden pa'o // bden pa rnam pa bzhi ni /
translated: the truth of characteristics, the truth of words, and the truth of action.

original: sdu bsngal gyi bden pa nas /
analyzed: sdu bsngal gyi bden pa nas /
translated: From the point of view of the four truths, there are four truths:

original: lam gyi bden pa'i bar dag go //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i bar dag go //
translated: the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: bden pa rnam pa lnga ni rgyu'i bden pa dang / 'bras bu'i bden pa dang / shes pa'i bden pa dang / shes bya'i bden pa dang / mchog gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa lnga ni rgyu'i bden pa dang / 'bras bu'i bden pa dang / shes pa'i bden pa dang / shes bya'i bden pa dang / mchog gi bden pa'o //
translated: The five kinds of truth are: the truth of cause, the truth of effect, the truth of knowledge, the truth of the object of knowledge, and the supreme truth.

original: bden pa rnam pa drug ni /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa drug ni /
translated: The six kinds of truth are:

original: bden pa'i bden pa dang / brdzun pa'i bden pa dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i bden pa dang / spang bar bya ba'i bden pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i bden pa dang / bsgom par bya ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i bden pa dang / brdzun pa'i bden pa dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i bden pa dang / spang bar bya ba'i bden pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i bden pa dang / bsgom par bya ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of truth, the truth of falsehood, the truth of thorough knowledge, the truth of abandonment, the truth of realization, and the truth of cultivation.

original: bden pa rnam pa bdun ni ro myong ba'i bden pa dang / nyes dmigs kyi bden pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / chos nyid kyi bden pa dang / mos pa'i bden pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa dang /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa bdun ni ro myong ba'i bden pa dang / nyes dmigs kyi bden pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / chos nyid kyi bden pa dang / mos pa'i bden pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa dang /
translated: The seven kinds of truth are: the truth of experience, the truth of disadvantage, the truth of liberation, the truth of reality, the truth of devotion, the truth of the noble ones, and

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of the non-noble ones.

original: bden pa rnam pa brgyad ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / 'jug pa'i bden pa dang / ldog pa'i bden pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bden pa dang /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa brgyad ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / 'jug pa'i bden pa dang / ldog pa'i bden pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bden pa dang /
translated: The eight kinds of truth are: the truth of the suffering of conditioned existence, the truth of the suffering of change, the truth of the suffering of suffering, the truth of engagement, the truth of disengagement, the truth of affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba'i bden pa dang / yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i bden pa dang / yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of purification, and the truth of right practice.

original: bden pa rnam pa dgu ni ;
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa dgu ni ;
translated: The nine kinds of truth are:

original: mi rtag pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i bden pa dang / stong pa'i bden pa dang / bdag med pa'i bden pa'i dang / 'byung ba sred pa'i bden pa dang / de spang ba'i thabs kyi bden pa dang / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bden pa dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i bden pa dang / stong pa'i bden pa dang / bdag med pa'i bden pa'i dang / 'byung ba sred pa'i bden pa dang / de spang ba'i thabs kyi bden pa dang / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bden pa dang /
translated: the truth of impermanence, the truth of suffering, the truth of emptiness, the truth of selflessness, the truth of craving for existence, the truth of the means of abandoning that, the truth of nirvāṇa with remainder of aggregates,

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: and the truth of nirvāṇa without remainder of aggregates.

original: bden pa rnam pa bcu ni /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa bcu ni /
translated: The ten kinds of truth are:

original: gnod pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / long spyod dang mi ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / khams ma snyoms pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / sdug pa 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal pa dang /
analyzed: gnod pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / long spyod dang mi ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / khams ma snyoms pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / sdug pa 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal pa dang /
translated: the truth of suffering that arises from harm, the truth of suffering that arises from lack of resources, the truth of suffering that arises from imbalance of the elements, the truth of suffering that arises from change of what is dear, the truth of suffering that arises from the appropriation of what is unwholesome,

original: las kyi bden pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bden pa dang / de bzhin du thos pa tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i bden pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'i bden pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'i 'bras bu'i bden @154a * //
analyzed: las kyi bden pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bden pa dang / de bzhin du thos pa tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i bden pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'i bden pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'i 'bras bu'i bden @154a * //
translated: the truth of karma, the truth of afflictions, and likewise the truth of listening and proper mental activity, the truth of right view, and the truth of the result of right view.

original: pa ste ; 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ste ; 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas' presentation of the designation of truths.

original: de'i rnam par dbye ba ni tshad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dbye ba ni tshad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Its divisions should be understood as immeasurable.

original: rig pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: rig pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges are:

original: rig pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rig pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the presentation of the designation of knowledge.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Their classification should be understood as above.

original: theg pa gsum po dag las /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po dag las /
translated: The vehicles are the three vehicles:🔽the sravaka vehicle, the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and the universal vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po dag ni re re yang rnam pa bdun bdun gyis gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po dag ni re re yang rnam pa bdun bdun gyis gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The establishment of the designation of the vehicles is the establishment of the designation of each of the three vehicles as sevenfold.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag las shes rab gang yin pa dang / shes rab de nyid kyi rten dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang / tshogs gang yin pa dang / shes rab de nyid kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag las shes rab gang yin pa dang / shes rab de nyid kyi rten dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang / tshogs gang yin pa dang / shes rab de nyid kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
translated: The wisdom that is one of the four noble truths, the basis, objective, companion, activity, and collection of that wisdom, and the result of that wisdom.

original: rnam pa bdun po 'di mtha' dag gis nyan thos kyi theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun po 'di mtha' dag gis nyan thos kyi theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the establishment of the designation of the sravaka vehicle is by means of all of these seven aspects.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag thos kyi theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag thos kyi theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The exposition of the designation of the vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas is similar to the exposition of the designation of the vehicle as it has been presented in the Sūtras.

original: brjod du med pa'i dngos po la dmigs par byas nas /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i dngos po la dmigs par byas nas /
translated: Having taken as object the inexpressible thing,

original: chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa mnyam pa nyid las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa dang / shes rab de nyid kyi rten dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang tshogs gang yin pa dang / shes rab de nyid kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa mnyam pa nyid las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa dang / shes rab de nyid kyi rten dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang tshogs gang yin pa dang / shes rab de nyid kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa dang /
translated: the wisdom which arises from the suchness of all dharmas, the non-discrimination of sameness, and the wisdom itself, its basis, its object, its friend, its action, its accumulation, and its result,

original: rnam pa bdun po 'di dag gis theg pa chen po'i gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'ang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun po 'di dag gis theg pa chen po'i gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'ang rig par bya'o //
translated: by means of these seven aspects, the exposition of the designation of the Great Vehicle should be understood.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang ; da ltar byung ba'i dus dag na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang ; da ltar byung ba'i dus dag na /
translated: In the past, the future, and the present,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad kyis dngos po bzhi po 'di dag gis yang dag par gdags pa rnam par gzhag par rig par byas shing byed par 'gyur la byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad kyis dngos po bzhi po 'di dag gis yang dag par gdags pa rnam par gzhag par rig par byas shing byed par 'gyur la byed de /
translated: present, and future, establish the designation of the four things in this way,

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: and no other way.🔽There is nothing higher than this,

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: nothing greater than this.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su btsal ba'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su btsal ba'i dngos po yin te /
translated: These four are the things to be sought by bodhisattvas in order to understand all things as they really are:

original: ming yongs su tshol ba dang / dngos po yongs su tshol ba dang / ngo bo nyid du'ang gdags pa yongs su tshol ba dang / bye brag tu @154b gdags pa yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: ming yongs su tshol ba dang / dngos po yongs su tshol ba dang / ngo bo nyid du'ang gdags pa yongs su tshol ba dang / bye brag tu @154b gdags pa yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: the search for names, the search for things, the search for the designation of essence, and the search for the designation of the distinctions.

original: 'di rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Their divisions are as follows:

original: de kho na'i don gyi le'u las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi le'u las rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood from the chapter on the meaning of reality.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: These four are the bodhisattvas' correct understanding of all phenomena.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽ming yongs su tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / dngos po yongs su tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid du gdags pa yongs su tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / ming yongs su tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / dngos po yongs su tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid du gdags pa yongs su tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: What are the four?

original: bye brag gdags pa yongs su tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste /🔽'di dag gi rnam par dbye ba yang snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bye brag gdags pa yongs su tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste / 'di dag gi rnam par dbye ba yang snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: Correct understanding of the investigation of names, correct understanding of the investigation of things, correct understanding of the investigation of essences, and correct understanding of the investigation of specific instances.

original: de kho na'i don gyi le'u las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi le'u las rig par bya'o //
translated: The analysis of these should be understood as above, in the chapter on the meaning of reality.

original: dpag tu med pa lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad la mkhas par byed par 'gyur ba ste ;
analyzed: dpag tu med pa lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad la mkhas par byed par 'gyur ba ste ;
translated: These five immeasurables are the means by which bodhisattvas become skilled in all things.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dang / chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa dang / 'dul ba'i khams dpag tu med pa dang / 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dang / chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa dang / 'dul ba'i khams dpag tu med pa dang / 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable realm of sentient beings, the immeasurable realm of worlds, the immeasurable realm of phenomena, the immeasurable realm of those to be trained, and the immeasurable realm of methods of training.

original: de la sems can gyi khams ni sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sems can gyi khams ni sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The realm of sentient beings refers to the sixty-four types of sentient beings.

original: yid kyis las 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: yid kyis las 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: They are like the mental activities.

original: rgyud kyi bye brag gis ni dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi bye brag gis ni dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable due to the differences in their mindstreams.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams ni phyogs bcu dag tu dpag tu med cing ming yang dpag tu med de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams ni phyogs bcu dag tu dpag tu med cing ming yang dpag tu med de /
translated: The realm of worlds refers to the immeasurable worlds in the ten directions, and their names are also immeasurable.

original: dper na 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams mi mdzad de /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams mi mdzad de /
translated: For example, this is the world system called Saha.

original: de'i ming las mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i ming las mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Its name is derived from the name of its lord, the Brahma of the Saha world.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //🔽sems can thams cad 'dul ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis dpag tu med par rig par bya'o // sems can thams cad 'dul ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate factors should be understood as immeasurable in terms of the mode of their classification.

original: 'dul ba ni gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The Vinaya is one in terms of the discipline of all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyang yod de //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyang yod de //
translated: It is also twofold:

original: mtha' dag gis bcings pa dang / mtha' dag ma yin pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag gis bcings pa dang / mtha' dag ma yin pas bcings pa'o //
translated: bound by the whole and bound by a part.

original: rnam pa gsum yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum yang yod de /
translated: It is also threefold:

original: dbang po rtul po dang / dbang po 'bring dang / dbang po rnon po'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po dang / dbang po 'bring dang / dbang po rnon po'o //
translated: of dull faculties, middling faculties, and sharp faculties.

original: rnam pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ni /
translated: It is also fourfold:

original: rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs so //
analyzed: rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs so //
translated: the kṣatriya, the brāhmaṇa, the vaiśya, and the śūdra.

original: rnam pa lnga ni 'dod chags spyod @155a * //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni 'dod chags spyod @155a * //
translated: It is also fivefold:

original: pa dang ; zhe sdang spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa dang / nga rgyal spyod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang ; zhe sdang spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa dang / nga rgyal spyod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa spyod pa'o //
translated: the one who practices with passion, the one who practices with aversion, the one who practices with delusion, the one who practices with pride, and the one who practices with discursive thought.

original: rnam pa drug ni khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba dang / yongs su ma smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa drug ni khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba dang / yongs su ma smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba'o //
translated: The six types are: householders, those gone forth, those not fully matured, those fully matured, those liberated, and those not liberated.

original: rnam pa bdun ni zhe 'gras pa dang / tha mal pa dang / spros pas shes pa dang / mgo glengs pas shes pa dang / de'i mod la 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang / phyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang / rkyen las gyur pa'i 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun ni zhe 'gras pa dang / tha mal pa dang / spros pas shes pa dang / mgo glengs pas shes pa dang / de'i mod la 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang / phyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang / rkyen las gyur pa'i 'dul ba ste /
translated: The seven types are: those who are hostile, those who are neutral, those who understand through elaboration, those who understand through a brief introduction, those who are disciplined immediately, those who are disciplined later, and those who are disciplined through conditions.

original: rkyen ji lta bu dang phrad pa de lta de ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen ji lta bu dang phrad pa de lta de ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are disciplined in accordance with the conditions they encounter.

original: rnam pa brgyad ni 'khor brgyad de /🔽rgyal rigs kyi 'khor la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad ni 'khor brgyad de / rgyal rigs kyi 'khor la sogs pa nas /
translated: The eight types are the eight assemblies:

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor gyi bar dag go //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor gyi bar dag go //
translated: the assembly of nobles, the assembly of brahmins, the assembly of householders, the assembly of ascetics, the assembly of gods of the desire realm, the assembly of gods of the form realm, the assembly of Māra, and the assembly of Brahmā.

original: rnam pa dgu ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba dang / byang chub sems dpas 'dul ba dang / bsgrub par dka' ba dang / bsgrub par sla ba dang / 'jam por bsgrub par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba dang / byang chub sems dpas 'dul ba dang / bsgrub par dka' ba dang / bsgrub par sla ba dang / 'jam por bsgrub par bya ba dang /
translated: Nine types of sentient beings are to be disciplined: those disciplined by the Tathāgata, those disciplined by śrāvakas, those disciplined by pratyekabuddhas, those disciplined by bodhisattvas, those disciplined with difficulty, those disciplined with ease, those disciplined with gentleness,

original: tshar gcad pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / rgyang ring po nas 'dul ba dang / drung nas 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: tshar gcad pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / rgyang ring po nas 'dul ba dang / drung nas 'dul ba'o //
translated: those disciplined with severity, and those disciplined from afar.

original: rnam pa bcu ni sems can dmyal pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang / mi dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni sems can dmyal pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang / mi dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang /
translated: Ten types of sentient beings are to be disciplined: those in the hells, those in the animal world, those in the world of Yama, those in the desire realm, those in the form realm, those in the formless realm,

original: 'du shes can dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes can yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes can dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes can yang ma yin /
translated: those with discernment, those without discernment,

original: 'du shes can ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes can ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: those neither with nor without discernment.

original: 'di yang rnam pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: This is also classified in fifty-five types.

original: rgyud kyi rab tu dbye bas ni tshad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rab tu dbye bas ni tshad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The divisions of the tantras should be understood as immeasurable.

original: de la sems can gyi khams dang / 'dul ba'i khams la tha dad du du bya ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la sems can gyi khams dang / 'dul ba'i khams la tha dad du du bya ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the realm of sentient beings and the realm of those to be trained?

original: rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa'i sems can thams cad ni sems can gyi khams su bye brag med do //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa'i sems can thams cad ni sems can gyi khams su bye brag med do //
translated: All sentient beings, whether they are in the lineage or not, are not distinguished in the realm of sentient beings.

original: rigs la gnas pa gnas skabs de dang de dag tu gnas pa gang dag yin pa de ni 'dul ba'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa gnas skabs de dang de dag tu gnas pa gang dag yin pa de ni 'dul ba'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are in the lineage and abide in those states are called the realm of those to be trained.

original: 'dul ba'i thabs ni sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i thabs ni sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The means of training should be understood as previously explained.

original: de yang rnam par dbye bas dpag tu med de //
analyzed: de yang rnam par dbye bas dpag tu med de //
translated: Moreover, it is immeasurable due to its divisions.

original: de dag bsdus na dpag tu med pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bsdus na dpag tu med pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: When summarized, it becomes five immeasurable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di na byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang dag gi don la sbyor ba de ni /
analyzed: 'di na byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang dag gi don la sbyor ba de ni /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva's application for the sake of sentient beings

original: @155b dpag tu med pa dang po'o //
analyzed: @155b dpag tu med pa dang po'o //
translated: is the first immeasurable.

original: sems can de dag gang la gnas pa yang dmigs pa de ni dpag tu med pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag gang la gnas pa yang dmigs pa de ni dpag tu med pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The object of those sentient beings is the second immeasurability.

original: sems can de dag 'jig rten gyi khams de dang de dag na chos gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag par gyur pa dmigs pa de ni dpag tu med pa gsum pa'o //🔽sems can de dag gi nang nas sems can gang dag skal ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: sems can de dag 'jig rten gyi khams de dang de dag na chos gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag par gyur pa dmigs pa de ni dpag tu med pa gsum pa'o // sems can de dag gi nang nas sems can gang dag skal ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: The phenomena by which those sentient beings are defiled and purified in those world-realms is the third immeasurability.

original: gtan du sdug bsngal las rnam par thar par byed nus par mthong ba de ni dpag tu med pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gtan du sdug bsngal las rnam par thar par byed nus par mthong ba de ni dpag tu med pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Among those sentient beings, those who are seen to be fortunate and able to be liberated from suffering forever are the fourth immeasurability.

original: sems can de dag nyid rnam par thar par bya ba'i thabs gang yin pa de ni dpag tu med pa lnga pa'o ;
analyzed: sems can de dag nyid rnam par thar par bya ba'i thabs gang yin pa de ni dpag tu med pa lnga pa'o ;
translated: The means by which those sentient beings are liberated is the fifth immeasurability.

original: ; de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dpag tu med pa lnga po de dag ni thams cad la mkhas par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ; de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dpag tu med pa lnga po de dag ni thams cad la mkhas par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, these five immeasurabilities of the bodhisattvas lead to expertise in all things.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These five should be known as the extensive benefits of the result of the teaching of the Dharma by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas to sentient beings.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: Some sentient beings, at the very time of the teaching of the holy Dharma,

original: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: generate the eye of Dharma with regard to phenomena, free from dust and uncontaminated.

original: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i mod la zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i mod la zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Some sentient beings, at the very time of the teaching of the holy Dharma, attain the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: ; de dag las sems can kha cig na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: ; de dag las sems can kha cig na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
translated: Some sentient beings generate the mind of unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos thos pa de nyid kyi mod la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos thos pa de nyid kyi mod la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some sentient beings, at the very time of hearing the holy Dharma, attain the supreme acceptance of the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dam pa'i chos bstan pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dam pa'i chos bstan pas /
translated: The Dharma is taught by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: It is transmitted by means of the oral transmission, recitation, and correct practice,

original: dam pa'i chos kyi tshul yun ring du gnas par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi tshul yun ring du gnas par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: and in this way the way of the holy Dharma remains for a long time.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These five should be known as the great benefits of the result of teaching.

original: chen po bdun po 'di dag ni gang dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa la theg pa chen po zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: chen po bdun po 'di dag ni gang dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa la theg pa chen po zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: There are seven greatnesses, endowed with which the vehicle of the bodhisattvas is called the Great Vehicle.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: chos chen po ni 'di lta ste /🔽gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las 'byung ba'i @156a * //
analyzed: chos chen po ni 'di lta ste / gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las 'byung ba'i @156a * //
translated: The greatness of Dharma is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod shin tu rgyas pa'i sde'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod shin tu rgyas pa'i sde'o //
translated: It is the bodhisattva canon, the vaipulya section, which occurs in the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: sems bskyed pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The greatness of generating the spirit is as follows.

original: 'ga' zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par zad pa'o //
translated: Some of them generate the thought of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: mos pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mos pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Great devotion is as follows:

original: 'ga' zhig ni chos chen po de nyid la mos par zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni chos chen po de nyid la mos par zad pa'o //
translated: Some of them are devoted to that very great Dharma.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Great superior attitude is as follows:

original: 'ga' zhig gis mos pas spyod pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis mos pas spyod pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Some of them, having transcended the stage of devoted engagement,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug par zad do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug par zad do //
translated: enter the stage of pure superior attitude.

original: tshogs chen po ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs gang yang dag par 'grub pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs chen po ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs gang yang dag par 'grub pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The great collection is the collection of merit and the collection of wisdom, which are accomplished in order to fully awaken to unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: dus chen po ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum po gang yin pa'i dus des /
analyzed: dus chen po ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum po gang yin pa'i dus des /
translated: The great time is the time of the three incalculable aeons,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
translated: by which time one will fully awaken to unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa chen po ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa chen po ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: The great perfect realization is supreme enlightenment.

original: sku yang dag par 'grub pa de la ni lus yang dag par 'grub pa gzhan mtshungs pa yang med na /🔽gong du phyin pa lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: sku yang dag par 'grub pa de la ni lus yang dag par 'grub pa gzhan mtshungs pa yang med na / gong du phyin pa lta ga la yod de /
translated: There is no other perfect realization of the body that is equal to that perfect realization of the body,🔽much less one that is higher.

original: lhag pa lta yang ga la yod /
analyzed: lhag pa lta yang ga la yod /
translated: How could there be one that is superior?

original: de la chos chen po gang yin pa dang / sems bskyed pa chen po gang yin pa dang / mos pa chen po gang yin pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po gang yin pa dang / tshogs chen po gang yin pa dang / dus chen po gang yin pa dang /🔽chen po drug po 'di dag ni yang dag par 'grub pa chen po'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de la chos chen po gang yin pa dang / sems bskyed pa chen po gang yin pa dang / mos pa chen po gang yin pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po gang yin pa dang / tshogs chen po gang yin pa dang / dus chen po gang yin pa dang / chen po drug po 'di dag ni yang dag par 'grub pa chen po'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: In this context, the great Dharma, the great generation of the mind of enlightenment, the great aspiration, the great superior intention, the great collection, the great time,🔽and the great result are the causes of the great perfect realization.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa chen po de dag gcig pa ni drug po de dag gi 'bras bu'i gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa chen po de dag gcig pa ni drug po de dag gi 'bras bu'i gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The great perfect realization is the basis of the result of those six great factors.

original: chos brgyad po 'di dag ni theg pa chen po thams cad sdud par byed pa ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod de nyid du chos thams cad kyi de kho na'i don bstan pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod de nyid du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab cing mchog tu rgya che ba bstan pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: chos brgyad po 'di dag ni theg pa chen po thams cad sdud par byed pa ste / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod de nyid du chos thams cad kyi de kho na'i don bstan pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod de nyid du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab cing mchog tu rgya che ba bstan pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: These eight topics comprise the entire Great Vehicle.

original: de tshul bzhin du nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin du sems pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams su blang ba gang yin pa dang / @156b lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams su blang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i bsgom pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: de tshul bzhin du nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin du sems pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams su blang ba gang yin pa dang / @156b lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams su blang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i bsgom pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa dang /
translated: The first is the teaching of the Bodhisattva Canon, the second is the teaching in the Bodhisattva Canon of the meaning of reality of all phenomena, the third is the teaching in the Bodhisattva Canon of the inconceivable, supreme, vast power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the fourth is listening properly to the teachings, the fifth is practicing the superior intention preceded by proper reflection, the sixth is the practice of meditation preceded by the superior intention, the seventh is the practice of the superior intention preceded by the practice of meditation, and the eighth is the practice of the superior intention preceded by the practice of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa de nyid kyis gtan du nges par 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa de nyid kyis gtan du nges par 'byin pa ste /
translated: The accomplishment of the result of meditation, preceded by the practice of meditation, and the definitive release by means of that very accomplishment of the result of meditation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob pa rnams ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob pa rnams ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who train in that way will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag de ltar slob na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag de ltar slob na /
translated: What are the bodhisattvas who train in that way?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dag gang zhe na /
translated: Those who train in that way will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de dag ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, they should be known as being of ten types.

original: rigs la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa dang / bsam pa ma dag pa dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / yongs su ma smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / nges par zhugs pa ma yin pa dang / nges par zhugs pa dang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang /🔽srid pa tha ma pa'o //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa dang / bsam pa ma dag pa dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / yongs su ma smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / nges par zhugs pa ma yin pa dang / nges par zhugs pa dang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattva who is established in the spiritual lineage, the one who has entered, the one whose intention is impure, the one whose intention is pure, the one who is not fully matured, the one who is fully matured, the one who has not attained the certainty of a bodhisattva, the one who has attained the certainty of a bodhisattva, the one who is impeded by only one birth, and the one who is in his final existence.

original: de la rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' slob pa na sems skyed par byed pa de ni zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' slob pa na sems skyed par byed pa de ni zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the spiritual lineage and who is still a spiritual beginner is called “one who has entered”.

original: zhugs pa de nyid ji srid du bsam pa dag pa'i sa la ma zhugs pa de srid du ni bsam pa ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa de nyid ji srid du bsam pa dag pa'i sa la ma zhugs pa de srid du ni bsam pa ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who has entered is called “one whose intention is impure” for as long as he has not entered the spiritual level whose intention is pure.

original: zhugs pa ni bsam pa dag pa yin no//
analyzed: zhugs pa ni bsam pa dag pa yin no//
translated: The one whose intention is pure is called “one who has entered”.

original: zhugs pa ni yongs su smin pa yin no //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni yongs su smin pa yin no //

analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa de yang ji srid du nges pa dang / spyod pa nges pa'i sa la nges par ma zhugs pa de srid du ni ma nges pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: Moreover, that which is not fully matured is called “uncertain” for as long as one has not entered the stage of certainty and the stage of certain conduct.

original: ; zhugs pa ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ; zhugs pa ni nges pa yin no //
translated: But when one has entered, it is called “certain.”

original: yongs su smin pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /

translated: that which is separated by one birth is that which will fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment in the next life; and that which is in the final life is that which will fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment while still in this life.

translated: The ten types of bodhisattvas that have been presented, from the lineage up to the stage of the tenth level, are the ones who train in the bodhisattva trainings.

original: la slob pa de dag gi bslab pa ni gang la slob pa dang / ji ltar slob pa de las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: la slob pa de dag gi bslab pa ni gang la slob pa dang / ji ltar slob pa de las gong na yang med do //

original: de las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: de las lhag pa yang med do //

translated: There are no bodhisattvas higher than those bodhisattvas who have been presented in this way and who train in the bodhisattva trainings.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyi ming dbyer med pa 'di lta bu 'di dag ni yon tan las btags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyi ming dbyer med pa 'di lta bu 'di dag ni yon tan las btags par rig par bya ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa ma yin no //

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes khas 'che bar gnas la byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams la yang legs par slob pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //

analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

analyzed: snying brtse ba dang / snyan par smra ba dang / brtan pa dang / lag rkyong @157b ba dang ; don dang dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'o //
translated: They are: compassion, pleasant speech, steadfastness, openhandedness, and the ability to explain the profound meaning.

analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag ni lngar bsgre bar rig par bya ste /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon dang / go rims dang bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: de la snying brtse ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: bsam par gtogs pa dang / sgrub par gtogs pa'o //
