analyzed: sbyin pa la byed pa ni 'di la byang chub sems dpa' @160b sbyin pas yongs su skyob med par rtag tu rgyun mi 'chang pa kho nar dus thams cad du sbyin par bya ba'i ci ba dog pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is this. The practice in regard to generosity is that a bodhisattva always gives gifts at all times without fail, without being stingy about the things to be given.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i kha na ma tho ba med par byed pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i kha na ma tho ba med par byed pa ji lta bu yin zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is a bodhisattva's practice free of demerit?

original: sbyin pa la byed pa ni 'di la byang chub sems dpa' kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sbyin pa sbyin pa'i le'u las bstan pa gang yin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa can de spangs na /
analyzed: sbyin pa la byed pa ni 'di la byang chub sems dpa' kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sbyin pa sbyin pa'i le'u las bstan pa gang yin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa can de spangs na /
translated: It is this. The practice in regard to generosity is that a bodhisattva, having abandoned the demerit that is taught in the chapter on generosity,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: He gives a gift that is not defiled.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva gives a gift that is

original: sbyin pa legs par sbyin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa legs par sbyin par byed pa yin no //
translated: well-given.

original: sbyin pa la ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la yang nges par byed pa dang / byang bar byed pa dang / rtag par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la yang nges par byed pa dang / byang bar byed pa dang / rtag par byed pa dang /
translated: Just as with generosity, so also with morality, patience, effort, meditative absorption, and wisdom, he is one who is determined, one who is skilled, one who is constant, and one who is not defiled.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: These four kinds of non-transgression should be understood as they are set forth in the sutra.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s skill?

original: de ni mdor bsdus na rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdus na rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as being of ten types.

original: sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi sdang ba bsal ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / tha mal pa rnams 'jug par bya ba dang / zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi sdang ba bsal ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / tha mal pa rnams 'jug par bya ba dang / zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang /
translated: They are skilled in the means to dispel the hostility of hostile beings, to engage ordinary beings, to bring those who have been engaged to full maturity, and to liberate those who have been brought to full maturity.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la /
translated: They are skilled in all worldly treatises and in the bodhisattva vows.

original: 'khrul pa byung ba la rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam la mkhas pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dang / theg pa chen po la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa byung ba la rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam la mkhas pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dang / theg pa chen po la mkhas pa ste /
translated: They are skilled in recognizing mistakes that occur in the practice of the bodhisattva vows, in making pure aspirations, in the vehicle of the hearers, in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and in the Great Vehicle.

original: mkhas pa 'di dag thams cad kyang snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: mkhas pa 'di dag thams cad kyang snga ma bzhin du /
translated: All of these skills are as described above.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba de dang / de dag las ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba de dang / de dag las ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: These ten masteries of the bodhisattva should be known as the five actions.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mkhas pa bcu po 'di dag ni bya ba lnga byed pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mkhas pa bcu po 'di dag ni bya ba lnga byed pa yin te /
translated: The first four masteries are the five actions of the wise bodhisattva.

original: mkhas pa gong ma bzhis ni byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams rang gi don la 'dzud do //
analyzed: mkhas pa gong ma bzhis ni byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams rang gi don la 'dzud do //
translated: By the first four masteries, the bodhisattva engages sentient beings in their own aim.🔽By mastery of the treatises, the bodhisattva engages sentient beings in their own aim.🔽By mastery of the mundane and transcendent arts, the bodhisattva engages sentient beings in their own aim.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pas ni byang chub sems dpas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad zil gyis gnon @161a * //🔽par byed do //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la 'khrul pa byung ba la rtog pa la mkhas pas ni byang chub sems dpas nyes pa mi 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas pas ni byang chub sems dpas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad zil gyis gnon @161a * // par byed do // byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la 'khrul pa byung ba la rtog pa la mkhas pas ni byang chub sems dpas nyes pa mi 'byung ba'am /
translated: By mastery of all the mundane sciences, the bodhisattva overwhelms all adversaries.

original: nyes pa byung na yang chos bzhin du phyir 'chos par byed cing /
analyzed: nyes pa byung na yang chos bzhin du phyir 'chos par byed cing /
translated: By mastery of the bodhisattva vow of morality, the bodhisattva does not commit errors or, if he does err, he restores his vow according to the teaching.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa shin tu yongs su dag pa srung bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa shin tu yongs su dag pa srung bar byed do //
translated: He also keeps the vows of moral discipline that he has taken very pure.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in right aspiration

original: byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma la 'dod pa'i don thams cad 'grub par 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma la 'dod pa'i don thams cad 'grub par 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: ensures that a bodhisattva will accomplish all his desired goals in the future.🔽Skill in the three vehicles

original: theg pa gsum la mkhas pas ni byang chub sems dpas rigs dang / dbang po dang ; mos pa ji lta ba rnams la de dang mthun par chos ston cing /
analyzed: theg pa gsum la mkhas pas ni byang chub sems dpas rigs dang / dbang po dang ; mos pa ji lta ba rnams la de dang mthun par chos ston cing /
translated: means that a bodhisattva teaches the Dharma in accord with the spiritual genes, faculties, and aspirations of those to be trained.

original: 'tsham pa dang / rigs par ston te /
analyzed: 'tsham pa dang / rigs par ston te /
translated: He teaches appropriately and reasonably.

original: de ltar na mkhas pa bcu po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpas bya ba lnga byed de /🔽de'i bya ba lnga po de dag gis tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don las brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar na mkhas pa bcu po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpas bya ba lnga byed de / de'i bya ba lnga po de dag gis tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don las brtsams te /
translated: Thus, through these ten skills, a bodhisattva performs five actions.

original: bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through these five actions, all his actions are completed, beginning with the aims of this life and the next.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s helpful activity?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa rnams la brten nas de dag las sems can kha cig la ni phan pa nye bar sgrub pa bde bar yang nye bar sgrub /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa rnams la brten nas de dag las sems can kha cig la ni phan pa nye bar sgrub pa bde bar yang nye bar sgrub /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, by means of the four social practices—generosity, agreeable speech, beneficial activity, and sameness of purpose—provides benefit and happiness for some beings,

original: phan pa dang bde ba yang nye bar sgrub ste /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba yang nye bar sgrub ste /
translated: provides both benefit and happiness for others,🔽and provides neither benefit nor happiness for still others.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan la phan 'dogs pa mdor bstan pa'o //🔽rgyas par bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan la phan 'dogs pa mdor bstan pa'o // rgyas par bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the brief teaching on the bodhisattvas’ altruistic practice.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las rig par bya'o ;
translated: The extensive teaching should be understood as it is described in the chapter on the practice of altruism.

original: ; de la byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su bsngo ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ; de la byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su bsngo ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ dedication?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yang bsags so cog de dag thams cad snying thag pa nas dad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i 'bras bu rnam par
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yang bsags so cog de dag thams cad snying thag pa nas dad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i 'bras bu rnam par
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, by means of these three doors of good works, skill, and benefiting others, completely dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment with a sincere faith all the roots of virtue that have been, will be, and are being gathered in the past, future, and present.

original: smin pa gzhan mi 'dod de /
analyzed: smin pa gzhan mi 'dod de /
translated: He does not desire any other maturation of the fruit of those roots of virtue.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kho na 'dod do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kho na 'dod do //
translated: He desires only unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: @161b bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams kyi bslab pa'i chos bstan pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: @161b bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams kyi bslab pa'i chos bstan pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la zhugs pa dang /
translated: Whatever the Blessed One has taught as the rules of training for the bodhisattvas, whether lay or ordained, all of them are included in the three—ethics, meditation, and wisdom.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bzhi po 'di dag tu bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bzhi po 'di dag tu bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever the Blessed One has taught as the precepts for training of the bodhisattvas, whether householders or those gone forth, all of that is included in these four: good works, skill, engaging in benefiting others,🔽and dedication.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ltar las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la zhugs pa dang / yongs su sngo bar byed pa la ni 'di ltar 'thob par dka' zhing rtogs par dka' ba'i byang chub kyang nye bar gyur cing /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ltar las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la zhugs pa dang / yongs su sngo bar byed pa la ni 'di ltar 'thob par dka' zhing rtogs par dka' ba'i byang chub kyang nye bar gyur cing /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva who is thus engaged in good works, skill, benefiting others, and dedication should know that even enlightenment, which is difficult to attain and difficult to realize, is near,

original: yang dag par nye bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par nye bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: and is truly near.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang su yang rung ba de dag thams cad kyis khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs rnams la bslab nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang su yang rung ba de dag thams cad kyis khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs rnams la bslab nas /
translated: All bodhisattvas, whether lay or ordained, should train in these four dharmas.

original: chos bzhi po de dag kho nas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus dag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas /
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag kho nas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus dag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas /
translated: In the past, present, and future, only by means of these four dharmas have bodhisattvas fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: They will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: They are fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: de ltar chos bzhi po de dag las byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba dag yang dag par sbyor du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar chos bzhi po de dag las byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba dag yang dag par sbyor du zin kyang /
translated: Thus, although lay and ordained bodhisattvas may correctly engage in these four dharmas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa bas /
translated: compared to a lay bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni shin tu bye brag cher 'phags pa dang / shin tu khyad che bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni shin tu bye brag cher 'phags pa dang / shin tu khyad che bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has gone forth should be known as very superior and very exalted.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni thog ma kho nar pha ma dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pa bu smad yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyes pa las yongs su grol ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni thog ma kho nar pha ma dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pa bu smad yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyes pa las yongs su grol ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has gone forth is first of all completely free from the fault of possessing a wife, children, and so on, such as a mother, father, and so on.

original: khyim pa ni yongs su ma grol bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa ni yongs su ma grol bar rig par bya'o //
translated: But the householder is not completely free.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni yongs su bzung ba de dag nyid kyi don du zhing las dang ; nyo tshong dang / rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par chags pa'i sdug bsngal ba rnams las yongs su grol ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni yongs su bzung ba de dag nyid kyi don du zhing las dang ; nyo tshong dang / rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par chags pa'i sdug bsngal ba rnams las yongs su grol ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva who has gone forth is completely free from the suffering of affliction and attachment due to farming, commerce, service to the king, and so on, for the sake of those very possessions.

original: khyim pa ni yongs su ma grol ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa ni yongs su ma grol ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: But the householder is not completely free.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni tshangs bar spyod pa gcig @162a * //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni tshangs bar spyod pa gcig @162a * //
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva who is a renunciate is one who practices pure conduct.🔽

original: tu nges par lu gu rgyud bzhin du brtan par spyod nus kyi /
analyzed: tu nges par lu gu rgyud bzhin du brtan par spyod nus kyi /
translated: Moreover, the ordained bodhisattva is able to practice celibacy with a single definite purpose, like a string of beads.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas ni mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas ni mi nus so //
translated: But the bodhisattva who is a householder is not able to do that.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la mngon par shes pa myur ba yin te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la mngon par shes pa myur ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the ordained bodhisattva is quick in his superknowledges with regard to all the factors of awakening.

original: dge ba gang dang gang rtsom pa de dang de nyid la myur ba myur bar mthar phyin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dge ba gang dang gang rtsom pa de dang de nyid la myur ba myur bar mthar phyin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever virtue he undertakes, he quickly brings it to completion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa ni de lta ma yin no //🔽yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni brtul zhugs la nges par gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa ni de lta ma yin no // yang byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni brtul zhugs la nges par gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: But the bodhisattva who is a householder is not like that.

original: gzhan dag la tshig btsun pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag la tshig btsun pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the ordained bodhisattva is trustworthy to others because he is firmly committed to his vows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But the bodhisattva who is a householder is not like that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba gnyis ni de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyis shin tu khyad cher zhugs par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las phyogs kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba gnyis ni de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyis shin tu khyad cher zhugs par rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las phyogs kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: The householder and ordained bodhisattvas should be understood as being very different from each other in terms of these and other such qualities.

original: // / bam po bcu bdun pa ;
analyzed: // / bam po bcu bdun pa ;
translated: This concludes the second chapter, on the spiritual levels, in this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.

original: sdom ni / sems can rnams la blo ldan gyi //
analyzed: sdom ni / sems can rnams la blo ldan gyi //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ love for sentient beings🔽is shown to be sevenfold,

original: mnyes gshin pa ni rnam bdun dang // de dag bsam pa bco lnga ste //
analyzed: mnyes gshin pa ni rnam bdun dang // de dag bsam pa bco lnga ste //
translated: with fifteen aspects,

original: bya ba bcu ni byed par bstan //
analyzed: bya ba bcu ni byed par bstan //
translated: and with ten activities.

original: sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun 'byung ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ love for sentient beings is sevenfold.

original: mnyes gshin pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni /
analyzed: mnyes gshin pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have this love

original: dge ba'i bsam pa can mchog tu dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam pa can mchog tu dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to have a virtuous attitude, the highest virtuous attitude.

original: mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven aspects of love?

original: 'jigs pa med pa dang / rigs pa dang / mi skyo ba dang / gsol ba ma btab pa dang / zang zing med pa dang / rgya che ba dang / mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa dang / rigs pa dang / mi skyo ba dang / gsol ba ma btab pa dang / zang zing med pa dang / rgya che ba dang / mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is fearless, reasonable, not discouraged, unsolicited, disinterested, vast, and equal.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni su la yang 'jigs pa'i phyir mnyes gshin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni su la yang 'jigs pa'i phyir mnyes gshin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A bodhisattva does not cultivate amiability out of fear of anyone.🔽He cultivates the agreeable conduct of body, speech, and mind which is pleasing, beneficial, and happy.

original: mthun pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yid du 'ong zhing phan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa kun du spyod par byed kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i mnyes gshin pa ;🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yid du 'ong zhing phan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa kun du spyod par byed kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i mnyes gshin pa ; 'di lta ste /
translated: A bodhisattva does not cultivate amiability through unreasonableness.

original: chos ma yin pa dang / 'dul ba ma yin pa dang / tshogs par kun du spyod par mi 'os pa gnas ma yin pa la 'dzud pa'i phyir 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang / 'dul ba ma yin pa dang / tshogs par kun du spyod par mi 'os pa gnas ma yin pa la 'dzud pa'i phyir 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: He does not cultivate amiability through what is contrary to the Dharma, contrary to the Vinaya, or improper conduct, or through engaging in what is not the basis.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni ci nas de dag gi don las brtsams la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni ci nas de dag gi don las brtsams la /
translated: A bodhisattva cultivates amiability in order to benefit sentient beings, in order to benefit himself and others, and in order to benefit and be at ease himself.

original: thams cad yongs su mi skyo bar de ltar sems can rnams la @162b mnyes gshin pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad yongs su mi skyo bar de ltar sems can rnams la @162b mnyes gshin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is always affectionate toward sentient beings without ever getting discouraged.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gsol ba ma btab par sems can rnams la mnyes gshin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gsol ba ma btab par sems can rnams la mnyes gshin pa yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva is affectionate toward sentient beings without being asked.

original: la la zhig gis gsol ba btab pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: la la zhig gis gsol ba btab pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not affectionate toward some because they have asked him to be.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis mnyes gshin pa yin gyi /🔽gzhan las lan du phan 'dogs su re ba'am /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis mnyes gshin pa yin gyi / gzhan las lan du phan 'dogs su re ba'am /
translated: He is affectionate with a mind free of material desires.🔽He does not expect any reward from others

original: tshe phyi ma la sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa la re ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa la re ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: or any pleasant karmic result in the future.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la rgyu med par mnyes gshin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la rgyu med par mnyes gshin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is affectionate toward sentient beings without any reason.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mnyes gshin pa de ni rgya che ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mnyes gshin pa de ni rgya che ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva’s affection is vast

original: chung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chung ba ma yin no //
translated: and not small.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can de dag las ji ltar gnod pa byed pa'i rnam pa thams cad dang phrad kyang spong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can de dag las ji ltar gnod pa byed pa'i rnam pa thams cad dang phrad kyang spong bar mi byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva does not abandon those sentient beings even if he encounters all the forms of harm from them.

original: bdag nyid la dga' dgur mi sdug par byed kyang srid kyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid la dga' dgur mi sdug par byed kyang srid kyi /
translated: Even if it is possible that they may not like themselves,

original: gzhan dag la ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang sdig pa byed par ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang sdig pa byed par ni mi 'dod de /
translated: they do not want to do anything bad to others by any means.

original: de ltar rgya che ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rgya che ba yin no //
translated: This is how it is extensive.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mnyes gshin pa de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang / de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa de ni sems can thams cad kho na la mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mnyes gshin pa de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang / de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa de ni sems can thams cad kho na la mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin gyi /
translated: That loving kindness of the bodhisattvas, which has such characteristics and such virtues, is the same for all sentient beings,

original: sems can gyi khams la nyi tshe ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams la nyi tshe ba ni ma yin te /
translated: not limited to the realm of sentient beings.

original: de ltar na mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i bsam pa can mchog tu dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i bsam pa can mchog tu dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas who have these seven kinds of loving kindness are said to have a virtuous intention, the highest virtuous intention.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nges par 'byed pa dang / dad pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nges par 'byed pa dang / dad pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's superior intention is the aspiration for the qualities of the Buddha, the discernment of the Dharma, the discernment of the truth, the discernment of faith, and the discernment of the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: These superior intentions of the bodhisattva should be understood in brief as fifteenfold.

original: bco lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bco lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fifteen?

original: mchog gi bsam pa dang / tshul khrims kyi bsam pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa dang / de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa dang / mthu'i bsam pa dang / phan pa'i bsam pa dang ; bde ba'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: mchog gi bsam pa dang / tshul khrims kyi bsam pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa dang / de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa dang / mthu'i bsam pa dang / phan pa'i bsam pa dang ; bde ba'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang /
translated: The superior intention of the highest, the superior intention of morality, the superior intention of the perfections, the superior intention of the meaning of reality, the superior intention of power, the superior intention of benefit, the superior intention of happiness, the superior intention of the ultimate, the superior intention of the unerring, the superior intention of the unattached, the superior intention of the unfettered, the superior intention of the unobscured, the superior intention of the unaddicted, the superior intention of the unregressing, and the superior intention of the irreversible.

original: brtan pa'i bsam pa dang / mi slu ba'i bsam pa dang / ma dag pa'i bsam pa dang / dag pa'i bsam pa dang / shin tu dag pa'i bsam pa dang / tshar gcad pa'i bsam pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam pa'o //🔽de la sangs rgyas dang / chos @163a * //
analyzed: brtan pa'i bsam pa dang / mi slu ba'i bsam pa dang / ma dag pa'i bsam pa dang / dag pa'i bsam pa dang / shin tu dag pa'i bsam pa dang / tshar gcad pa'i bsam pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam pa'o // de la sangs rgyas dang / chos @163a * //
translated: the steadfast intention, the non-deceptive intention, the impure intention, the pure intention, the very pure intention, the intention to destroy, and the innate intention.

original: dang ; dge 'dun dkon mchog rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni mchog gi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang ; dge 'dun dkon mchog rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni mchog gi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's superior intention toward the Jewels of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha is called the supreme intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention toward the bodhisattva's vow of morality is called the moral intention.

original: sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention to accomplish generosity, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom is called the transcendent intention.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa don dam pa chos kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa don dam pa chos kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention regarding the profound reality of the suchness of things, which is the selflessness of phenomena and of persons, is called the intention regarding the meaning of reality.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i mthu'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i mthu'am /
translated: The superior intention regarding the inconceivable power of the superknowledges of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni mthu'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni mthu'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or the power of their spontaneous accomplishment, is called the intention regarding power.

original: sems can rnams la dge ba nye bar sgrub par 'dod pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la dge ba nye bar sgrub par 'dod pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire to establish beings in virtue is called the intention to benefit.

original: sems can rnams la phan gdags pa nye bar sgrub par 'dod pa ni bde ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan gdags pa nye bar sgrub par 'dod pa ni bde ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire to establish beings in the attainment of benefit is called the intention to bring happiness.

original: sems can rnams la zang zing med pa'i sems dang sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i sems ni lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la zang zing med pa'i sems dang sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i sems ni lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire to establish beings in the absence of desire for material things and in the absence of desire for the ripening of affection is called the superior intention.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems gcig tu nges pa ni brtan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems gcig tu nges pa ni brtan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention that is definitely one-pointed for unexcelled, perfect enlightenment is called the “stable intention.”

original: sems can gyi don thabs dang / byang chub kyi thabs la phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa ni mi slu ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don thabs dang / byang chub kyi thabs la phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i mos pa ni mi slu ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The interest that is endowed with the knowledge that is unmistaken with regard to the means for accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings and enlightenment is called the “non-deceptive intention.”

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni ma dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni ma dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention of the bodhisattvas on all the stages of the practice of interest is called the “impure intention.”

original: bsam pa dag pa'i sa nas bzung ste /🔽spyod pa nges pa'i sa'i bar la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i sa nas bzung ste / spyod pa nges pa'i sa'i bar la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Beginning with the stage of pure superior intention,🔽up to the stage of certain conduct, the bodhisattvas’ superior intention is called the “pure intention.”

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni shin tu dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni shin tu dag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: On the stage that goes to the ultimate, the bodhisattvas’ superior intention is called the “extremely pure intention.”

original: de la ma dag pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de nyid ni tshar gcad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la ma dag pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de nyid ni tshar gcad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The superior attitude that is impure is called “to be eliminated”

original: so sor brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be examined.

original: dag pa dang / @163b shin tu dag pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dag pa dang / @163b shin tu dag pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The superior attitude that is pure and very pure is called “innate”

original: rang bzhin gyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / brten pa shin tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / brten pa shin tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is naturally that way and because it is well established.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mdor bsdu na lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas thams cad du gtogs pa bco lnga po 'di dag gis bya ba bcu byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mdor bsdu na lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas thams cad du gtogs pa bco lnga po 'di dag gis bya ba bcu byed de /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattvas, by means of their pure superior attitude, perform ten functions with these fifteen categories.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: mchog gi bsam pas ni dkon mchog la mchod pa byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa thams cad la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: mchog gi bsam pas ni dkon mchog la mchod pa byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa thams cad la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: With the superior attitude of the highest, they apply themselves to worship of the Three Jewels, which is the best of all the requisites for enlightenment.

original: tshul khrims kyi bsam pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la srog gi phyir yang bsams bzhin du nyes pa 'byung bar mi byed la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bsam pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la srog gi phyir yang bsams bzhin du nyes pa 'byung bar mi byed la /
translated: With the intention of morality, he does not intentionally commit a transgression even at the cost of his life, once he has taken up the bodhisattva vow of morality.

original: nyes pa byung na yang myur ba myur bar so sor 'chags par byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa byung na yang myur ba myur bar so sor 'chags par byed do //
translated: And if he does commit a transgression, he quickly confesses it.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pas ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa rtag tu byed pas bag yod par gnas shing mchog tu bag yod par gnas par byed do //🔽de kho na'i don gyi lhag pa'i bsam pas ni sems can gyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor bar yang byed la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pas ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa rtag tu byed pas bag yod par gnas shing mchog tu bag yod par gnas par byed do // de kho na'i don gyi lhag pa'i bsam pas ni sems can gyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor bar yang byed la /
translated: With the intention of the perfections, he practices the virtues that are their objects, and he is careful and most careful in their practice.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa mi gtong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa mi gtong bar yang byed do //
translated: With the intention of reality, he turns the wheel of the Dharma for the sake of beings, with a mind that is not at all defiled, and he does not abandon the intention of nirvana.

original: mthu'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni brtan pa la snying thag pa nas dad cing ston par yang byed la /
analyzed: mthu'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni brtan pa la snying thag pa nas dad cing ston par yang byed la /
translated: With the intention of power, he has deep faith in the steadfast, and he teaches.

original: bsgom pa la yang gces par 'dzin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa la yang gces par 'dzin te /
translated: He also cherishes meditation.

original: 'dod pa skyes pas shas cher gnas la /
analyzed: 'dod pa skyes pas shas cher gnas la /
translated: He is mostly intent on the arising of desire.

original: thos pa dang / bsam pa tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsam pa tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin to //
translated: He does not consider mere learning and reflection to be sufficient.

original: phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: With the intention of benefit, the intention of happiness, and the superior intention, he applies himself to all the aspects of working for the benefit of beings.

original: sbyor ba byas nas kyang yongs su mi skyo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba byas nas kyang yongs su mi skyo'o //
translated: Having applied himself, he does not become weary.

original: brtan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni /
analyzed: brtan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni /
translated: With the steadfast superior intention,

original: brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang / brtson 'grus rgya chen po yang dag par rtsom par gnas te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang / brtson 'grus rgya chen po yang dag par rtsom par gnas te /
translated: he applies himself to the blazing of effort and the vastness of effort.

original: sbyor ba lhod par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sbyor ba lhod par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: He does not relax his application.

original: sbyor ba nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not diminish his application.

original: mi slu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni dge ba'i chos mngon par sgrub pa de dang de dag la mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni dge ba'i chos mngon par sgrub pa de dang de dag la mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur te /
translated: With the non-deceptive superior intention, he quickly attains the higher knowledge in regard to the various virtuous qualities that he has accomplished.

original: khyad par 'thob pa dma' ba dang / chung du tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin to //🔽tshar gcad pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni /
analyzed: khyad par 'thob pa dma' ba dang / chung du tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin to // tshar gcad pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni /
translated: In particular, he is not satisfied with a small or inferior attainment.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa 'dren to //🔽lhan cig @164a * //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa 'dren to // lhan cig @164a * //
translated: The superior attitude of destruction leads to the innate superior attitude.

original: skyes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni lha dang / mi rnams kyi don dang phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed do //
analyzed: skyes pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas ni lha dang / mi rnams kyi don dang phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed do //
translated: The innate superior attitude quickly leads to the realization of supreme enlightenment for the sake of the benefit and happiness of gods and humans.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs de dang de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa dang / brtags pa dang / bshad pa gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga po 'di dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs de dang de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa dang / brtags pa dang / bshad pa gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga po 'di dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, all the firm, examined, and explained superior attitudes of the bodhisattvas in various contexts in the sutras are included in these fifteen superior attitudes.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag lhag pa'i bsam pa dge ba rnams kyis 'das pa dang ; ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus dag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag lhag pa'i bsam pa dge ba rnams kyis 'das pa dang ; ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus dag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang /
translated: unsurpassed perfect complete awakening with their virtuous superior intention,

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de dag thams cad ni lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga po 'di dag lo na ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de dag thams cad ni lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga po 'di dag lo na ste /
translated: do so on the basis of these fifteen superior intentions.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu'i phan yon can yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu'i phan yon can yin te /
translated: Thus, these fifteen superior intentions of the bodhisattvas are the benefits of the result of great enlightenment.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas de dag la brten nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas de dag la brten nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva attains unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in dependence on them.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las lhag pa'i bsam pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las lhag pa'i bsam pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on superior attitude, the third chapter of the Bodhisattvabhūmi Stages of the Bodhisattva.

original: // / sdom ni /
analyzed: // / sdom ni /
translated: The summary:🔽Lineage, and likewise interest,🔽Exuberance, superior morality,

original: rigs dang de bzhin mos pa dang // rab tu dga' dang lhag khrims dang // lhag pa'i sems dang shes rab gsum //
analyzed: rigs dang de bzhin mos pa dang // rab tu dga' dang lhag khrims dang // lhag pa'i sems dang shes rab gsum //
translated: Superior mind and wisdom,

original: mtshan ma med pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The two kinds of signlessness,

original: rtsol dang bcas dang lhun gyis grub //
analyzed: rtsol dang bcas dang lhun gyis grub //
translated: With effort and spontaneous,🔽Correct understanding, and the highest,🔽The supreme state of the Tathāgatas.

original: so so yang dag rig dang mchog / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa mchog de ltar rigs phun sum tshogs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag rig dang mchog / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa mchog de ltar rigs phun sum tshogs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus, beginning with the perfect lineage,

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob cing ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rtags rnams la yang dag par snang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba rnams la yang dag par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob cing ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rtags rnams la yang dag par snang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba rnams la yang dag par zhugs pa dang /
translated: He trains in the bodhisattva trainings as they have been presented, and the bodhisattva signs that have been presented appear in him. He is engaged in the bodhisattva activities that pertain to his faction.

original: ji ltar brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa ni mdor bsdu na /🔽bcu @164b gnyis yod de /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i gnas rnams kyis /
analyzed: ji ltar brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa ni mdor bsdu na / bcu @164b gnyis yod de / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas rnams kyis /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva’s way of life that purifies the superior intention of a steadfast bodhisattva is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all bodhisattva activities are included in the twelve bodhisattva ways of life.

original: bcu gsum pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ste /
translated: The thirteenth way of life is the way of life of the tathāgatas.

original: de ni byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de'i gnas pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de'i gnas pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is the unsurpassed way of life of those who have fully awakened to complete buddhahood.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve bodhisattva ways of life?

original: rigs la gnas pa dang / mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gsum po byang chub kyi phyogs dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa dang / mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gsum po byang chub kyi phyogs dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The first is the bodhisattva who has entered the first stage, the second is the bodhisattva who has entered the stages of faithful action, the third is the bodhisattva who has entered the stage of great joy, the fourth is the bodhisattva who has entered the stage of superior morality, the fifth is the bodhisattva who has entered the stage of superior mind, and the sixth is the bodhisattva who has entered the three stages of superior wisdom, which are endowed with the elements leading to enlightenment.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa dang / ldog pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa dang / ldog pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the bodhisattva who has entered the stage of superior wisdom, which is endowed with happiness, the eighth is the bodhisattva who has entered the stage of superior wisdom, which is endowed with the forward and reverse processes of dependent origination.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpas gang gis de ltar mthong ba dang / de kho na gang mthong ba dang / de kho na de ma shes pas sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal ji ltar 'jug pa dang / shes pas sdug bsngal mi 'jug pa de ni sgo gsum nas shes rab kyis rnam par dpyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa rnam pa gsum yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpas gang gis de ltar mthong ba dang / de kho na gang mthong ba dang / de kho na de ma shes pas sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal ji ltar 'jug pa dang / shes pas sdug bsngal mi 'jug pa de ni sgo gsum nas shes rab kyis rnam par dpyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa rnam pa gsum yin pa dang /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who sees in this way, who sees reality, who sees that the suffering of sentient beings arises from not knowing that reality, and who sees that suffering does not arise from knowing that reality, is the bodhisattva who has entered the three stages of superior wisdom endowed with the wisdom that analyzes with wisdom through the three doors.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing rtsol ba dang bcas pa la rgyun chags kyi lam la 'jug pa dang ; mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med cing lhun gyis grub pa'i lam la 'jug pa dang /🔽so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mchog yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing rtsol ba dang bcas pa la rgyun chags kyi lam la 'jug pa dang ; mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med cing lhun gyis grub pa'i lam la 'jug pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mchog yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: It is to engage in the path of continuity with a focused mind that is still accompanied by effort and formation. It is to engage in the path that is free of effort and formation and is focused on the absence of attributes.🔽It is to engage in the knowledge of the correct discrimination of phenomena and in the supreme state of the bodhisattvas.🔽

original: bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa yin no //🔽de rnams kyis de dag gis gnas pa thams cad bsdus te /🔽byang byang sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa gang yin pa ste /

original: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de'i gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de'i gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is the state of the one who has fully awakened to supreme enlightenment.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa tha ma ni rab tu gnas pa'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las ril gyis ston to //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa tha ma ni rab tu gnas pa'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las ril gyis ston to //
translated: The final state of the tathāgatas is taught in its entirety in the final stage of the yoga of firm conviction.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis ni ji ltar rnam par gnas pa de bzhin du bstan par bya ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i @165a * //🔽rigs la gnas pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis ni ji ltar rnam par gnas pa de bzhin du bstan par bya ste / byang chub sems dpa'i @165a * // rigs la gnas pa ni gang yin /
translated: The twelve states of the bodhisattvas should be taught in accordance with their order.🔽What is the state of the bodhisattva?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa ni ji ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa ni ji ltar gnas she na /
translated: What is the state of the bodhisattva who is established in the lineage?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa ni rang bzhin gyis sems kyi rgyun dge ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan byang chub sems dpa' la 'os pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa ni rang bzhin gyis sems kyi rgyun dge ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan byang chub sems dpa' la 'os pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva who is established in the lineage naturally possesses the virtuous qualities that are suitable for a bodhisattva, because his mindstream is naturally virtuous.

original: de yang dag par spyod pa la yang dag par snang la /
analyzed: de yang dag par spyod pa la yang dag par snang la /
translated: He is also seen to be engaged in correct practice.

original: rang bzhin gyis dge ba kho nas ngang gis dge ba de la 'jug gi so sor brtags te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dge ba kho nas ngang gis dge ba de la 'jug gi so sor brtags te /
translated: He is naturally virtuous, and he is engaged in virtue by nature, not by analysis.

original: gags dang bcas par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gags dang bcas par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not obstructed.

original: rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the lineage holds the seeds of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon thams cad de'i lus la gnas shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon thams cad de'i lus la gnas shing /
translated: The seeds of all the qualities of a buddha exist in his body,

original: rten la gnas par yod do //
analyzed: rten la gnas par yod do //
translated: and they exist in a manner that is supported.

original: rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dri ma rags pa dang bral ba yin te /🔽de ni kun nas dkris pa gang gis kun nas dkris na mtshams med pa gang yang rung ba'i las kun du spyod par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dri ma rags pa dang bral ba yin te / de ni kun nas dkris pa gang gis kun nas dkris na mtshams med pa gang yang rung ba'i las kun du spyod par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the lineage is free of coarse impurities.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyun chad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris par mngon du byed pa'i cha ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyun chad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris par mngon du byed pa'i cha ma yin no //
translated: He is not in a condition in which he would manifest the kind of mental affliction that would cause him to commit any of the acts with an immediately successive retribution or to cut off the wholesome roots, even if he were to be overcome by the fetters.

original: rigs kyi le'u las rigs la gnas pa'i bya ba brtan pa gang yin pa des yang rgyas par rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi le'u las rigs la gnas pa'i bya ba brtan pa gang yin pa des yang rgyas par rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The chapter on the family states that the bodhisattva who is established in the family is also to be known as the bodhisattva who is engaged in the activities of one who is established in the family.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s station in the family.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s station of the conduct that is based upon devotion?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, from the time that the bodhisattva first generates the thought,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang ci yang rung ba de ni de'i mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang ci yang rung ba de ni de'i mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: whatever conduct of the bodhisattva is based upon the impure superior attitude is called the station of the conduct that is based upon devotion.

original: de la rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de las gzhan pa byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gcig po thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu tsam la 'jug cing ;
analyzed: de la rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de las gzhan pa byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gcig po thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu tsam la 'jug cing ;
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the family enters into the mere cause of the stations of the bodhisattva that are other than that and of the tathāgata’s station.

original: rgyu yongs su 'dzin par zad kyi /
analyzed: rgyu yongs su 'dzin par zad kyi /
translated: He merely holds the cause.

original: des byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa gzhan ci yang brtsams pa yang med /🔽thob pa yang med /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa gzhan ci yang brtsams pa yang med / thob pa yang med /
translated: He does not undertake any other bodhisattva activities.🔽He does not attain anything.

original: rnam par sbyangs pa yang med na de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: rnam par sbyangs pa yang med na de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa lta ci smos /
translated: How much more so for the bodhisattva way of life and the way of life of the Tathāgata?

original: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas @165b thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa yang brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas @165b thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa yang brtsams pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the stage of action in faith has begun the bodhisattva way of life and the way of life of the Tathāgata,

original: thob pa ni ma yin zhing rnam par sbyangs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa ni ma yin zhing rnam par sbyangs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: but has not yet attained them or purified them.

original: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa de nyid ni thob pa yin te /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa de nyid ni thob pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the stage of action in faith has attained the stage of action in faith,

original: de nyid rnam par sbyangs pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par sbyangs pa la zhugs so //
translated: and has begun the purification of that stage.

original: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa yongs su dag na /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa yongs su dag na /
translated: When the stage of action in faith is purified,

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa sngon du brtsams pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa sngon du brtsams pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: the bodhisattva enters the first stage, the Joyous, which he has begun.🔽He has attained the stage of action in faith,

original: de nyid rnam par sbyangs pa la yang zhugs so //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par sbyangs pa la yang zhugs so //
translated: and has begun the purification of that stage.

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa yongs su dag na /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa yongs su dag na /
translated: When the stage of the Joyous is purified,

original: lhag pa'i tshal khrims la gnas pa sngon brtsams pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshal khrims la gnas pa sngon brtsams pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the morality of restraint obtains the very same morality that he previously undertook.

original: de nyid rnam par sbyangs pa la yang zhugs so //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par sbyangs pa la yang zhugs so //
translated: He also enters into the purification of that very morality.

original: de bzhin du rgyas par byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog yongs su grub pa'i bar du yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas par byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog yongs su grub pa'i bar du yang rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood in detail up to the bodhisattva’s supreme abode, which is the accomplishment of the bodhisattva’s abode.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog yongs su grub pa yongs su dag na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog yongs su grub pa yongs su dag na /
translated: When the bodhisattva’s supreme abode, which is the accomplishment of the bodhisattva’s abode, is purified,

original: de ma thag tu sngon brtsams pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa cig car du 'thob cing /
analyzed: de ma thag tu sngon brtsams pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa cig car du 'thob cing /
translated: immediately after that he simultaneously obtains the Tathāgata’s abode, which he previously undertook, and

original: rnam par dag par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that it is purified.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa rnams kyi khyad par yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa rnams kyi khyad par yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the difference between the Tathāgata’s abode and the bodhisattva’s abodes.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s abode of joy?

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the bodhisattva’s abode of the pure superior intention.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Bodhisattva's dwelling in superior morality?

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i gzhis rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i gzhis rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the dwelling of one who is endowed with natural morality, on the basis of a pure superior aspiration.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Bodhisattva's dwelling in superior mind?

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i gzhi dag gis 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i gzhi dag gis 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the dwelling in mundane contemplations, concentrations and attainments, on the basis of a pure dwelling in superior morality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Bodhisattva's dwelling in superior wisdom endowed with the factors of enlightenment?

original: 'jig rten dpa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten dpa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas /
translated: It is the dwelling in the concentrations and attainments of the Bodhisattva who has attained the stages, on the basis of the purity of mundane knowledge.

original: bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye par gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas pa gnag yin pa'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas @166a * //
analyzed: bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye par gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas pa gnag yin pa'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas @166a * //
translated: The station of the bodhisattva who is engaged in the realization of the truths is the discernment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, such as the stations of mindfulness, etc.

original: pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's station consisting of the higher wisdom associated with the truths?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brten nas ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa rtogs pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brten nas ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa rtogs pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the station of the bodhisattva who, on the basis of the discernment of the aids to enlightenment, realizes the truths as they are.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the bodhisattva's station consisting of the higher wisdom associated with the knowledge of the conditioned and unconditioned?

original: bden pa rtogs pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: It is the station of the bodhisattva who, on the basis of the realization of the truths,

original: de ma shes pas sdug bsngal 'byung ba rgyu dang bcas par rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu phye ba dang / de shes pas sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu phye ba'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ma shes pas sdug bsngal 'byung ba rgyu dang bcas par rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu phye ba dang / de shes pas sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu phye ba'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is distinguished by the thorough differentiation of suffering and its cause, since that is not understood, and by the thorough differentiation of the cessation of suffering and its cause, since that is understood.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing rtsol ba dang bcas pa gang zhe na /🔽lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa rnam pa de gsum gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing rtsol ba dang bcas pa gang zhe na / lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa rnam pa de gsum gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' one-pointed concentration on the signless that is accompanied by an over-all conceptualization and an over-all mental orientation?🔽It is the one-pointed concentration on the signless that is accompanied by an over-all conceptualization and an over-all mental orientation.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rtsol bas rgyun chags su bar chad med par chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab bsgom pa dang ldan pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rtsol bas rgyun chags su bar chad med par chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab bsgom pa dang ldan pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' one-pointed concentration on the signless that is free from over-all conceptualization and over-all mental orientation?

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa med cing lhun gyis grub pa gang zhe na /🔽mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa snga ma de nyid shas cher bsgoms pas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa med cing lhun gyis grub pa gang zhe na / mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa snga ma de nyid shas cher bsgoms pas /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' signless abiding that is neither created nor spontaneous?🔽It is the abiding that is endowed with the path that is entered into continuously and uninterruptedly by means of one's own power,

original: rang gi rang nyid kyis rgyun chags su bar chad med par 'jug pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang nyid kyis rgyun chags su bar chad med par 'jug pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: through the cultivation of just that previous signless abiding.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par dmigs pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par dmigs pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' abiding in the correct discrimination of each and every thing?

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu yongs su dag cing mi g-yo ba de nyid la brten nas blo gros chen po rgya che ba rjes su thob ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu yongs su dag cing mi g-yo ba de nyid la brten nas blo gros chen po rgya che ba rjes su thob ste /
translated: It is the attainment of a great, vast intelligence, based on that very unshakable concentration endowed with wisdom and complete purity.

original: gzhan dag la chos yang dag par ston pa bla na med pa las brtsams nas chos rnams kyi rnam grangs dang don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye ba rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la chos yang dag par ston pa bla na med pa las brtsams nas chos rnams kyi rnam grangs dang don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye ba rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the state of abiding in the teaching of the Dharma to others, beginning with the unsurpassed, which is the analysis of the categories, meanings, etymologies, and divisions of the teachings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa mchog gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa mchog gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' highest state of abiding?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi mthar thug ste /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu chos kyi dbang bskur ba chen po thob pa skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi mthar thug ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu chos kyi dbang bskur ba chen po thob pa skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'am /
translated: It is the state of abiding in which the bodhisattva, having reached the end of the path of the bodhisattva,

original: yang na srid pa tha ma pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na srid pa tha ma pa yin te /
translated: receives the great anointment of Dharma in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and is either in his last life or is in the state immediately followed by the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gnas pa de'i mjug thogs su bar chad med pa kho nar bla @166b na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad mdzad do //
analyzed: gnas pa de'i mjug thogs su bar chad med pa kho nar bla @166b na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad mdzad do //
translated: Immediately after that state, he attains unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment without any interval and performs all the actions of a Buddha.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la ni byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa la chung ngur byed pa dang / rgyun chags ma yin par byed pa dang / nges par mi byed pa dang / thob pa las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la ni byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa la chung ngur byed pa dang / rgyun chags ma yin par byed pa dang / nges par mi byed pa dang / thob pa las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: For the bodhisattva who is established in the stage of action in faith, the cultivation of the bodhisattva is small, not continuous, not certain, and he falls away from what has been attained.

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la ni /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la ni /
translated: But for the bodhisattva who is established in the stage of joy,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa de nyid la rgya cher byed pa dang / rgyun chags su byed pa dang / nges par byed pa dang / ji ltar thob pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa de nyid la rgya cher byed pa dang / rgyun chags su byed pa dang / nges par byed pa dang / ji ltar thob pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: that very cultivation of the bodhisattva is extensive, continuous, certain, and he does not fall away from what has been attained.

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la ji lta ba bzhin du lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gsum gyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la ji lta ba bzhin du lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gsum gyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as for the stage of joy, the same holds for the three stages up to the stage of excellence.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: But beginning with the first stage of direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation,
