original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog gi bar du byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa la tshad med par byed pa dang / rgyun chags su byed pa dang / nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog gi bar du byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa la tshad med par byed pa dang / rgyun chags su byed pa dang / nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: up to the supreme abode of the bodhisattva, the bodhisattva cultivates the bodhisattva's immeasurable, continuous, and certain cultivation.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa yang dag par rtsom par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa yang dag par rtsom par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the stage of action in faith, the bodhisattva should be known as one who has begun to cultivate the signless.

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa rnams la ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa de 'thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa rnams la ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa de 'thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the stages of joy, superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom, the bodhisattva should be known as one who has attained the cultivation of the signless.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang po la ni yang dag par 'grub bo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang po la ni yang dag par 'grub bo //
translated: On the first stage of the signless, he accomplishes it.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa gnyis pa la ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa yongs su dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa gnyis pa la ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa yongs su dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the second stage, the stage of the signless, the bodhisattva's cultivation of the signless should be understood as purified.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa dang / gnas pa mchog la ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa'i bsgom pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu so sor myong bar rig par bya'o //🔽mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa ni gang dag yin /🔽rtags ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa dang / gnas pa mchog la ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa'i bsgom pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu so sor myong bar rig par bya'o // mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa ni gang dag yin / rtags ni gang dag yin /
translated: On the stage of direct intuition and the supreme stage, the bodhisattva experiences the result of that cultivation of the signless.

original: mtshan ma ni gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the aspects, what are the signs, and what are the portents of the bodhisattva who is on the stage of action in faith?

original: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs can yin te /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs can yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stage of action in faith is one who has the power of discernment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba'i sbyor ba dag la so sor brtags shing brtags shing shes rab kyis sbyor bar byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba'i sbyor ba dag la so sor brtags shing brtags shing shes rab kyis sbyor bar byed kyi /
translated: He is one who applies wisdom after having repeatedly examined the applications of the bodhisattva's activities.

original: rang bzhin gyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur @167a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur @167a * //
translated: He is not one who is naturally and essentially.

original: pas byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa mi 'gyur ba dang / brtan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa 'thob pa ni ma yin no //🔽bsgom pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: pas byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa mi 'gyur ba dang / brtan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa 'thob pa ni ma yin no // bsgom pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva does not attain the stability, firmness, and irreversibility of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: As with meditation, so it is with the results of meditation: the analytical knowledges, the superknowledges, the various kinds of liberation, concentration, and attainment.

original: 'jigs pa rnam pa lnga po 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa rnams las kyang 'das pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'jigs pa rnam pa lnga po 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa rnams las kyang 'das pa ma yin no ;
translated: And he does not transcend the five fears: fear of having to make a living, fear of public speaking, fear of death, fear of miserable states of existence, and fear of being in the midst of the assembly.

original: ; sems can gyi don rnams la yang so sor brtags te sbyor gyi rang bzhin gyis snying brtse zhing byams pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ; sems can gyi don rnams la yang so sor brtags te sbyor gyi rang bzhin gyis snying brtse zhing byams pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not apply himself to the welfare of sentient beings spontaneously, but only after deliberation, and not out of natural compassion and love.

original: ched 'ga' ni sems can rnams la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis log par sgrub bo //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni sems can rnams la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis log par sgrub bo //
translated: Sometimes they act wrongly toward sentient beings with their body, speech, and mind.

original: ched 'ga' ni yul rnams la yang lhag par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni yul rnams la yang lhag par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes they are attached to objects.

original: ched 'ga' ni yo byad rnams la kun du 'dzin par yang snang ngo //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni yo byad rnams la kun du 'dzin par yang snang ngo //
translated: Sometimes they are seen to hoard goods.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la yang dad pas 'gro bar 'gyur gyi /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la yang dad pas 'gro bar 'gyur gyi / 'di lta ste /
translated: They go for refuge to the Buddha and the other bodhisattvas out of faith,🔽but not in the way that is taught,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: namely, in the Tathagata,🔽in the Dharma,

original: chos sam / dge 'dun nam /🔽de kho na'i don nam /
analyzed: chos sam / dge 'dun nam / de kho na'i don nam /
translated: in the Sangha,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'am /
translated: in the power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas,🔽in the cause,

original: rgyu'am / 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyu'am / 'bras bu'am /
translated: in the result,

original: thob par bya ba'i don nam /🔽thob par bya ba'i thabs sam /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i don nam / thob par bya ba'i thabs sam /
translated: in the goal to be attained,🔽in the means of attaining it,

original: spyod yul las brtsams te /
analyzed: spyod yul las brtsams te /
translated: or in the field.

original: so sor rang la de kho nar shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor rang la de kho nar shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not understand it for themselves, as it really is, on the basis of the domain of wisdom that comes from listening and reflection.

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: They have only a small amount of wisdom that comes from listening and reflection.

original: tshad med pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not endowed with the immeasurables.

original: de nyid kyang des ched 'ga' brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyang des ched 'ga' brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: He is also sometimes forgetful.

original: brjed ngas pa'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa'i chos can yin no //
translated: He is forgetful by nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par shes pa bul ba dka' ba dang ldan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par shes pa bul ba dka' ba dang ldan pa yang yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the slow superknowledges of the bodhisattva path and with difficulty.

original: byang chub chen po la yang 'dun pa drag po med do //
analyzed: byang chub chen po la yang 'dun pa drag po med do //
translated: He does not have a strong aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus 'bar ba ma yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus 'bar ba ma yin no //
translated: He is not burning with energy.

original: zab mo la dga' ba legs par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zab mo la dga' ba legs par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not well established in the delight in the profound.

original: gnas pa gsum po rnams su yang brjed ngas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa gsum po rnams su yang brjed ngas pa yin te /
translated: He is forgetful in the three states.🔽Sometimes he has a wrong attitude toward pleasant and unpleasant objects, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and dharmas.

original: yul gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba rnams la ched 'ga' phyin ci log tu sems pa dang / skye ba lus dang tha dad pa de dang /
analyzed: yul gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba rnams la ched 'ga' phyin ci log tu sems pa dang / skye ba lus dang tha dad pa de dang /
translated: He is born with a different body from that.

original: der skyes pa nas lus snga ma brjed pa dang / chos lung mnos @167b pa dang ; bzung ba dang / byas nas yun ring du lon pa dang / smras nas yun ring du lon pa dag kyang ched 'ga' brjed pas na /
analyzed: der skyes pa nas lus snga ma brjed pa dang / chos lung mnos @167b pa dang ; bzung ba dang / byas nas yun ring du lon pa dang / smras nas yun ring du lon pa dag kyang ched 'ga' brjed pas na /
translated: There, having been born, he forgets his former body, and he forgets the Dharma that he has received and retained, and he forgets what he has done after a long time, and he forgets what he has said after a long time.

original: de ltar gnas gsum po de dag tu brjed ngas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnas gsum po de dag tu brjed ngas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is forgetful in these three circumstances.

original: ched 'ga' ni yid gzhungs par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni yid gzhungs par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Sometimes, he is intelligent,

original: chos rnams len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / don 'jug par nus la /
analyzed: chos rnams len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / don 'jug par nus la /
translated: able to receive and retain the Dharma and to understand its meaning.

original: ched 'ga' ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Sometimes, he is not like that.

original: ched 'ga' ni dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: Sometimes, he is mindful,

original: ched 'ga' ni brjed ngas pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //🔽sems can rnams 'dul ba'i thabs kyang ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mi shes la /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni brjed ngas pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro // sems can rnams 'dul ba'i thabs kyang ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mi shes la /
translated: sometimes, he is forgetful by nature.🔽He does not understand the means of disciplining sentient beings as they should be understood,

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos sgrub pa'i thabs kyang mngon par mi shes so //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos sgrub pa'i thabs kyang mngon par mi shes so //
translated: and he does not understand the means of accomplishing his own Buddha qualities as they should be understood.

original: gzhan dag la yang nan gyis chos ston cing gdams pa dang rjes su brtan pa la 'jug par byed de /🔽des nan gyis 'jug par byas pa de yang /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang nan gyis chos ston cing gdams pa dang rjes su brtan pa la 'jug par byed de / des nan gyis 'jug par byas pa de yang /
translated: He also teaches the Dharma to others, and he instructs and stabilizes them.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ma yin te /
translated: But that instruction is not based on knowledge that is in accord with fact.

original: mtshan mo mda' 'phangs pa bzhin du dbang du 'grub par zad pas na /
analyzed: mtshan mo mda' 'phangs pa bzhin du dbang du 'grub par zad pas na /
translated: It is like shooting an arrow in the dark: it may or may not hit the target.

original: ched 'ga' ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
translated: Sometimes it is ineffective.

original: ched 'ga' ni 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes it is effective.

original: ched 'ga' ni byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa las kyang gtong bar 'gyur /🔽ched 'ga' ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs kyang ldog pa'am /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa las kyang gtong bar 'gyur / ched 'ga' ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs kyang ldog pa'am /
translated: Sometimes, even though he has generated the thought of the Great Vehicle, he gives it up.

original: yang na spro ba med par 'gyur ro //🔽ched 'ga' ni sems can gyi don bya ba zhugs pa las kyang bar ma dor skye bar gyur nas /
analyzed: yang na spro ba med par 'gyur ro // ched 'ga' ni sems can gyi don bya ba zhugs pa las kyang bar ma dor skye bar gyur nas /
translated: Sometimes, even though he has taken up the vow of bodhisattva morality, he turns back from it or loses enthusiasm for it.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i sbyor ba de las phyir ldog par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i sbyor ba de las phyir ldog par 'gyur ro /
translated: Sometimes, even though he has begun to work for the welfare of sentient beings, he turns back from that application in the middle of the task.

original: bsam pa thag pa nas bdag nyid bde bar 'dod la gzhan gyi bde ba ni so sor brtags te 'dod par zad do //
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas bdag nyid bde bar 'dod la gzhan gyi bde ba ni so sor brtags te 'dod par zad do //
translated: He desires his own happiness with all his heart, and he desires the happiness of others only after reflection.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa rnams la yang yongs su shes pa mang mod kyi /🔽yang dang yang du 'khrul pa lhag par spyod pas yongs su shes shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa rnams la yang yongs su shes pa mang mod kyi / yang dang yang du 'khrul pa lhag par spyod pas yongs su shes shing /
translated: The bodhisattva has a great deal of understanding of his errors.

original: ma lus par spong ba dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma lus par spong ba dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he does not have the understanding and complete abandonment of errors that comes from not committing them again and again.

original: ched 'ga' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi chos 'dul ba 'di las khrid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi chos 'dul ba 'di las khrid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes he is led away from this Dharma and Vinaya of the bodhisattva collection.

original: ched 'ga' ni chos bstan pa zab cing rgya che ba thos nas skrag par 'gyur zhing de'i sems g-yo ba dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni chos bstan pa zab cing rgya che ba thos nas skrag par 'gyur zhing de'i sems g-yo ba dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes, hearing profound and vast teachings, he is frightened and his mind moves, is divided, and doubts.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje chen po kun du spyod pa yang thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje chen po kun du spyod pa yang thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He completely abandons the practice of great compassion for sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba chung du bsgrub pas nye bar gnas pa yin te /🔽rgya che ba dang / tshad @168a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba chung du bsgrub pas nye bar gnas pa yin te / rgya che ba dang / tshad @168a * //
translated: He is not established in the small benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not established in the great and immeasurable benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad la yang slob par mi byed do //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad la yang slob par mi byed do //
translated: He does not train in all the perfections of the bodhisattva as they have been presented.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rtags yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rtags yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: He does not possess all the perfections of the bodhisattva signs as they have been presented.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad la yang dag par mi snang ngo bdag nyid kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las ring bar 'dzin to //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad la yang dag par mi snang ngo bdag nyid kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las ring bar 'dzin to //
translated: He does not manifest all the perfections of the bodhisattva’s application to the factors as they have been presented. He considers himself far from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni 'khor ba na 'khor ba la ji ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa gnas pa ltar mya ngan las pa la de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba na 'khor ba la ji ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa gnas pa ltar mya ngan las pa la de lta ma yin no //
translated: And he does not have the same attitude toward nirvana as he does toward samsara, in which he remains with a superior intention.

original: dge ba dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sbyangs shing mi g-yo ba rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sbyangs shing mi g-yo ba rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the virtues and the factors of enlightenment, and is unshakable.

original: de dag dang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rtags dang mtshan ma dang / rnam pa de dag ni mos pa spyod pa la gnas pas gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rtags dang mtshan ma dang / rnam pa de dag ni mos pa spyod pa la gnas pas gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These and other such signs, indications, and aspects should be understood as the signs of a bodhisattva who is established in the stage of conduct through devoted interest.

original: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la bzod pa chung ngu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma ji skad bstan pa de dag shas che bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la bzod pa chung ngu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma ji skad bstan pa de dag shas che bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In the case of a bodhisattva who is established in the stage of conduct through devoted interest and who is abiding in the small form of forbearance, those aspects, signs, and indications that were presented should be understood as being predominant.

original: bzod pa 'bring la gnas pa la ni 'bring du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa 'bring la gnas pa la ni 'bring du rig par bya'o //
translated: In the case of one who is abiding in the middling form of forbearance, they should be understood as being middling.

original: bzod pa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni rnam pa dang ; rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag chung zhing srab par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni rnam pa dang ; rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag chung zhing srab par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the case of a bodhisattva who is abiding in the great form of forbearance, those aspects, signs, and indications should be understood as being small and subtle.

original: bzod pa chen po la gnas pa nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag kyang ma lus par spong la /
analyzed: bzod pa chen po la gnas pa nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag kyang ma lus par spong la /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of great patience abandons those aspects, signs, and indications completely.

original: de ma thag tu rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la yang 'thob pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la yang 'thob pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: Immediately after that, he enters the stage of joy in the manner of attainment.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa de la ni mos pas spyod pa la gnas pas gnas pa la yod par bstan pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du med do //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa de la ni mos pas spyod pa la gnas pas gnas pa la yod par bstan pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du med do //
translated: In the stage of joy, all those dharmas that were taught to exist in the stage of conduct by faith do not exist at all.

original: de las bzlog pa'i dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad ni yod de /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad ni yod de /
translated: All the dharmas of the bright side that are the opposite of those do exist.

original: de dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Endowed with those, the bodhisattva is said to have a pure superior attitude.

original: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i tshul gyis gong nas gong du mos pa dag pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i tshul gyis gong nas gong du mos pa dag pa yod mod kyi /
translated: For the bodhisattva who is established in the stage of action in faith, there is also a purification of superior attitude, in the sense of a greater and greater faith, in the small, middling, and great stages.

original: de la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: But this is not called the purification of superior attitude.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar @168b mos pa de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa du ma de dag gis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur pas 'jug la /
analyzed: 'di ltar @168b mos pa de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa du ma de dag gis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur pas 'jug la /
translated: Because that faith is accompanied by many kinds of secondary mental afflictions.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mos pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag thams cad spang ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing dag pa'i mos pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mos pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag thams cad spang ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing dag pa'i mos pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: But for the bodhisattva who is established in the stage of the joyous, all those secondary mental afflictions of faith are eliminated, and faith functions without mental afflictions and is purified.

original: / de la rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: / de la rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa ni gang dag yin /
translated: What are the aspects of the bodhisattva who is established in the stage of the joyous?

original: rtags ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: rtags ni gang dag yin /
translated: What are the signs?

original: mtshan ma ni gang dag yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gang dag yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What are the signs of this?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa las rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa las rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la 'jug pa na /
translated: Here, when a bodhisattva who is on the stage of action in faith enters the pleasurable state of great joy,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi smon lam snga ma byang chub legs par ma rtogs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi smon lam snga ma byang chub legs par ma rtogs pa /
translated: he abandons the bodhisattva's former aspiration for unsurpassable perfect enlightenment, which was not well understood,

original: byang chub par bya ba'i thabs legs par ma rtogs pa phal cher gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba nges pa ma yin pa spangs nas /
analyzed: byang chub par bya ba'i thabs legs par ma rtogs pa phal cher gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba nges pa ma yin pa spangs nas /
translated: which was not well understood as the means to attain enlightenment, which was mostly dependent on the conditions of others, and which was not certain.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam shin tu rnam par nges pa so so rang gi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sar pa gzhan rnam pa drug po de las gzhan pa'i dkar po'i smon lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa mtshungs pa med cing 'bras bu thun
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam shin tu rnam par nges pa so so rang gi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sar pa gzhan rnam pa drug po de las gzhan pa'i dkar po'i smon lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa mtshungs pa med cing 'bras bu thun
translated: He formulates a new bodhisattva aspiration that is very well ascertained, that is not dependent on the conditions of others, that is not common to others, that is fresh, that is of six aspects, that surpasses all other virtuous aspirations, that is unequaled, and that is the cause for the attainment of the result of the pleasurable state of great joy.

original: mong ba ma yin pa dang / de 'jig rten pa dang / de 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi yul las kyang yang dag par 'das pa dang / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mong ba ma yin pa dang / de 'jig rten pa dang / de 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi yul las kyang yang dag par 'das pa dang / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not common, it is supramundane, it is beyond the scope of all mundane beings, it is endowed with the protection of all sentient beings from suffering,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa dang / smon lam de skad cig tsam skyes na yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dkar po'i chos kyi sdug bsngal ba'i 'bras bu dpag tu med par 'gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag lta bu'i chos kyi rang bzhin de dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa dang / smon lam de skad cig tsam skyes na yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dkar po'i chos kyi sdug bsngal ba'i 'bras bu dpag tu med par 'gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag lta bu'i chos kyi rang bzhin de dang /
translated: it is not shared in common with all sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and even if that aspiration is generated for just a moment, the result of the bodhisattvas' virtuous qualities becomes immeasurable.

original: smon lam de 'gyur pa med cing zad mi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: smon lam de 'gyur pa med cing zad mi shes pa yin te /
translated: That nature of Dharma and that aspiration are unchanging and inexhaustible.

original: de thob pa la rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de thob pa la rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: There is no way whatsoever that it can be diminished in attaining it.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa dang / de khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha dang mthun zhing phyi ma'i mthar phyin pa la /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa dang / de khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha dang mthun zhing phyi ma'i mthar phyin pa la /
translated: It is not observed to change into something else, and it is conducive to its special development and to its completion in the future.

original: byang chub chen po'i mthar thug pa dag gis skyed par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i mthar thug pa dag gis skyed par byed de /
translated: It is generated by the ultimate of great enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam shin tu rnam par nges pa de ni sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam shin tu rnam par nges pa de ni sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the generation of the thought of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: This generation of the thought of the bodhisattva should be understood in brief as having four aspects:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: @169a * // thog ma kho nar byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu dag la sems de skyed pa dang / ci la dmigs nas skye ba dang / ji lta bu'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhing gang gi bdag nyid du skye ba dang / sems de skyes na phan 'dogs cir 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis sems skye ba de rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @169a * // thog ma kho nar byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu dag la sems de skyed pa dang / ci la dmigs nas skye ba dang / ji lta bu'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhing gang gi bdag nyid du skye ba dang / sems de skyes na phan 'dogs cir 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis sems skye ba de rig par bya'o //
translated: The generation of the thought should be understood by means of four aspects: by what kind of bodhisattvas that thought is generated, on what it takes as object, what kind of characteristics it has, and what kind of self it has.

original: de la mdor bsdu na mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la rnam pa thams cad du dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags shing /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa la rnam pa thams cad du dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags shing /
translated: In brief, the thought of awakening arises in bodhisattvas who are abiding in the stage of engagement through aspiration, who have fully accumulated roots of virtue,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang dag pa la nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sems de skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang dag pa la nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sems de skye'o //
translated: and who are intent on the bodhisattva way of life.

original: mdor bsdu na phyi ma la yang dag par myur du rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis sems can gyi don bya ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chu dang /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na phyi ma la yang dag par myur du rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis sems can gyi don bya ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chu dang /
translated: In brief, it arises in order to perfect all the accumulations for complete and perfect awakening in the future, to complete the welfare of sentient beings by all bodhisattvas, and to attain unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la dmigs pa byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems de skye'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la dmigs pa byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems de skye'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas give rise to this mind by focusing on the complete perfection of all the qualities of the Buddha and on the complete perfection of the activities of the Buddha.

original: yang dag par myur du rnam pa thams cad du byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad dang mthun pa dang / sems can rnams la rnam pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba dang mthun pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang byung gi ye shes 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par myur du rnam pa thams cad du byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad dang mthun pa dang / sems can rnams la rnam pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba dang mthun pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang byung gi ye shes 'thob pa dang /
translated: This mind is given rise to in order to quickly and completely perfect all the accumulations for enlightenment, in order to completely accomplish all the activities of a bodhisattva for sentient beings, in order to attain the self-arisen gnosis of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: mthun pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa dang mthun pa'i sems de skye'o //
analyzed: mthun pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa dang mthun pa'i sems de skye'o //
translated: and in order to completely accomplish all the activities of the Buddha.

original: sems de skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' byis pa'i byang chub sems dpa' so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa yin /
analyzed: sems de skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' byis pa'i byang chub sems dpa' so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa yin /
translated: When this mind is given rise to, the bodhisattva has transcended the stage of the childish bodhisattva, the stage of the ordinary person.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin /
translated: He has entered into the faultlessness of a Bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
translated: He is born into the family of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi sras yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi sras yin /
translated: He is the heart-son of the Tathagatas.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gro ba dang ; de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gro ba dang ; de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges pa yin no //
translated: He is certain to go to perfect enlightenment and is certain to be in the family of the Tathagatas.

original: de ltar gyur pa de shes nas dad pa thob nas mchog tu dga' ba mang ba yin /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de shes nas dad pa thob nas mchog tu dga' ba mang ba yin /
translated: Having understood that this is so, he has attained faith and has much supreme joy.

original: gzhan dag la shas cher nyes rtsom med pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag la shas cher nyes rtsom med pa yin /
translated: He is not very much given to committing faults in regard to others.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba med pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba med pa yin /
translated: He is not given to violence.

original: khro ba med pa mang pa yin no //
analyzed: khro ba med pa mang pa yin no //
translated: He is not given to anger.

original: rnam pa thams cad du byang chub sems @169b dpa'i sems can gyi don bya ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du byang chub sems @169b dpa'i sems can gyi don bya ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang /
translated: In every way he is engaged in the welfare of sentient beings, in every way he is completing the accumulations for enlightenment, in every way he is attaining enlightenment, and in every way he is attaining the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las sgrub pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas dmigs pa byas shing mos pas 'jug pa chos 'di la myur du yang dag par 'grub pa dang / mthun pa dag nyid yang dag par mthong zhing khong du chud nas mchog tu dga' ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las sgrub pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas dmigs pa byas shing mos pas 'jug pa chos 'di la myur du yang dag par 'grub pa dang / mthun pa dag nyid yang dag par mthong zhing khong du chud nas mchog tu dga' ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to accomplish the Buddha’s work, he has the pure superior intention, and he enters into the Dharma by means of his aspiration. He quickly and perfectly accomplishes this Dharma, and he sees and understands the things that are in accord with it. He has a great deal of supreme joy.

original: bdag nyid dge ba rgya chen po mngon par 'gyur pa dang ldan pa zang zing med pa mtshungs pa med pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid dge ba rgya chen po mngon par 'gyur pa dang ldan pa zang zing med pa mtshungs pa med pa /
translated: He has a great deal of virtue that is manifest and that is unequaled.

original: lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog tu dga' ba dang / dge ba'i tshos 'bar ba dag dang ldan no //
analyzed: lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog tu dga' ba dang / dge ba'i tshos 'bar ba dag dang ldan no //
translated: He has a great deal of supreme joy that benefits his body and mind. He has a great deal of the blazing of virtuous Dharmas.

original: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur to //
translated: He thinks, “I am close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub chen po la bdag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni rnam par dag go //
analyzed: byang chub chen po la bdag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni rnam par dag go //
translated: My superior intention toward great awakening is pure.

original: bdag ni 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral lo snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag ni 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral lo snyam nas /
translated: I am free from all fears.”

original: de'i phyir yang mchog tu dga' ba mang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mchog tu dga' ba mang ba yin no //
translated: For this reason, he has a great deal of supreme joy.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems shin tu rnam par nges par bskyed pa ni 'jigs pa lnga spangs ba yin te /🔽bdag med pa'i ye shes shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa la ni bdag tu 'du shes pa yang mi 'byung na de la bdag la chags pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems shin tu rnam par nges par bskyed pa ni 'jigs pa lnga spangs ba yin te / bdag med pa'i ye shes shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa la ni bdag tu 'du shes pa yang mi 'byung na de la bdag la chags pa'am /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has generated the thought of awakening in a very definite way has abandoned the five fears.

original: yo byad la chags pa lta ga la 'byung ste /
analyzed: yo byad la chags pa lta ga la 'byung ste /
translated: When one has cultivated very thoroughly the knowledge of selflessness, the notion of self does not arise, much less the attachment to self or to possessions.

original: de'i phyir de la 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of not making a living.

original: gzhan dag las kyang ci yang re ba med la /🔽'di lta bur yang 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag las kyang ci yang re ba med la / 'di lta bur yang 'dod de /
translated: He does not hope for anything from others.

original: bdag nyid kyis sems can 'di rnams kyi don thams cad sgrub bo snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis sems can 'di rnams kyi don thams cad sgrub bo snyam ste /
translated: He thinks, “I myself will accomplish all the aims of these sentient beings.”

original: de'i phyir de la tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa med do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de la tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa med do ;
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of being without verses.

original: ; bdag tu lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir na de la bdag tu 'du shes pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ; bdag tu lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir na de la bdag tu 'du shes pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: Since he is free from the view of self, the notion of self does not arise for him.

original: de'i phyir de la 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of death.

original: bdag ni shi ba'i 'og tu phyi ma la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nges par phrad par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag ni shi ba'i 'og tu phyi ma la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nges par phrad par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: After my death, in the next life, I will certainly meet the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar nges par gyur pas na /
analyzed: de ltar nges par gyur pas na /
translated: Thus, being certain of this,

original: de'i phyir de la ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa med do //🔽'jig rten thams cad na bdag dang bsam pa mtshungs shing mnyam pa su yang ma mthong na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa med do // 'jig rten thams cad na bdag dang bsam pa mtshungs shing mnyam pa su yang ma mthong na /
translated: he has no fear of the lower realms.

original: ches lhag pa lta ga la yod snyam ste /
analyzed: ches lhag pa lta ga la yod snyam ste /
translated: He thinks, I have never seen anyone in the whole world who has the same thoughts as I do, much less someone better.

original: de'i phyir nge la 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nge la 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of being embarrassed in the assembly.

original: de de ltar 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / zab mo ston @170a * //
analyzed: de de ltar 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / zab mo ston @170a * //
translated: Thus, being free from all fears, he teaches the profound

original: pa thams cad kyis skrag pa dang bral ba dang / thos pa'i nga rgyal gyis khengs pa dang bral ba dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa dang log par sgrub pa thams cad la zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / 'jig rten gyi 'du 'dzi'i dga' ba thams cad dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: pa thams cad kyis skrag pa dang bral ba dang / thos pa'i nga rgyal gyis khengs pa dang bral ba dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa dang log par sgrub pa thams cad la zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / 'jig rten gyi 'du 'dzi'i dga' ba thams cad dang bral ba dang /
translated: They are free from fear of all the sufferings of samsara, free from the pride of thinking they have heard a lot, free from anger toward all the harm and ingratitude of others, free from all the joys of worldly busyness.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir nyams pa med pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir phal pa ma yin pa'i bsam pas dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /🔽tshe 'di la yang rnam pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir nyams pa med pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir phal pa ma yin pa'i bsam pas dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir / tshe 'di la yang rnam pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
translated: They are not degenerate because they are not defiled, and they are not ordinary because they are so well trained.

original: dad pa'i dbang du bya ba sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang du bya ba sngon du btang ste /
translated: They are endowed with the power of faith, and they are endowed with the power of perseverance.🔽They are endowed with the power of mindfulness, and they are endowed with the power of concentration.

original: phyi ma la yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi le'u las sngar bstan pa'i smon lam chen po bcu po gang yin pa de dag bsam pa dag pa la brten nas rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa 'di la mngon par 'grub par byed do /🔽// / bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: phyi ma la yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi le'u las sngar bstan pa'i smon lam chen po bcu po gang yin pa de dag bsam pa dag pa la brten nas rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa 'di la mngon par 'grub par byed do / // / bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: In the latter case, the ten great aspirations taught in the chapter on the elements leading to enlightenment are accomplished on this ground of The Joyous, in dependence on the pure thought.🔽The great aspiration to make offerings to the lords of Dharma, the supreme beings who are the objects of offering, is the second.🔽The great aspiration to uphold the excellent Dharma taught by them is the third.

original: sems can gyi mchog yon gyi gnas ston pa chos kyi mnga' bdag la mchod pa bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang gnyis pa ste des gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos yang dag par bzung ba dang / gsum pa ste dam pa'i chos go rims bzhin du 'byung bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi mchog yon gyi gnas ston pa chos kyi mnga' bdag la mchod pa bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang gnyis pa ste des gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos yang dag par bzung ba dang / gsum pa ste dam pa'i chos go rims bzhin du 'byung bar bya ba dang /
translated: The great aspiration to make the excellent Dharma arise in sequence is the fourth.

original: bzhi pa ste de dang mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / lnga pa ste de'i snod kyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / drug pa ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su 'gro ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba dang /
analyzed: bzhi pa ste de dang mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / lnga pa ste de'i snod kyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / drug pa ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su 'gro ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba dang /
translated: seeing the tathagatas;🔽listening to the sublime Dharma; the seventh, purifying one's own buddha realm; the eighth, not being separated from the buddhas and bodhisattvas in all one's lives;

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / bdun pa ste rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / brgyad pa ste tshe rabs thams cad du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mi 'bral bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par bya ba dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / bdun pa ste rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / brgyad pa ste tshe rabs thams cad du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mi 'bral bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par bya ba dang /
translated: being of the same intention and application as the bodhisattvas;

original: dgu pa ste sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad 'bras bu yod par bya ba dang / bcu pa ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bya ba'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub po //
analyzed: dgu pa ste sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad 'bras bu yod par bya ba dang / bcu pa ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bya ba'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub po //
translated: The tenth is the great vow to accomplish the highest, complete enlightenment and to perform the deeds of a Buddha.🔽Just as the continuum of sentient beings passes from one life to another without interruption, and just as mundane phenomena are uninterrupted,

original: sems can gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rgyun mi 'chad pa lta bu dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rgyun mi 'chad pa bzhin du byang chub kyi mthar @170b thug par 'gro ba'i bar du /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rgyun mi 'chad pa lta bu dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rgyun mi 'chad pa bzhin du byang chub kyi mthar @170b thug par 'gro ba'i bar du /
translated: in the same way, until the end of cyclic existence,

original: tshe rab thams cad du bdag gi smon lam chen po 'di thob pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / mi 'bral bar gyur cig ces sems kyis yang dag par smon par byed do //🔽snga ma ni smon par bya ba'i don la smon pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rab thams cad du bdag gi smon lam chen po 'di thob pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / mi 'bral bar gyur cig ces sems kyis yang dag par smon par byed do // snga ma ni smon par bya ba'i don la smon pa'o //
translated: in all my lives may I attain these great vows, may I not forget them, and may I not be separated from them.🔽The former is the vow to attain the object of the vow.

original: phyi ma ni smon lam nyid la smon par rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: phyi ma ni smon lam nyid la smon par rig par bya ste ;
translated: The latter is the vow to make the vow itself.

original: de smon lam chen po 'di dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' de'i yang dag pa'i smon lam rnams kyi smon lam grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de smon lam chen po 'di dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' de'i yang dag pa'i smon lam rnams kyi smon lam grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These and other great aspirations are the ten hundred thousand countless aspirations of the bodhisattvas’ perfect aspirations.

original: de ni 'di ltar phyi ma la yang smon lam dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar phyi ma la yang smon lam dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, they will be endowed with aspirations in the future,

original: tshe 'di la yang brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni gnas pa yongs su sbyangs pa'i chos bcus rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: tshe 'di la yang brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni gnas pa yongs su sbyangs pa'i chos bcus rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: and in this life, they will purify the stage of The Joyful One by means of the ten dharmas that purify the stage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mngon par dad pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig pa yang dag par 'grub par lta ba'i snying rje dang / bdag gis sems can 'di dag sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig pa 'di las rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam du lta ba'i byams pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mngon par dad pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig pa yang dag par 'grub par lta ba'i snying rje dang / bdag gis sems can 'di dag sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig pa 'di las rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam du lta ba'i byams pa dang /
translated: They are: faith in all the Buddha dharmas; compassion that views the mere mass of suffering of sentient beings as being produced by the principle of dependent origination; love that views, “I will liberate these sentient beings from this mere mass of suffering”;

original: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pas bdag nyid la mi lta ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pas bdag nyid la mi lta ste /
translated: They do not care about themselves, but think only of protecting all sentient beings from suffering.🔽Because they do not care about themselves, they give away to sentient beings all their inner and outer possessions.

original: de la mi lta bas sems can rnams la nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po yongs su gtong ba dang / sems can de dag nyid kyi don du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gzhan las yongs su tshol ba la mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: de la mi lta bas sems can rnams la nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po yongs su gtong ba dang / sems can de dag nyid kyi don du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gzhan las yongs su tshol ba la mi skyo ba dang /
translated: For the sake of those very sentient beings, they never tire of seeking the mundane and supramundane teachings.🔽Because they are indefatigable, they achieve the perfect knowledge of all the treatises.

original: mi skyo bas bstan bcos thams cad shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par dag pas bstan bcos shes pa dang / bstan bcos shes pas sems can tha ma dang 'bring dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams la ci nus ci 'os su de bzhin nyid du bsgrub pas 'jig rten shes pa dang /🔽sbyor ba de dag nyid la dus dang dus tshod la sogs pa'i spyod pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: mi skyo bas bstan bcos thams cad shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par dag pas bstan bcos shes pa dang / bstan bcos shes pas sems can tha ma dang 'bring dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams la ci nus ci 'os su de bzhin nyid du bsgrub pas 'jig rten shes pa dang /🔽sbyor ba de dag nyid la dus dang dus tshod la sogs pa'i spyod pa las brtsams te /
translated: With their knowledge of the treatises, they practice accordingly, to the best of their ability and in the appropriate manner, for the sake of sentient beings, whether they are of lesser, middling, or superior capacity.🔽And they never tire of teaching the Dharma to others.

original: ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa dang / sbyor ba de dag nyid la phyir mi ldog pas sran thub pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang bsgrub pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa ste /🔽'di lta ste dad ba dang snying rje dang / byams pa dang / gtong ba dang / mi skyo ba dang / bstan bcos shes pa dang / 'jig rten @171a * //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa dang / sbyor ba de dag nyid la phyir mi ldog pas sran thub pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang bsgrub pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa ste / 'di lta ste dad ba dang snying rje dang / byams pa dang / gtong ba dang / mi skyo ba dang / bstan bcos shes pa dang / 'jig rten @171a * //
translated: 10. shame and abashment, 11. the power of endurance in not turning away from those very practices, 12. worship of the Tathagata with gain, honor, and service, and 13. attendance upon him.

original: shes pa dang / ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa dang / sran thub pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag ni gnas pa yongs su dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa dang / sran thub pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag ni gnas pa yongs su dag par byed pa'o //
translated: These ten dharmas are: 1. faith, 2. compassion, 3. love, 4. relinquishment, 5. indefatigability, 6. knowledge of the scriptures, 7. knowledge of the world, 8. shame and abashment, 9. the power of endurance, and 10. worship and attendance upon the Tathagata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de yang chos de yang dag par blangs te 'dug cing lan mang du byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de yang chos de yang dag par blangs te 'dug cing lan mang du byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva, having taken up these dharmas, remains in them and practices them frequently.

original: de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa dgu po rnams kyi lam gyi yon tan dang skyon gyi rnam pa thams cad sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa dgu po rnams kyi lam gyi yon tan dang skyon gyi rnam pa thams cad sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: He seeks from the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas all the good and bad aspects of the path of the nine abodes of Bodhisattvas, such as the superior morality, etc.

original: de shes nas kyang lam chud mi za zhing rnam pa dang / thob pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i mtshan ma legs par bzung la /
analyzed: de shes nas kyang lam chud mi za zhing rnam pa dang / thob pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i mtshan ma legs par bzung la /
translated: And, knowing them, he does not waste the path. He well grasps the signs of the aspects, the attainment, and the conformity.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang gnas pa thams cad mnan nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang gnas pa thams cad mnan nas /
translated: And, having himself trodden down all the abodes,

original: byang chub chen po bde blag tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub chen po bde blag tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he easily attains the great enlightenment.

original: sems can gyi 'dron po phal po che yang 'khor ba'i dgon pa'i lam las sgrol lo //🔽rnam pa gang dag gis 'jug par byed pa de dag ni rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'dron po phal po che yang 'khor ba'i dgon pa'i lam las sgrol lo // rnam pa gang dag gis 'jug par byed pa de dag ni rnam pa dag go //
translated: And he delivers the great multitude of beings from the path of the wilderness of cyclic existence.🔽The aspects by which he engages are the aspects.

original: 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni 'thob pa'o //
translated: That engagement is the attainment.

original: zhugs nas kyang 'bras bu chen po'i phan yon 'grub pa de ni rgyu mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang 'bras bu chen po'i phan yon 'grub pa de ni rgyu mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And having entered, the great result of benefit is accomplished. This should be known as the natural outflow.🔽By means of two causes, the bodhisattva who is established in this pleasurable state sees many buddhas and perceives many buddha fields.

original: gnas pa de la gnas pa'i rgyu gnyis kyis sangs rgyas mang po bltar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa de la gnas pa'i rgyu gnyis kyis sangs rgyas mang po bltar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The first cause is that he sees the buddhas who appear in the ten directions by means of the eye of flesh.🔽The second cause is that he sees the buddhas who appear in the ten directions by means of the eye of knowledge.

original: des byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las thos pa gang yin pa dag dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ming sna tshogs pa dag na /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las thos pa gang yin pa dag dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ming sna tshogs pa dag na /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in this pleasurable state of superior wisdom also sees many buddhas and perceives many buddha fields.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of flesh.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of knowledge.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan sna tshogs pa dag bzhugs par sems kyis mos pa gang yin pa de dag la dad pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i sems kyis mthong bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod par byed la / de lta bur gyur pa de'i 'dod pa don 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur te / 'di ni rgyu gcig go //
translated: He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.🔽He sees those buddhas by means of the eye of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas gang du 'byung ba der bdag skye bar gyur cig ces de ltar yang sems kyis smon par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gang du 'byung ba der bdag skye bar gyur cig ces de ltar yang sems kyis smon par byed de /
translated: He sees those buddhas by means of

original: de lta bur gyur pa de'i smon lam de ni 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de'i smon lam de ni 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: The prayer of such a one will certainly be fulfilled.

original: des de ltar dad pa rgya chen pos mthong ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa de dag mthong nas mchod pa dang / bde ba'i yo byad kyi rnam pa thams cad sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: des de ltar dad pa rgya chen pos mthong ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa de dag mthong nas mchod pa dang / bde ba'i yo byad kyi rnam pa thams cad sgrub par byed do //
translated: With such vast faith, through the power of seeing and the power of prayer, he sees those Tathagatas and makes offerings to them, and he accomplishes all the requisites of happiness.

original: ci nus ci lcogs kyis dge 'dun la yang bkur sti byed do //
analyzed: ci nus ci lcogs kyis dge 'dun la yang bkur sti byed do //
translated: He honors the Sangha as much as he can.

original: de bzhin gshegs @171b pa de dag las chos kyang nyan pa dang / len pa dang 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @171b pa de dag las chos kyang nyan pa dang / len pa dang 'dzin par byed do //
translated: He hears the Dharma from those Tathagatas, and he takes it up and remembers it.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyang nan tan gyis sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyang nan tan gyis sgrub par byed do //
translated: He practices the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba de thams cad kyang byang chub chen por yongs su sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba de thams cad kyang byang chub chen por yongs su sngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates all those roots of virtue to great enlightenment.

original: bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He brings beings to maturity through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / dge 'dun dang chos la mchod pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / dge 'dun dang chos la mchod pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: and to hold the worship of the Tathagata, the Community, and the Teaching; and to bring beings to maturity by means of the means of gathering disciples; and to dedicate the roots of virtue to enlightenment.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag gis bskal pa du ma bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag rgya cher rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag gis bskal pa du ma bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag rgya cher rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: By these three causes of purification, for many hundreds of thousands of millions of eons, those roots of virtue become purified to a high degree.

original: dper na gser rang bzhin du gnas pa ni gser mgar mkhas pas ji lta ji ltar mer bcug pa de lta de ltar ches rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na gser rang bzhin du gnas pa ni gser mgar mkhas pas ji lta ji ltar mer bcug pa de lta de ltar ches rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, gold that is being refined becomes purer and purer the more it is put into the fire by a skilled goldsmith.

original: de bzhin du bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang rnam par dag pa'i rgyu de dag gis ches rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang rnam par dag pa'i rgyu de dag gis ches rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva whose intention is pure become purer and purer by those causes of purification.

original: de la gnas pa de ni skye ba las phal cher 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa de ni skye ba las phal cher 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: Abiding in that, he becomes a universal monarch, for the most part, in every life.

original: tshe rabs tshe rabs su 'dzam bu gling gi dbang phyug ser sna'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i dri ma thams cad sel ba'i bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs tshe rabs su 'dzam bu gling gi dbang phyug ser sna'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i dri ma thams cad sel ba'i bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: In every life, he becomes the lord of the Rose Apple Land, free from all stains of stinginess, the master who removes all the stains of stinginess of sentient beings.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las gang ci rtsom yang rung /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las gang ci rtsom yang rung /
translated: Whatever he undertakes, from among the four means of gathering disciples,

original: de dag thams cad kyang dkon mchog dang / byang chub yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam pa thams cad yid la byed pa rnams dang mi 'bral te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang dkon mchog dang / byang chub yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam pa thams cad yid la byed pa rnams dang mi 'bral te /
translated: he is never separated from the mental attentions that are the aspects of the complete accomplishment of the Three Jewels and Awakening.

original: bdag sems can thams cad kyi mchog don thams cad ston par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag sems can thams cad kyi mchog don thams cad ston par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam mo //
translated: “Oh, how I wish to be the foremost of all sentient beings, the one who shows all the aims!”

original: 'dod na khyim dang / chung ma dang / longs spyod thams cad spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod na khyim dang / chung ma dang / longs spyod thams cad spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung ste /
translated: If he wishes, he abandons home, wife, and all possessions, and goes forth into the teaching of the Tathāgata.

original: skad cig dang thang cig dang / yud tsam cig la byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug pa dang lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa brgya mthong ba dang / de dag gi sprul pa dang /
analyzed: skad cig dang thang cig dang / yud tsam cig la byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug pa dang lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa brgya mthong ba dang / de dag gi sprul pa dang /
translated: In an instant, a moment, or a second, they can enter a hundred bodhisattva absorptions, with their divine eye see a hundred different buddhafields and the thus-gone ones in them, and with their divine ear listen to the Dharma taught by those thus-gone ones.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyang shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya yang g-yo bar byed @172a * //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyang shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya yang g-yo bar byed @172a * //
translated: In an instant, a moment, or a short period of time, they enter a hundred bodhisattva meditative absorptions, see a hundred different world realms with their divine eye, and know the blessings of a hundred buddhas.🔽They shake a hundred world realms, and with their bodies they travel to a hundred world realms.

original: pa dang ; de bzhin du lus kyis kyang 'gro bar byed pa dang / 'od kyis rgyas par byas nas gzhan dag la ston par byed pa dang / sprul pa brgyas 'dul ba'i sems can brgya yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: pa dang ; de bzhin du lus kyis kyang 'gro bar byed pa dang / 'od kyis rgyas par byas nas gzhan dag la ston par byed pa dang / sprul pa brgyas 'dul ba'i sems can brgya yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
translated: They illuminate a hundred world realms and mature a hundred beings with each emanation.

original: 'dod na bskal pa brgyar yang gnas par byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: 'dod na bskal pa brgyar yang gnas par byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: If they wish, they can remain for a hundred eons.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa brgyar yang ye shes mthong bas 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa brgyar yang ye shes mthong bas 'jug par byed do //
translated: He enters with the vision of wisdom into a hundred eons of the past and the future.

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos kyi sgo rnams kyis chos kyi sgo brgya yang rab tu rnam par byed do //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos kyi sgo rnams kyis chos kyi sgo brgya yang rab tu rnam par byed do //
translated: He illuminates a hundred Dharma doors, such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: lus brgya yang sprul par byed do /
analyzed: lus brgya yang sprul par byed do /
translated: He manifests a hundred bodies.

original: lus re re zhing yang byang chub sems dpa' 'khor brgya brgya ston to //
analyzed: lus re re zhing yang byang chub sems dpa' 'khor brgya brgya ston to //
translated: And in each body he manifests a hundred bodhisattvas.

original: de las lhag par yang rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam gyi stobs kyi mthu'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni tshad med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las lhag par yang rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam gyi stobs kyi mthu'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni tshad med par rig par bya ste /
translated: And beyond that, the emanations of the bodhisattvas who are in this Joyful stage should be known as immeasurable through the power of their prayers.

original: de dag ni smon lam gyi stobs can yin pas smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni smon lam gyi stobs can yin pas smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul par byed do //
translated: For they have the power of prayer and they emanate through the power of their special prayers.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam de dag gi grangs ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyi bar du yang gcad par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam de dag gi grangs ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyi bar du yang gcad par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The number of those perfect aspirations cannot be calculated even in a hundred thousand quintillion eons.🔽Thus, the bodhisattvas’ stage of The Joyful is the accomplishment of the effort of generating the four kinds of thoughts and of making perfect aspirations,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa 'di ni sems bskyed pa rnam pa bzhi dang yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / gnas pa yongs su sbyong ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa 'di ni sems bskyed pa rnam pa bzhi dang yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / gnas pa yongs su sbyong ba dang /
translated: the purification of the stage,🔽the mastery of the other stages,🔽the vision of the buddhas,🔽the purification of the roots of virtue,

original: de ma yin pa'i gnas pa la yang byang ba dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag par byed pa dang / skye ba dang mthus shin tu rnam par nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gnas pa la yang byang ba dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag par byed pa dang / skye ba dang mthus shin tu rnam par nges pa yin te /
translated: and the certainty of birth and power.

original: de ni mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the brief teaching.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni sa bcu'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni sa bcu'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive teaching is as found in the Sūtra on the Ten Stages.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the stage of The Joyful one is born into the family of the buddhas.

original: sa bcu'i mdo las byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: sa bcu'i mdo las byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The Ten Grounds Sutra states:🔽The ten grounds of the bodhisattvas

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi ma mo bstan pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi ma mo bstan pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu ste /
translated: are the ten abodes of the bodhisattvas in this Bodhisattva Canon.

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Beginning with the Joyful One,

original: gnas pa mchog gi bar du go rims bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa mchog gi bar du go rims bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: up to the Supreme One should be understood in sequence.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bzung ba'i don gyis ni sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su bzung ba'i don gyis ni sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of “ground” is that which is fully possessed by the bodhisattvas,

original: longs spyod pa'i gnas kyi don gyis ni gnas @172b pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa'i rnam pa ni gang dag yin /🔽rtags ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i gnas kyi don gyis ni gnas @172b pa zhes bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa'i rnam pa ni gang dag yin / rtags ni gang dag yin /
translated: and the meaning of “abode” is the place of enjoyment.

original: mtshan ma ni gang dag yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gang dag yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Here, what are the aspects, what are the signs, and what are the indications of the bodhisattvas’ superior morality?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas thog ma nyid du rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la sems kyi bsam pa rnam pa bcus bsam pa dag pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas thog ma nyid du rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la sems kyi bsam pa rnam pa bcus bsam pa dag pa thob pa yin te /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva first attains a pure attitude on the ground of the joyful one through ten mental states.

original: slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / sbyin gnas thams cad la mi bslu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / chos mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la nges pa dang 'grogs na bde ba'i bsam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ;
analyzed: slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / sbyin gnas thams cad la mi bslu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / chos mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la nges pa dang 'grogs na bde ba'i bsam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ;
translated: He has the superior attitude of never deceiving any master, guru, or one worthy of respect; the attitude of being happy to associate with bodhisattvas who have the same Dharma; the attitude of being free of the afflictions and

original: bdud kyi las thams cad zil gyis mnan cing /
analyzed: bdud kyi las thams cad zil gyis mnan cing /
translated: subduing all the activities of Mara;

original: rang gi sems la dbang bya ba'i bsam pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la nyes pa'i bsam pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon gyi bsam pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dge ba rnams bsgom pa la rtag tu bya ba'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi sems la dbang bya ba'i bsam pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la nyes pa'i bsam pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon gyi bsam pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dge ba rnams bsgom pa la rtag tu bya ba'i bsam pa dang /
translated: the attitude of controlling his own mind; the attitude of seeing faults in all compounded things; the attitude of seeing the benefits of nirvana; the attitude of constantly cultivating the virtuous dharmas that are the factors of enlightenment;

original: sgom pa de dag nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rab tu dben pa'i bsam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi zang zing dang / thos pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti thams cad la mi lta ba'i bsam pa dang / theg pa dman pa spangs te theg pa chen po rtogs par bya ba'i bsam pa dang /🔽sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad bya ba'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: sgom pa de dag nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rab tu dben pa'i bsam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi zang zing dang / thos pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti thams cad la mi lta ba'i bsam pa dang / theg pa dman pa spangs te theg pa chen po rtogs par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad bya ba'i bsam pa ste /
translated: The attitude of these meditations is fivefold:🔽the attitude of solitude, which is in conformity with these meditations;🔽the attitude of not looking at any worldly material things, learning, gain or honor;🔽the attitude of abandoning the Hinayana and realizing the Mahayana;🔽the attitude of working for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: yang dag pa'i bsam pa bcu po 'di dag ni sems de la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bsam pa bcu po 'di dag ni sems de la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: These ten correct thoughts are the entry to that thought.

original: de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes bya'o //
