translated: They are called the pure superior thought.

original: bsam pa de dag nyid che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa sa gnyis pa la 'jug cing gnon to //
analyzed: bsam pa de dag nyid che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa sa gnyis pa la 'jug cing gnon to //
translated: By the greatness of these very thoughts and their completion, the bodhisattva enters and ascends to the second stage, the stage of Stainless.

original: de lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa las rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can yin te /
analyzed: de lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa las rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can yin te /
translated: He is naturally moral because of his morality in the stage of Stainless.

original: log pa'i las kyi lam du gtogs pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims chung ngu yang kun du mi spyod na /
analyzed: log pa'i las kyi lam du gtogs pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims chung ngu yang kun du mi spyod na /
translated: He does not even commit the slightest immorality that is included in the wrong path of action,

original: 'bring ngam chen po lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'bring ngam chen po lta ci smos /
translated: much less the medium or great forms.

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu yongs su rdzogs pa dag la yang rang bzhin gyis yang dag par snang ngo //🔽des de ltar rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can gyi shes rab kyis ngan 'gro rnams dang / bde 'gro rnams dang / theg pa gsum po dag la nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i las kyi lam rnams kyi las @173a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu yongs su rdzogs pa dag la yang rang bzhin gyis yang dag par snang ngo // des de ltar rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can gyi shes rab kyis ngan 'gro rnams dang / bde 'gro rnams dang / theg pa gsum po dag la nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i las kyi lam rnams kyi las @173a * //
translated: He also naturally appears to be completely endowed with the ten virtuous paths of action.

original: kun du spyod pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus, through his wisdom of naturally pure morality, he correctly knows, just as it is, the establishment of the results of actions that are produced from the causes of engaging in the paths of action that are afflicted or unafflicted in the three miserable realms, in the happy realms, and in the three vehicles.

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu las kyang las de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu las kyang las de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He also correctly knows, just as it is, those actions in terms of their results of karmic maturation and results that are in accordance with the causal action.

original: bdag nyid kyang mi dge ba'i las spong ba dang / dge ba'i las yang dag par len par yang dag par snang la /🔽gzhan dag kyang de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mi dge ba'i las spong ba dang / dge ba'i las yang dag par len par yang dag par snang la / gzhan dag kyang de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud bar 'dod cing /
translated: He himself is seen to abandon nonvirtuous actions and to take up virtuous actions.

original: yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
translated: He wishes to introduce others to those very things and he introduces them to them.

original: phongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phongs par gnas pa la snying brtse zhing /
analyzed: phongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phongs par gnas pa la snying brtse zhing /
translated: He is compassionate toward those who are in various kinds of distress.

original: snying brtse ba rgya chen po thob nas las mi mthun pa kun du spyod pa'i nyes pa'i skyon chags pa'i sems can gyi khams dar ba'am rgud par gnas pa thams cad la bye brag med par don dam par sdug bsngal ba yin par so sor rtog go //
analyzed: snying brtse ba rgya chen po thob nas las mi mthun pa kun du spyod pa'i nyes pa'i skyon chags pa'i sems can gyi khams dar ba'am rgud par gnas pa thams cad la bye brag med par don dam par sdug bsngal ba yin par so sor rtog go //
translated: Having attained a great compassion, he thoroughly investigates the ultimate suffering of all beings, regardless of whether they are in a prosperous or wretched condition, who are afflicted by the fault of engaging in actions that are not in accord with the Dharma.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa de la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa de la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The vision of the buddhas that is attained by abiding in superior morality and the purification of the roots of virtue should be understood as described earlier.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: However, there is a difference.

original: dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas nag tshur gyis bskus nas mer bcug na /
analyzed: dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas nag tshur gyis bskus nas mer bcug na /
translated: For example, when that very gold is anointed with black collyrium and put into fire by a skilled goldsmith,

original: shas cher ches rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de shas cher rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shas cher ches rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de shas cher rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: it becomes much more pure. In the same way, it should be understood that the roots of virtue of that bodhisattva become much more pure.

original: gnas pa de la sems kyi bsam pa dag pa sgrub pa la 'jug pa ni skye bas phal cher gling bzhi pa'i 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa de la sems kyi bsam pa dag pa sgrub pa la 'jug pa ni skye bas phal cher gling bzhi pa'i 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that stage, the bodhisattva who is engaged in accomplishing the purity of mental intention is mostly born as a world-emperor in the four continents,

original: shas cher sems can rnams 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams las zlog par byed cing /
analyzed: shas cher sems can rnams 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams las zlog par byed cing /
translated: and he mostly turns beings away from immorality and the paths of non-virtuous actions,

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams la yang yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams la yang yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
translated: and he correctly establishes them in the paths of virtuous actions.

original: de'i mthu ni snga ma las bcu 'gyur du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i mthu ni snga ma las bcu 'gyur du rig par bya ste /
translated: His power should be understood as ten times greater than before.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dri ma'i rnam pa thams cad sel ba dang / las kyi lam thams cad kyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i rnam pa thams cad shes pa so sor rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dri ma'i rnam pa thams cad sel ba dang / las kyi lam thams cad kyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i rnam pa thams cad shes pa so sor rtogs pa dang /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas' superior morality is natural morality, the removal of all the aspects of the stain of immorality, the understanding of the causes and effects of all the paths of action, and the understanding of the results of all the paths of action.

original: dge ba'i las la gzhan yang dag par 'dzud par 'dod pa dang / snying brtse ba rgya chen po thob pa dang / sems can gyi khams kyi las las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / phongs pa la rtog pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam @173b par dag pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i las la gzhan yang dag par 'dzud par 'dod pa dang / snying brtse ba rgya chen po thob pa dang / sems can gyi khams kyi las las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / phongs pa la rtog pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam @173b par dag pa dang /
translated: It is the desire to introduce others to virtuous actions, the attainment of vast compassion, the investigation of the suffering and misfortune of the realm of sentient beings that arises from karma, and the purity of the roots of virtue.

original: skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as taught in brief in terms of birth and power.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows.

original: mdo nyid las sa bcu'i sa dri ma med pa'i sa las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo nyid las sa bcu'i sa dri ma med pa'i sa las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is as it is taught in the sutra itself, in the chapter on the stage of stainlessness, the tenth stage.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is free from the stain of immorality,🔽it is called the stage of spotless.

original: dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya ba la 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya ba la 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is free from the stain of immorality, it is called the stage of spotless.

original: de la dri ma med pa'i sa gang yin pa de 'dir lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa'i rnam pa ni gang dag yin /🔽rtags ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa'i sa gang yin pa de 'dir lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa'i rnam pa ni gang dag yin / rtags ni gang dag yin /
translated: Here, the stage of spotless should be understood as the stage of superior morality.

original: mtshan ma ni gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the aspects, what are the signs, what are the marks of the bodhisattvas' stage of superior mind?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nyid du lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa la bsam pa dag pa bcu po gang dag yid la byas shing brten te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nyid du lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa la bsam pa dag pa bcu po gang dag yid la byas shing brten te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattvas, first of all, on the stage of superior morality, having taken up and kept in mind the ten pure attitudes,

original: rtogs par gyur pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa de dag gzhan rnam pa bcus che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas /
analyzed: rtogs par gyur pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa de dag gzhan rnam pa bcus che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas /
translated: The bodhisattva's attention to the realization of his own mental attitude is superior to that of others in ten ways, and it is complete.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi gnas pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi gnas pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Having transcended the stage of superior morality, he enters the stage of superior mind.

original: rnam pa bcus bdag gi sems kyi bsam pa dag par gyur to snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag gi bsam pa dge ba rnam pa bcu po 'di las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha ma yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus bdag gi sems kyi bsam pa dag par gyur to snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag gi bsam pa dge ba rnam pa bcu po 'di las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha ma yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
translated: He thinks, “My mental attitude has become pure in ten ways,” and he thinks, “I will not fall away from these ten virtuous mental attitudes.”

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug cing mi mthun par yang gnas so snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / de'i gnyen po bsgom pa la yang bdag gi rnam par shes pa yang dag par gnas so snyam pa'i bsam pa yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug cing mi mthun par yang gnas so snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / de'i gnyen po bsgom pa la yang bdag gi rnam par shes pa yang dag par gnas so snyam pa'i bsam pa yid la byed pa dang /
translated: He thinks, “My mind does not engage with or dwell on the impure dharmas,” and he thinks, “My consciousness is well established in the cultivation of their antidotes.”

original: bdag ni gnyen po 'di las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha ma yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag ni 'di ltar gnyen po brtan por gyur pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos de dag thams cad dang / bdud thams cad kyis zil gyis non par 'gyur ba'i cha ma yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag ni gnyen po 'di las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha ma yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag ni 'di ltar gnyen po brtan por gyur pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos de dag thams cad dang / bdud thams cad kyis zil gyis non par 'gyur ba'i cha ma yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
translated: I am not on the side of being overcome by all those contaminated phenomena and all the demons, since I have such a firm antidote.🔽  My mind enters into all the qualities of the Buddha without timidity.🔽  All the hardships I undergo do not harm me.

original: bdag gi yid ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la zhum pa med par 'jug go snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa thams cad kyang bdag la gnod pa med do snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag ni sems rtse gcig tu nges pas theg pa chen po la mos kyi /🔽de @174a * //
analyzed: bdag gi yid ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la zhum pa med par 'jug go snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa thams cad kyang bdag la gnod pa med do snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag ni sems rtse gcig tu nges pas theg pa chen po la mos kyi /🔽de @174a * //
translated: I am intent on the Great Vehicle with a one-pointed mind.

original: ma yin pa'i theg pa dman pa rnams la ni ma yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag gi sems ni sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad bya ba la mngon par dga'o snyam pa'i yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i theg pa dman pa rnams la ni ma yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang / bdag gi sems ni sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad bya ba la mngon par dga'o snyam pa'i yid la byed pa ste /
translated: and not for those of the inferior vehicles.

original: sems kyi bsam pa bcu po de dag gis 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa bcu po de dag gis 'jug par bya'o //
translated: With these ten mental orientations, he enters.

original: lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du byed thams cad la nyes dmigs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sun 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du byed thams cad la nyes dmigs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sun 'byin par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the superior mind of aspiration, by means of various kinds of faults, repudiates all the formative forces.

original: de dag las yid skyo bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag las yid skyo bar byed do //
translated: He becomes disenchanted with them and turns his mind away from them.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la phan yon rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phan yon du lta zhing de la 'dod pa skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la phan yon rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phan yon du lta zhing de la 'dod pa skyes pa yin no //
translated: He views the wisdom of the Buddha as beneficial by means of various kinds of benefits and generates a desire for it.

original: snying thag pa nas 'dun pas sems can gyi khams la sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal bar rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: snying thag pa nas 'dun pas sems can gyi khams la sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal bar rnam par blta'o //
translated: With a mind that is intent on it, he views the world of sentient beings as suffering by means of various kinds of suffering.

original: sems can de dag la lta ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can de dag la lta ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He has a mind that looks upon those sentient beings.

original: 'du byed thams cad la bag yod pa dang / don la rton pa'i sems dang / byang chub kyi phyir brtson 'grus 'bar ba yin /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la bag yod pa dang / don la rton pa'i sems dang / byang chub kyi phyir brtson 'grus 'bar ba yin /
translated: He is heedful with regard to all compounded things, has a mind that relies on the meaning, and has blazing diligence for the sake of enlightenment.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje'i bsam pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje'i bsam pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He has a vast attitude of compassion for sentient beings.

original: sems can de dag gtan du sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar bya ba'i thabs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma bsgribs pa'i ye shes kho na yin par mthong ba yin /
analyzed: sems can de dag gtan du sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar bya ba'i thabs ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma bsgribs pa'i ye shes kho na yin par mthong ba yin /
translated: He sees that the method for liberating those sentient beings from suffering forever is nothing but wisdom that is unobscured by any of the afflictions.

original: rnam par thar pa de yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings la rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba thams cad kyi gnyen po ni shes rab yin par mthong ba yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa de yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings la rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba thams cad kyi gnyen po ni shes rab yin par mthong ba yin /
translated: He sees that wisdom is the antidote to the arising of all the causes of conceptualization in the dharma-dhātu, which is the accomplishment of that liberation.

original: ye shes kyi snang ba de 'grub par byed pa ni yang dag par ting nge 'dzin yin par mthong ba yin /
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba de 'grub par byed pa ni yang dag par ting nge 'dzin yin par mthong ba yin /
translated: He sees that the accomplishment of that appearance of wisdom is right samādhi.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag sgrub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod nyan pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / nyan pa'i gzhi yin par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag sgrub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod nyan pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / nyan pa'i gzhi yin par mthong ba yin no //
translated: He sees that the attainment of those meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions is preceded by listening to the bodhisattva collection of scriptures and is based on listening.

original: mthong nas kyang brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pas thos pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pas thos pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Having seen that, he seeks learning by undertaking great effort.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i phyir rdzas dang yo byad dang / nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po gang yongs su mi gtong ba de med do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i phyir rdzas dang yo byad dang / nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po gang yongs su mi gtong ba de med do //
translated: There is nothing internal or external that he will not give up in order to listen to the true Dharma.

original: bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba gang nyams su mi len pa de med do //
analyzed: bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba gang nyams su mi len pa de med do //
translated: There is no service to a teacher that he will not perform.

original: 'dun pa gang nyams su mi len pa de med do //
analyzed: 'dun pa gang nyams su mi len pa de med do //
translated: There is no desire that he will not fulfill.

original: lus kyi gnod pa gang nyams su mi len pa de med do //
analyzed: lus kyi gnod pa gang nyams su mi len pa de med do //
translated: There is no bodily injury that he will not undergo.

original: de ni tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su @174b bcad pa gcig thos pas kyang ches dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su @174b bcad pa gcig thos pas kyang ches dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: He is even more pleased to hear a single four-line verse of the Dharma than if he were to obtain in his hands a treasure filling the three-thousand great one-thousand worlds.

original: stong gsum po gang ba dang mnyam pa'i rin po che'i phung po chen pos ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: stong gsum po gang ba dang mnyam pa'i rin po che'i phung po chen pos ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But not so much as a heap of jewels filling the three-thousandfold world.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig tsam gros pas ni ches dga' bar 'gyur gyi brgya byin nyid dang / tshangs pa nyid dang / bdud nyid dang /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig tsam gros pas ni ches dga' bar 'gyur gyi brgya byin nyid dang / tshangs pa nyid dang / bdud nyid dang /
translated: And if one were to teach just one word of the Dharma that purifies the bodhisattva’s conduct as taught by the perfect Buddha, that would be much more delightful than attaining the status of Śakra, Brahmā, or Māra,

original: 'jig rten skyong ba nyid dang / 'khor los sgyur ba nyid kyi lus thob pa rnams kyis ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba nyid dang / 'khor los sgyur ba nyid kyi lus thob pa rnams kyis ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: or of a Lokapāla, or of a wheel-turning emperor.

original: gal te de la la la zhig 'di skad du ji ste khyed me dong chen por bdag nyid 'dor bar byed dam /
analyzed: gal te de la la la zhig 'di skad du ji ste khyed me dong chen por bdag nyid 'dor bar byed dam /
translated: If someone were to say to him, “If you throw yourself into a great pit of fire,

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa chen po nyams su len par byed na ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa chen po nyams su len par byed na ni /
translated: and undergo great suffering and harm,

original: 'di ltar ngas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig 'di khyod la bsgrags so zhes zer ba thos na yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig 'di khyod la bsgrags so zhes zer ba thos na yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: If I hear the words of the Dharma taught by the perfect Buddha, which purify the conduct of the bodhisattvas, I will think:

original: bdag gis chos kyi tshig 'di'i phyir snga ma bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po gang ba dang mnyam pa'i me dong du yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag nyid dor bar spro na /
analyzed: bdag gis chos kyi tshig 'di'i phyir snga ma bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po gang ba dang mnyam pa'i me dong du yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag nyid dor bar spro na /
translated: ‘For the sake of these words of the Dharma, I would joyfully throw myself from the Brahma realm into a great mass of fire equal to the trichiliocosm, as described above.

original: ngan don gyi nang du lta ci smos /
analyzed: ngan don gyi nang du lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention the minor sufferings of this world?

original: bdag gis sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal la gnas pa dang yang bsngos te /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal la gnas pa dang yang bsngos te /
translated: I would even return to the sufferings of the hells for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su btsal dgos na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su btsal dgos na /
translated: If I must seek out the teachings of the Buddha,

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa phal pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa phal pa lta ci smos te /
translated: what need is there to mention the minor sufferings of this world?

original: de lta bu'i brtson 'grus brtsams pas chos rnams yongs su btsal nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i brtson 'grus brtsams pas chos rnams yongs su btsal nas /
translated: With such diligence, I will seek out the teachings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni 'di ltar chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la brten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni 'di ltar chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la brten pa yin gyi /
translated: The qualities of the Buddha are like this: they are based on the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tshig 'bru dang sgra tsam gyis rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no snyam du de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed do //
analyzed: tshig 'bru dang sgra tsam gyis rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no snyam du de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed do //
translated: They are not purified by mere words and sounds.

original: de ltar rig nas thos pa de nyid la brten te /
analyzed: de ltar rig nas thos pa de nyid la brten te /
translated: In this way, having understood this, based on that learning,

original: chos kyi mtshan ma rnams la yang dag par dmigs pa byas nas /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan ma rnams la yang dag par dmigs pa byas nas /
translated: having correctly observed the signs of the Dharma,

original: 'dod pa rnams las dben pa dang / rgyas par 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las dben pa dang / rgyas par 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang /
translated: he practices the four dhyānas and four formless concentrations of the worldly path, the four immeasurables,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and the five superknowledges, and abides in them.

original: de de dag gis lan mang du gnas te /
analyzed: de de dag gis lan mang du gnas te /
translated: He abides in them many times.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag las bzlog na /🔽smon lam gyi @175a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag las bzlog na / smon lam gyi @175a * //
translated: When they turn away from those meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions,🔽they are reborn in the desire realm through the power of their vows,

original: dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams gang du sems can gyi don byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba mthong ba der skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams gang du sems can gyi don byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba mthong ba der skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: wherever they see that they can complete the perfection of the factors of awakening for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de de dag gi dbang gis skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de dag gi dbang gis skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not reborn through the power of those meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'ching ba rnams spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'ching ba rnams spangs pa yin la /
translated: Because they are free from desire realm attachment, they have abandoned the fetters of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las bzlog pa'i phyir srid pa'i 'ching ba rnams spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las bzlog pa'i phyir srid pa'i 'ching ba rnams spangs pa yin no //
translated: Because they have turned away from those meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions, they have abandoned the fetters of existence.

original: de ni thog ma mos pas spyod pa'i sa nyid nas chos kyi de bzhin nyid la mos pa'i phyir lta ba las gyur pa'i 'ching ba rnams spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni thog ma mos pas spyod pa'i sa nyid nas chos kyi de bzhin nyid la mos pa'i phyir lta ba las gyur pa'i 'ching ba rnams spangs pa yin no //
translated: From the very beginning, on the stage of action in faith, he has eliminated the bonds of view by his faith in the suchness of things.

original: log pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni de la gtan mi 'byung ngo /
analyzed: log pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni de la gtan mi 'byung ngo /
translated: He is never affected by false attachment, aversion, or confusion.

original: de'i sangs rgyas mthong ba nas rgyas par dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sangs rgyas mthong ba nas rgyas par dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: His vision of the Buddha, and so on, and the purification of his roots of virtue should be understood as above.

original: de la bye bra ga ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye bra ga ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there is a difference.

original: dper na gser mgar mkhas pa'i lag na yod pa'i gser de nyid dri ma dang skyon bag kyang zad la skye bri med par tshad mnyam pa de bzhin du de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na gser mgar mkhas pa'i lag na yod pa'i gser de nyid dri ma dang skyon bag kyang zad la skye bri med par tshad mnyam pa de bzhin du de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the gold in the hands of the skilled goldsmith, free from all impurities and flaws, is ready to be used, so should the bodhisattva’s purified roots of virtue be understood.

original: skye bas ni phal cher lha'i dbang po brgya byin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bas ni phal cher lha'i dbang po brgya byin du 'gyur te /
translated: By rebirth, he is usually born as Śakra, lord of the gods,

original: sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bzlog pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bzlog pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: and is skilled in turning beings away from attachment to sense pleasures.

original: mthu ni gnas pa snga ma gang la stong du bstan pa de 'dir 'bum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthu ni gnas pa snga ma gang la stong du bstan pa de 'dir 'bum du rig par bya'o //
translated: The power is that whatever was taught as a thousand in the previous stage should be known here as a hundred thousand.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa 'di ni sems kyi yid la byed pa 'grub pa la 'jug pa dang / 'du byed dang / sems can gyi khams dang / byang chub chen po yang dag par so sor rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa 'di ni sems kyi yid la byed pa 'grub pa la 'jug pa dang / 'du byed dang / sems can gyi khams dang / byang chub chen po yang dag par so sor rtogs pa dang /
translated: This stage of superior mind of the bodhisattvas is the entry into the accomplishment of mental attention, the correct realization of the realms of formations and sentient beings and of great enlightenment,

original: sems can sdug bsngal las rnam par thar par bya ba'i thabs yang dag par yongs su tshol ba dang / gus pa chen pos yongs su tshol ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos nan tan du sgrub ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal las rnam par thar par bya ba'i thabs yang dag par yongs su tshol ba dang / gus pa chen pos yongs su tshol ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos nan tan du sgrub ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: the correct search for the means to liberate sentient beings from suffering, the search with great respect, the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, and the mundane meditative absorptions and liberations.

original: rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa la gnas pa dang / de las bzlog nas smon lam gyis gang du 'dod par skye ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa la gnas pa dang / de las bzlog nas smon lam gyis gang du 'dod par skye ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: and the accomplishment of the liberations, concentrations, meditative attainments, and superknowledges, and the reversal of those, and the birth in any place desired through the power of vows, and the purification of the roots of virtue,🔽and the birth, and the power.

original: skye ba dang / mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //🔽rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o // rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood as it is found in the sutra.

original: sa bcu'i mdo sa'i 'od byed pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bcu'i mdo sa'i 'od byed pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is like that found in the Sutra of the Ten Stages, in the stage called Shining.

original: @175b sa de ni thos pa'i rnam pa'i chos kyi snang ba gsal ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi snang ba gsal bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @175b sa de ni thos pa'i rnam pa'i chos kyi snang ba gsal ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi snang ba gsal bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That stage is called Shining because it is distinguished by the shining of the Dharma through the aspects of learning and by the shining of concentration.

original: nang gi sems rnam par dag pa la brten nas de 'od dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: nang gi sems rnam par dag pa la brten nas de 'od dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: And because it is endowed with light, based on the inner purity of mind.

original: de lta bas na gnas pa de lhag pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa de lhag pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that stage is called the stage of superior mind.

original: gang gi don gyis 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i don de nyid kyis lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi don gyis 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i don de nyid kyis lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the stage of the bright one is the stage of superior mind, because of the meaning of the word bright.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' stage of superior wisdom endowed with the factors of enlightenment?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thos pa yongs su btsal ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thos pa yongs su btsal ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, in the context of seeking learning,

original: lhag pa'i sems la dbang du gnas pa la thog ma nyid du chos la snang ba 'jug pa bcu po thob pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la dbang du gnas pa la thog ma nyid du chos la snang ba 'jug pa bcu po thob pa yin te /
translated: first attains the ten kinds of light of the Dharma on the stage of superior mind.

original: de dag che ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa las 'das nas /
analyzed: de dag che ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa las 'das nas /
translated: Because they are great and perfect, he transcends the stage of superior mind

original: lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa dang po la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa dang po la 'jug pa'o //
translated: and enters the first stage of superior wisdom.

original: chos la snang ba 'jug pa bcu po de dag kyang gzhung ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba de kho na bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos la snang ba 'jug pa bcu po de dag kyang gzhung ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba de kho na bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The ten kinds of light of the Dharma should be understood as they are explained in the scriptures.

original: gang dag 'dogs pa dang gang du 'dogs pa dang de dag kyang don dam par gang dang mnyam pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas gang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang dag 'dogs pa dang gang du 'dogs pa dang de dag kyang don dam par gang dang mnyam pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas gang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The meaning of the above is as follows:🔽The basis of imputation, that which is imputed, the manner in which they are imputed, the fact that they are all the same in the ultimate, the defilement and purification by which they become defiled and purified,

original: gang dang ldan pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag pa bla na med pa gang gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag pa bla na med pa gang gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: the defilement and purification that possess them, and the unsurpassed purification by which they are purified.

original: chos la snang ba bstan pa de dag gi don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos la snang ba bstan pa de dag gi don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the summary of the meaning of the teachings on the illumination of phenomena.

original: gnas pa de la gnas pa de ni mi phyed pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos mdo sde las ji skad 'byung ba rnam pa bcu dang ldan pas ye shes yongs su smin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa de la gnas pa de ni mi phyed pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos mdo sde las ji skad 'byung ba rnam pa bcu dang ldan pas ye shes yongs su smin pa'i phyir /
translated: Abiding in that state, one possesses the ten qualities that ripen the wisdom explained in the sutras, such as the indivisible intention and so on.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rab tu grub ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rab tu grub ba yin no //
translated: And by attaining the Dharma that is its very nature, he is fully established in the family of the Tathagatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lta ba rnam pa thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du bsgom mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lta ba rnam pa thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du bsgom mo //
translated: With regard to the Bodhisattva’s view, he cultivates the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, such as the applications of mindfulness, in accordance with the sutras, taking all aspects of the view into account.

original: des chos de dag thabs kyis yongs su zin pas bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des chos de dag thabs kyis yongs su zin pas bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he cultivates these factors of enlightenment with skillful means,

original: de 'jig tshogs la lta ba shin tu cha phra ba dang / @176a * //
analyzed: de 'jig tshogs la lta ba shin tu cha phra ba dang / @176a * //
translated: he completely abandons the view of the transitory composite,

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / g-yo ba thams cad kun du mi spyod pas gtan du spong bar byed do //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / g-yo ba thams cad kun du mi spyod pas gtan du spong bar byed do //
translated: as well as all the subtle forms of clinging to the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on, and all the movements of the mind.

original: de rnams spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa'i las gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du mi spyod do //
analyzed: de rnams spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa'i las gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du mi spyod do //
translated: By abandoning these, he completely avoids all the actions that are condemned by the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par byed do //
translated: All those who are praised by the Tathagata are engaged in the real.

original: de ltar gyur na de bas kyang shas cher sems 'jam pa dang / mnyen pa dang / las su rung bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na de bas kyang shas cher sems 'jam pa dang / mnyen pa dang / las su rung bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the mind becomes even more pliant, malleable, and workable.

original: de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems shin tu rnam par dag par gyur na byas pa gzo ba dang ; byas pa tshor ba la sogs pas de'i bsam pa dang mthun pa'i dkar po'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems shin tu rnam par dag par gyur na byas pa gzo ba dang ; byas pa tshor ba la sogs pas de'i bsam pa dang mthun pa'i dkar po'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind becomes very pure in this way through various means, it becomes endowed with various virtuous qualities such as gratitude and appreciation.

original: sa gong ma yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i las rnams kyang yang dag par yongs su tshol zhing brtson 'grus rtsom pa chen po thob ste gnas so //
analyzed: sa gong ma yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i las rnams kyang yang dag par yongs su tshol zhing brtson 'grus rtsom pa chen po thob ste gnas so //
translated: He also seeks the activities that purify the higher stages and attains and maintains great exertion.

original: gzhi des de'i bsam pa dang ; lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa'i khams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi des de'i bsam pa dang ; lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa'i khams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this basis, his intention, superior intention, and aspiration are fulfilled.

original: gzhi des kyang bstan pa'i dgrar gyur pa mu stegs can dang bdud thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs shing mi bskyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi des kyang bstan pa'i dgrar gyur pa mu stegs can dang bdud thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs shing mi bskyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And on that basis, no one can steal away or shake the bodhisattva, not even all the non-Buddhists and demons who are enemies of the teaching.

original: sangs rgyas mthong ba nas rgyas par dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong ba nas rgyas par dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The vision of the Buddhas, and the purification of the roots of good, should be understood as above.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /🔽dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas rgyan gyi rnam par byas pa ni rgyan du ma byas pa'i gser rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni de las gzhan pa'i byis pa'i gnas la gnas🔽pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de / dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas rgyan gyi rnam par byas pa ni rgyan du ma byas pa'i gser rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni de las gzhan pa'i byis pa'i gnas la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
translated: But there is this difference.🔽Just as that gold, fashioned into ornaments by a skilled goldsmith, cannot be surpassed by any gold not so fashioned, in the same way, the roots of goodness of that bodhisattva cannot be surpassed by the roots of goodness of any other bodhisattvas who are in the stages of lesser spiritual practice.🔽Just as the light of the sun cannot be surpassed by the light of the stars, in the same way, the light of the Dharma teaching of that bodhisattva cannot be surpassed by the Dharma teaching of any of the hearers and solitary illuminates.

original: dper na nor bu rin po che snang ba rab tu gtong ba ni de ma yin pa'i nor bu rnams kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
analyzed: dper na nor bu rin po che snang ba rab tu gtong ba ni de ma yin pa'i nor bu rnams kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
translated: Just as the light of the sun cannot be surpassed by the light of the planets and houses, in the same way, the light of the Dharma teaching of that bodhisattva cannot be surpassed by the Dharma teaching of any other bodhisattvas who are in the stages of lesser spiritual practice.

original: rlung dang chu dang char pa rnams kyis 'od mi chod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
analyzed: rlung dang chu dang char pa rnams kyis 'od mi chod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
translated: Just as the light of the sun and moon cannot be obscured by the wind, water, and clouds, in the same way, the light of the bodhisattva’s wisdom cannot be obscured by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: shes rab kyi snang ba yang bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis mi chod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba yang bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis mi chod pa yin no //
translated: And the light of wisdom cannot be obscured by all the māras and opponents.

original: skye bas ni lha'i rgyal po rab 'thab bral du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bas ni lha'i rgyal po rab 'thab bral du 'gyur te /
translated: By birth, he becomes the king of the gods, Suyāma.

original: sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam par bzlog pa la mkhas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam par bzlog pa la mkhas so //
translated: He is skilled in turning beings away from the view of the transitory collection.

original: mthu ni gnas pa snga ma @176b gang du 'bum 'gyur du bstan pa de 'dir bye bar bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mthu ni gnas pa snga ma @176b gang du 'bum 'gyur du bstan pa de 'dir bye bar bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: The power is to be known as a hundred thousand times the previous abode, here taught as ten million.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa 'di ni chos la snang ba 'jug pa 'grub pa thob pa dang / ye shes yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos brten pa dang /🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / g-yo ba thams cad spangs pa dang / bkag pa dang / gnang ba'i las rnam par spong ba dang / brten pa dang gzhi des sems mnyen par 'gyur ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i yon tan yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa 'di ni chos la snang ba 'jug pa 'grub pa thob pa dang / ye shes yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos brten pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / g-yo ba thams cad spangs pa dang / bkag pa dang / gnang ba'i las rnam par spong ba dang / brten pa dang gzhi des sems mnyen par 'gyur ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i yon tan yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
translated: This is the bodhisattvas' abiding in superior wisdom that is conducive to enlightenment. It is the attainment of the accomplishment of the entry of light into phenomena, the full maturation of gnosis, and the support of the factors of enlightenment.🔽It is the abandonment of all attachment to the view of the transitory composite and so on, the abandonment of all movement, the abandonment of actions that are prohibited and permitted, and the support of the basis.

original: sa yongs su dag par byed pa'i las yongs su tshol ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: sa yongs su dag par byed pa'i las yongs su tshol ba las brtsams te /
translated: It is the flexibility of the mind through that basis, the accomplishment of the qualities that are in harmony with it, and the search for the activity that purifies the bhūmis.

original: brtson 'grus chen po brtsams pa dang / gzhi des bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mos pa rnam par dag par byed pa dang / gzhi des bstan pa'i dgra thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po brtsams pa dang / gzhi des bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mos pa rnam par dag par byed pa dang / gzhi des bstan pa'i dgra thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: great effort, by means of which he purifies his intention, superior intention, and faith; by means of which he cannot be led astray by any opponents; by means of which he purifies his roots of virtue;

original: skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and by means of which he is born in the world of desire and manifests his own power.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni sa bcu'i 'od 'phro can las ji skad bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni sa bcu'i 'od 'phro can las ji skad bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The extensive explanation is as it is taught in the Sūtra on the Ten Stages in the stage called “Shining.”

original: sa de la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bar gyur pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos ston pas 'jig rten rnams la shes rab kyi snang ba byed pas na de'i phyir sa de la 'od 'phro can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa de la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bar gyur pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos ston pas 'jig rten rnams la shes rab kyi snang ba byed pas na de'i phyir sa de la 'od 'phro can zhes bya ste /
translated: In that stage, the factors that contribute to enlightenment become the light of wisdom, and by teaching the true Dharma, he illuminates the world with the light of wisdom. Therefore, that stage is called “Shining.”

original: de nyid 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is what is meant here by “the stage of superior wisdom that is the factors that contribute to enlightenment.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gnyis pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gnyis pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' second stage, which is called The Stainless?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa snga ma la rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu thob pa gang yin pa de dag che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gnyis pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa snga ma la rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu thob pa gang yin pa de dag che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gnyis pa la 'jug go //
translated: Here the bodhisattva, by the greatness and perfection of the ten equalities of attitude toward the purity attained in the previous stage of superior wisdom, enters the second stage of superior wisdom.

original: rnam par dag pa las bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu'i gzhung ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa las bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu'i gzhung ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The ten equalities of attitude toward purity should be understood according to the sutra.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni mnyam pa med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / mnyam pa de ma yin pa'i sems can gyi khams las yang dag par 'das pa dang / chos gang dag dang ji ltar mnyam pa 'di ni rnam @177a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni mnyam pa med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / mnyam pa de ma yin pa'i sems can gyi khams las yang dag par 'das pa dang / chos gang dag dang ji ltar mnyam pa 'di ni rnam @177a * //
translated: The buddhas are beyond the realm of sentient beings who are equal to them and who are not equal to them.

original: par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rnams kyi don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rnams kyi don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the sutra should be understood as the equality of the pure realms.

original: gnas pa de la gnas pa de ni phyir zhing ye shes khyad par can 'dod pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rnam pa bcur yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gnas pa de la gnas pa de ni phyir zhing ye shes khyad par can 'dod pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rnam pa bcur yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Abiding in that state, he, desiring superior wisdom, correctly knows the four noble truths in ten aspects.

original: gzhung ni mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du thams cad rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhung ni mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du thams cad rig par bya'o //
translated: The text should be understood as it appears in the sutra itself.

original: gzhan la go bar byed pa dang / so sor rang gis shes pa dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas las brtsams te gang bstan pa dang / mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo las brtsams te gang gis bstan pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid dang /
analyzed: gzhan la go bar byed pa dang / so sor rang gis shes pa dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas las brtsams te gang bstan pa dang / mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo las brtsams te gang gis bstan pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid dang /
translated: The teaching that begins with understanding for others, personal understanding, and the basis of both, and that which is taught beginning with the sutra, vinaya, and abhidharma, and that which is taught by the present suffering nature,

original: rgyu las ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang / rgyu zad pas de zad de mi skye ba dang / de spang ba'i thabs la brten pa las brtsams nas ji ltar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu las ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang / rgyu zad pas de zad de mi skye ba dang / de spang ba'i thabs la brten pa las brtsams nas ji ltar bstan pa ste /
translated: The suffering that will arise from a cause, the exhaustion of that suffering through the exhaustion of its cause, and the means of abandoning that suffering.

original: de ltar na 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa rnam pa bcu'i don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa rnam pa bcu'i don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this is the summary of the meaning of the ten aspects of knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: de ltar bden pa la mkhas pa de ni 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad shes rab kyis yang dag par rnam par sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa la mkhas pa de ni 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad shes rab kyis yang dag par rnam par sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: One who is skilled in the truths thus abandons all conditioned things through wisdom.

original: sems can gyi khams la yang snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams la yang snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And one's compassionate intention toward the realm of sentient beings increases.

original: sems can byis pa'i log par sgrub pa yang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' las yang dag par rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: sems can byis pa'i log par sgrub pa yang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' las yang dag par rab tu rtogs so //
translated: One also correctly understands the childish wrong practice of sentient beings in terms of the past and future.

original: de dag rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su bzung ba la sems kyis smon par byed cing de la gnas pa'i bsam pa yang dag par 'grub po //
analyzed: de dag rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su bzung ba la sems kyis smon par byed cing de la gnas pa'i bsam pa yang dag par 'grub po //
translated: In order to liberate them, he aspires in his mind to take up the great collections of merit and wisdom, and he accomplishes the intention to remain there.

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa la sogs pa yon tan mang po rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / yid la byed pa gzhan dang bral ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs sna tshogs kyis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa la sogs pa yon tan mang po rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / yid la byed pa gzhan dang bral ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs sna tshogs kyis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He brings beings to maturity through many kinds of qualities such as mindfulness, understanding, and realization, through being free from other mental activities, and through various methods of ripening.

original: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yi ge dang bstan bcos dang / rgya dang / rtsis dang shod thabs la sogs pa bzo dang las kyi gnas mdo las ji skad 'byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang sems can rnams la 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dang mthun par bya ba dang dbul ba bsal bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yi ge dang bstan bcos dang / rgya dang / rtsis dang shod thabs la sogs pa bzo dang las kyi gnas mdo las ji skad 'byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang sems can rnams la 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dang mthun par bya ba dang dbul ba bsal bar bya ba dang /
translated: They do so in accordance with worldly conventions, to eliminate poverty,

original: khams ma snyoms pa dang mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i gnod pa zhi bar bya ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i rtsed mo dang / dga' ba'i dngos po bsgrub @177b pas chos ma yin pa la dga' ba las bzlog par bya ba dang /
analyzed: khams ma snyoms pa dang mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i gnod pa zhi bar bya ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i rtsed mo dang / dga' ba'i dngos po bsgrub @177b pas chos ma yin pa la dga' ba las bzlog par bya ba dang /
translated: to pacify harm caused by humans and nonhumans and imbalances of the elements, to establish blameless play and enjoyable things, to turn people away from enjoying nonvirtue,🔽and to make people happy.

original: khyim gyi yo byad 'dod pa rnams la tshegs chung dus khyim gyi yo byad bsgrub par bya ba dang / rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa las yongs su bskyab par bya ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i sbyor ba la gnang ba dang dgag par bya ba dang /
analyzed: khyim gyi yo byad 'dod pa rnams la tshegs chung dus khyim gyi yo byad bsgrub par bya ba dang / rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa las yongs su bskyab par bya ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i sbyor ba la gnang ba dang dgag par bya ba dang /
translated: 3) the means of permitting or prohibiting the application of what is possible and impossible,🔽4) the means of performing auspicious rites,🔽5) the means of accepting or rejecting inauspicious things,🔽6) the means of not harming each other in this life,

original: bkra shis pa bya ba dang / bkra mi shis pa'i dngos po blang ba dang dor ba la gzung pa dang / tshe 'di la gcig la gcig mi 'khu ba dang / tshe phyi ma la phyin ci ma log pa'i mngon par mtho bar 'gyur ba'i lam bstan pa dang /
analyzed: bkra shis pa bya ba dang / bkra mi shis pa'i dngos po blang ba dang dor ba la gzung pa dang / tshe 'di la gcig la gcig mi 'khu ba dang / tshe phyi ma la phyin ci ma log pa'i mngon par mtho bar 'gyur ba'i lam bstan pa dang /
translated: 7) the means of teaching the path to the unmistaken higher rebirth in the next life,

original: snying rje dang ldan pas mthar gyis byang chub la dgod par bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pas mthar gyis byang chub la dgod par bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa ste /
translated: and 8) the means of ultimately establishing them in enlightenment through compassion.

original: de lta na 'di ni sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i bzo dang las kyi gnas de dag gi don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'di ni sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i bzo dang las kyi gnas de dag gi don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these are to be known as the summaries of the meaning of those arts and crafts that benefit sentient beings.

original: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All the rest is as before.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod do //
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod do //
translated: But there is this difference.

original: dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas l'u byi dor byas pas spras pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir de ma yin pa'i gser dag gis mi 'phrogs so //
analyzed: dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas l'u byi dor byas pas spras pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir de ma yin pa'i gser dag gis mi 'phrogs so //
translated: For example, that same gold, when it is fashioned by a skilled goldsmith into well-adorned ornaments, is not surpassed by any other kinds of gold.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de ma yin pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de ma yin pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, that Bodhisattva is not surpassed by any of the Disciples and Solitary Sages, or by any of the Bodhisattvas who are in the stages below his.

original: dper na zla ba dang / nyi ma dang rgyu skar rnams kyi 'od ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs la rlung dang 'gro bar ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na zla ba dang / nyi ma dang rgyu skar rnams kyi 'od ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs la rlung dang 'gro bar ni 'dra'o //
translated: For example, the light of the sun, moon, and stars is not surpassed by the circle of wind, and yet the wind carries them along.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs la /
translated: In the same way, that Bodhisattva’s wisdom is not surpassed by any of the Disciples and Solitary Sages,

original: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba byed par ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba byed par ni 'dra'o //
translated: and yet he engages in worldly activities.

original: skye ba ni lha'i rgyal po yongs su dga' ldan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba ni lha'i rgyal po yongs su dga' ldan du 'gyur te /
translated: As for rebirth, he will become a king of the Tushita gods.

original: mu stegs can thams cad bzlog pa la mkhas so //
analyzed: mu stegs can thams cad bzlog pa la mkhas so //
translated: He will be skilled in refuting all the tirthikas.

original: mthu ni bye ba phrag stong gi grangs su bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthu ni bye ba phrag stong gi grangs su bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: His power will be known to be in the millions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa 'di ni rnam par dag pa la bsam pa nyid du grub pa la 'jug pa dang / thabs dang bden pa spyod pa so so rnam par 'phel ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa 'di ni rnam par dag pa la bsam pa nyid du grub pa la 'jug pa dang / thabs dang bden pa spyod pa so so rnam par 'phel ba dang /
translated: This is the bodhisattvas' station of superior wisdom endowed with the truth, which is accomplished as the intention to purify, the entry into accomplishment, the individual increase of the practice of means and truth,

original: 'du byed rnam par sun 'byin cing sems can la snying rje rnam par 'phel ba dang / de'i don du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i smon lam la sbyor ba dang / @178a * //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam par sun 'byin cing sems can la snying rje rnam par 'phel ba dang / de'i don du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i smon lam la sbyor ba dang / @178a * //
translated: the disgust with compositional activity, the increase of compassion for sentient beings, the application to the prayer of gathering the accumulations of merit and knowledge for that purpose,

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang rtog pa la sogs pa yon tan 'phel ba dang / gzhan yid la mi byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brtson pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang rtog pa la sogs pa yon tan 'phel ba dang / gzhan yid la mi byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brtson pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo sgrub pa dang /
translated: the increase of good qualities such as mindfulness, understanding, and thought; the non-attention to others; the striving for the complete maturation of beings in every way; the accomplishment of worldly crafts;🔽the purification of the roots of virtue; and the birth and power.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood as it is found in the sutra.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽sa bcu'i sa shin tu sbyang dka' ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste / sa bcu'i sa shin tu sbyang dka' ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows:

original: bden pa rnams la rnam par nges pa'i shes pa ni shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la rnam par nges pa'i shes pa ni shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The sutra says, “The knowledge of ascertainment with regard to the truths is called ‘difficult to conquer,’

original: 'dir yang de bstan pas na de'i phyir sa de la shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: 'dir yang de bstan pas na de'i phyir sa de la shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya ste ;
translated: because it is taught here, therefore this stage is called ‘difficult to conquer.’

original: don de nyid kyi bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don de nyid kyi bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen that this very meaning is the stage of superior wisdom endowed with the truths.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' steadfastness in superior wisdom that is associated with dependent origination?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa la thog ma nyid du chos mnyam pa nyid bcu thob ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa la thog ma nyid du chos mnyam pa nyid bcu thob ste /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva who is steadfast in superior wisdom that is associated with the truth first attains ten kinds of sameness with regard to things.

original: gzhung ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhung ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The text should be understood as it appears in the sutra.

original: de dag che ba'i phyir dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gnas pa 'di la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de dag che ba'i phyir dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gnas pa 'di la 'jug ste /
translated: He enters this steadfastness because those ten kinds of sameness are great and perfect.

original: chos thams cad la don dam par yod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan ma med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / brjod pa mngon par 'du byed pa snang ba mtshan nyid med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / de nyid mtshan nyid med pas bdag nyid ma skyes pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la don dam par yod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan ma med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / brjod pa mngon par 'du byed pa snang ba mtshan nyid med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / de nyid mtshan nyid med pas bdag nyid ma skyes pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: The sameness of all things in their ultimate nature, which is the absence of the signs of any existent entity; the sameness of all things in their appearance as the formation of expressions, which is the absence of any characteristic; the sameness of all things in their non-production, which is the absence of any reality;

original: rgyu las kyang ma skyes pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / rang dang rgyu las kyang ma skyes pas gzod ma nas shin tu zhi ba'i mnyam pa nyid dang / yod pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i shes pa spros pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / blang ba dang dor ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'i mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rgyu las kyang ma skyes pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / rang dang rgyu las kyang ma skyes pas gzod ma nas shin tu zhi ba'i mnyam pa nyid dang / yod pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i shes pa spros pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / blang ba dang dor ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'i mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: It is also the same in being unoriginated from causes, in being utterly peaceful from the beginning, in being free from the elaborations of the consciousness that apprehends existent entities, and in being free from the manifest activity of adopting and rejecting.

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dben pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / rnam par brtags pa'i shes bya'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang sprul pa lta bu'i mnyam pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med pa'i mnyam pa nyid de ni chos mnyam pa nyid bcu po de dag gi don rnam par dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dben pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / rnam par brtags pa'i shes bya'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang sprul pa lta bu'i mnyam pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med pa'i mnyam pa nyid de ni chos mnyam pa nyid bcu po de dag gi don rnam par dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o /
translated: The equality of voidness is the equality of the absence of the afflictions and the absence of the afflictions of suffering. The equality of the nature of things is the equality of the nature of things that are imagined objects of knowledge, which are like illusions and magical creations. The equality of nonconceptuality is the equality of the nonexistence of both things and nonthings that is the domain of nonconceptual wisdom.🔽🔽These should be understood as the divisions of the meaning of the ten equalities of phenomena.

original: // / bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: The equality of voidness is the equality of the nature of all phenomena, which is void of the two kinds of self. The equality of the ultimate is the equality of the ultimate truth, which is the same in all beings. The equality of the absence of suffering is the equality of the nature of all phenomena, which is free from the suffering of change. The equality of the absence of happiness is the equality of the nature of all phenomena, which is free from the suffering of conditioned existence. The equality of the absence of purity is the equality of the nature of all phenomena, which is free from the suffering of suffering. The equality of the absence of defilement is the equality of the nature of all phenomena, which is free from the defilements of the mental afflictions and suffering. The equality of the illusory and emanated is the equality of the nature of all phenomena, which is like an illusion or a magical creation. The equality of the non-dual is the equality of the nature of all phenomena, which is the domain of non-conceptual wisdom, and is neither existent nor non-existent. These should be understood as the divisions of the meaning of the ten equalities of phenomena.

original: gnas pa @178b de la gnas pa de byang chub la 'dun pa drag pos 'dod pa skyes shing sems can rnams la snying rje rgyas pas 'jig rten rnams kyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i legs par dpyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyis dpyod par byed cing rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gnas pa @178b de la gnas pa de byang chub la 'dun pa drag pos 'dod pa skyes shing sems can rnams la snying rje rgyas pas 'jig rten rnams kyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i legs par dpyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyis dpyod par byed cing rab tu shes so //
translated: Abiding in that state, he generates a strong desire for enlightenment, and his compassion for sentient beings increases. He thoroughly analyzes and fully understands the arising and destruction of the world through all the aspects of the correct analysis of dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i shes pa la brten nas de'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i shes pa la brten nas de'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa skye ba'o //
translated: Based on the knowledge of dependent origination, the three doors of liberation—emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness—arise in him.

original: gzhi des kyang de la bdag dang gzhan pa dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhi des kyang de la bdag dang gzhan pa dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes mi 'byung ngo //
translated: On that basis, he does not generate the notions of self and other, agent and experiencer, entity and non-entity.

original: de ltar don dam pa la mkhas pa dang / sems can la lta ba de ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / rkyen tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas rang bzhin gyis nyam chung ba bdag dang bdag gi dang bral zhing nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags pa 'byung ba nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa dang /

translated: Thus, those who are skilled in the ultimate and who observe sentient beings do not assemble conditions that are associated with afflictions and that give rise to conditioned things that are naturally weak, devoid of self and entities connected to the self, and full of many faults.

original: rkyen ma tshogs pa las ni mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshogs pa las ni mi 'byung ste /
