original: de ltar ye shes dang snying rje dang ldan pa de ni gnas pa de la chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes dang snying rje dang ldan pa de ni gnas pa de la chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one who has both pristine wisdom and compassion is said to be facing the pristine wisdom of nonattachment in that station, and the perfection of wisdom called the station of facing is manifest.

original: des na de 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa thams cad la chags pa med par spyod de /
analyzed: des na de 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa thams cad la chags pa med par spyod de /
translated: Therefore, he practices all mundane conduct without attachment.

original: gnas pa de yang sa bdun pa la sbyor ba las 'byung ba'i spyod pa mthar thug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa rnon po gang yin pa des bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de yang sa bdun pa la sbyor ba las 'byung ba'i spyod pa mthar thug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa rnon po gang yin pa des bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that station should be known as included in the sharp, concordant patience of a bodhisattva who has reached the culmination of the practice of the seventh stage.

original: de chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur pas byang chub 'dren par byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyang 'dren par byed pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyi 'dus byas kyi
analyzed: de chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur pas byang chub 'dren par byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyang 'dren par byed pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyi 'dus byas kyi
translated: Since the perfection of wisdom called facing the pristine wisdom of nonattachment is manifest, he also leads the conditions that lead to enlightenment.

original: gnas pas kyang gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: gnas pas kyang gnas par mi byed do //
translated: He does not make abiding abide.

original: rab tu zhi ba la yang zhi bar lta ba de yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba la yang zhi bar lta ba de yang mi gnas so //
translated: He does not make peace see peace.

original: de ltar thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes dang ldan pa de la ni 'jug pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo @179a * //
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes dang ldan pa de la ni 'jug pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo @179a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with the wisdom of method and wisdom has the doors of the concentrations such as the concentration of emptiness of engagement manifest to him.

original: 'bum phrag bcu po mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu po mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: He has a hundred thousand concentrations manifest to him.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la ji lta ba bzhin du smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la ji lta ba bzhin du smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with the concentration of emptiness, the two concentrations of wishlessness and signlessness should be understood in the same way.

original: de dag mngon du gyur pa na mi phyed pa'i bsam pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mngon du gyur pa na mi phyed pa'i bsam pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are manifest, he has an undivided intention.

original: bstan pa'i dgra mu stegs can dang / bdud thams cad kyis kyang rnam pa thams cad du bstan pa las mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i dgra mu stegs can dang / bdud thams cad kyis kyang rnam pa thams cad du bstan pa las mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He cannot be led away from the teaching by any kind of opponent to the teaching, such as tīrthikas and māras.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: Here is the difference.

original: dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas nor bu rin po che bee d'u rya byi dor byas pas spras pa ni de ma yin pa'i gser thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ches rnam
analyzed: dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas nor bu rin po che bee d'u rya byi dor byas pas spras pa ni de ma yin pa'i gser thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ches rnam
translated: For example, that very gold, when it is adorned by a skilled goldsmith with lapis lazuli gems, cannot be surpassed by any other gold.

original: par dag pa dang mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par dag pa dang mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the roots of virtue of that bodhisattva become very pure and cannot be surpassed.

original: snga ma bzhin du dper na zla ba'i 'od ni sems can rnams kyi lus kyang sim par byed la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dper na zla ba'i 'od ni sems can rnams kyi lus kyang sim par byed la /
translated: For example, the light of the moon refreshes the bodies of sentient beings🔽and is not obstructed by the four circles of wind.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhis kyang mi chod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab kyi 'od de yang sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad kyang rab tu zhi bar byed la /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhis kyang mi chod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab kyi 'od de yang sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad kyang rab tu zhi bar byed la /
translated: In the same way, the light of the wisdom of that bodhisattva completely pacifies all the mental torments of all sentient beings

original: bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis kyang mi chod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis kyang mi chod pa yin no //
translated: and is not obstructed by any demons or opponents.

original: skye bas na lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bas na lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul du 'gyur te /
translated: By being born, he becomes the king of the gods, Suyāma.

original: sems can rnams kyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal thams cad bzlog pa la mkhas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal thams cad bzlog pa la mkhas so //
translated: They are skilled in countering the pride of all sentient beings.

original: mthu yang bye ba phrag 'bum gyi grangs su bstan par blta bar bya'o //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa 'di ni chos mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa la 'jug pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'byung ba dang / log pa'i 'du shes thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: mthu yang bye ba phrag 'bum gyi grangs su bstan par blta bar bya'o // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa 'di ni chos mnyam pa nyid yongs su grub pa la 'jug pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'byung ba dang / log pa'i 'du shes thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba dang /
translated: Their power should be understood to be taught in terms of a hundred thousand times ten million.🔽This is the entrance into the accomplishment of the sameness of phenomena, the arising of the gateway of liberation that is the realization of dependent origination, the non-arising of all mistaken perceptions,

original: thabs kyis 'khor ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon du phyogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa thob pa dang / mi phyed pa'i bsam pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: thabs kyis 'khor ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon du phyogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa thob pa dang / mi phyed pa'i bsam pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: the retention of saṃsāra through skillful means, the actualization of the perfection of wisdom that is directed toward non-attached wisdom, the attainment of immeasurable samādhis, the attainment of an undivided intention,

original: bstan pa las mi 'phrogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa las mi 'phrogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the bodhisattva's stage of direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation is indicated in brief by the following: the non-deficiency of the Dharma, the non-deficiency of the bodhisattvas, the non-deficiency of the spiritual friend, the non-deficiency of the root of the wholesome, the non-deficiency of the mental disposition, the non-deficiency of the accumulation, the non-deficiency of the counteragent, the non-deficiency of the objective support, the non-deficiency of the application and the non-deficiency of the result.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows:

original: sa mngon du gyur pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sa mngon du gyur pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: as it is found in the Abhisamayālaṅkāra.

original: chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon @179b du phyogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur pas na mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon @179b du phyogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur pas na mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The stage of direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation is called the 'stage of direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation' because it is the stage of the perfection of wisdom which is directed towards direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation.

original: don de nyid kyis 'di gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing rtsol ba dang bcas pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: don de nyid kyis 'di gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing rtsol ba dang bcas pa gang zhe na ;
translated: This very meaning should be understood as the basis.🔽What is the bodhisattvas' stage of direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation which is accompanied by the formative influence and accompanied by effort?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa 'das ma thag pa la thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa 'das ma thag pa la thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa /
translated: Here, immediately after the stage of superior wisdom, the bodhisattva, through the method of wisdom, accomplishes the direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation which is accompanied by the formative influence and accompanied by effort.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i 'jig rten pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i 'jig rten pa /
translated: It is not shared in common with all worlds.🔽It is the basis for the ten special qualities that are not shared in common with other paths.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang thun mong ma yin lam gzhan brtsams pa'i khyad par bcu po thob par 'gyur ba de dag che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gnas pa bdun pa la 'jug pa ste /🔽de dag gi gzhung ni rgyas par mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang thun mong ma yin lam gzhan brtsams pa'i khyad par bcu po thob par 'gyur ba de dag che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gnas pa bdun pa la 'jug pa ste / de dag gi gzhung ni rgyas par mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The seventh stage is entered because those qualities are great and complete.

original: 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa dang / sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa las brtsams pa dang / byang chub kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gong nas gong du yang skye ba las brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa dang / sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa las brtsams pa dang / byang chub kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gong nas gong du yang skye ba las brtsams pa dang /
translated: The texts should be understood in accordance with what appears in the sutra itself, beginning with the retention of merit that accomplishes mundane abundance, beginning with the intention to benefit and bring happiness to sentient beings, beginning with the accumulation of merit for enlightenment and the arising of the factors of enlightenment more and more,

original: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa las brtsams pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa las brtsams pa dang / sems can gyi khams las brtsams pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams las brtsams pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang /

original: gsung dang / thugs shes pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: gsung dang / thugs shes pa las brtsams te /
translated: beginning with what is not in common with the Disciples, beginning with what is not in common with the Solitary Buddhas, beginning with the realm of sentient beings, beginning with the realm of the world, beginning with the knowledge of the body, speech, and mind of the Tathagata.

original: de ltar 'di ni thabs dang shes rab kyis sgrub pa'i lam gzhan brtsams pa'i khyad par de dag gi dbang du byas pa'i don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni thabs dang shes rab kyis sgrub pa'i lam gzhan brtsams pa'i khyad par de dag gi dbang du byas pa'i don gyi mdo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this is the summary of the meaning of the other paths of practice of means and insight, which are distinguished by these special topics.

original: de de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul tshad med grangs med pa khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul tshad med grangs med pa khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with these, he penetrates the immeasurable, innumerable domain of the Tathagata.

original: de yang dag par bskyed ba'i phyir yang lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pas sangs rgyas kyi yul tshad med pa yang dag par skyed par mthong nas /
analyzed: de yang dag par bskyed ba'i phyir yang lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pas sangs rgyas kyi yul tshad med pa yang dag par skyed par mthong nas /
translated: Moreover, he sees that the infinite domain of the buddhas is generated by the spontaneous, signless, nonconceptual, and non-discriminative generation of the roots of virtue.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / bar chad med par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / bar chad med par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Thus, he applies himself uninterruptedly and without interruption.

original: spyod lam dang / spyod pa dang / gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa thams cad dang / gnas skabs thams cad na gnas la de lam dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro//
analyzed: spyod lam dang / spyod pa dang / gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa thams cad dang / gnas skabs thams cad na gnas la de lam dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro//
translated: He remains in all his postures, activities, abodes, mental orientations, and situations, and he does not depart from the path.

original: @180a * // de ni sems kyi skad cig re re la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad khyad par du 'phags par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @180a * // de ni sems kyi skad cig re re la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad khyad par du 'phags par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In each instant of mind, he completely perfects the distinctive virtues that are the factors of enlightenment, such as the ten perfections.

original: gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case for others.

original: dang por rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la ni smon lam la lhag par dmigs pa dang / gnyis pa la ni sems kyi 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma sel ba dang / gsum pa ni smon lam rnam par 'phel zhing chos la snang ba thob pa dang /
analyzed: dang por rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la ni smon lam la lhag par dmigs pa dang / gnyis pa la ni sems kyi 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma sel ba dang / gsum pa ni smon lam rnam par 'phel zhing chos la snang ba thob pa dang /
translated: On the first ground, the bodhisattva is focused on aspiration, on the second he eliminates the stain of immorality in the mind, on the third he increases his aspiration and obtains the light of Dharma.

original: bzhi pa la na'i  mal 'jug pa dang / lnga pa la ni 'jig rten pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa dang / drug pa la ni zab mo la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: bzhi pa la na'i  mal 'jug pa dang / lnga pa la ni 'jig rten pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa dang / drug pa la ni zab mo la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: On the fourth he enters the door of meditative concentration, on the fifth he enters mundane activities and on the sixth he enters the profound.

original: gnas pa bdun pa 'di la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bskyed pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa bdun pa 'di la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bskyed pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: On this seventh ground, the bodhisattva perfects the factors conducive to enlightenment because he perfectly generates all the qualities of buddhahood.

original: gnas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas bsdus pa dang ; ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas pa brgyad pa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas bsdus pa dang ; ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas pa brgyad pa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: This stage is included in the bodhisattva's conduct that arises from application and is perfected, and it is the entry into the eighth stage of purity of intuition, higher knowledge, and conduct.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni gnas pa 'di'i mjug thogs su gnas pa brgyad pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni gnas pa 'di'i mjug thogs su gnas pa brgyad pa la 'jug cing /
translated: Thus, immediately after this stage, the bodhisattva enters the eighth stage,

original: gnas pa de ni gcig tu nges par rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gnas pa de ni gcig tu nges par rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because that stage is absolutely pure.

original: gnas pa bdun po 'di dag ni 'dren pa yin te /🔽gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa bdun po 'di dag ni 'dren pa yin te / gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin la /
translated: These seven stages are mixed,🔽because they are not defiled, since they are the precursors of the pure stages,

original: de ma thob pa'i phyir ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod par gtogs par brjod do //
analyzed: de ma thob pa'i phyir ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod par gtogs par brjod do //
translated: and because they are included in the conduct that is defiled, since they have not attained the pure stages.

original: gnas pa de dag la de'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa de dag la de'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: In these stages, all the passions of the bodhisattva, such as attachment, are eliminated.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not associated with afflictions.🔽

original: nyon mongs pa med pa yang ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa yang ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this stage is neither defiled nor undefiled,

original: kun du mi spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du mi spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not defiled by the passions, and because it is not undefiled, since it is not free from the desire for the knowledge of a Buddha.

original: de ltar gyur pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag cing /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag cing /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, with his pure intention,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las tshad med par 'jug go //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las tshad med par 'jug go //
translated: engages in immeasurable actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: de las gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas ma bsngags pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas ma bsngags pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The actions that are not praised by the Tathagata are as before.

original: de'i gnas pa lnga par 'jig rten pa'i bzo shes pa mngon par sgrub pa rnams ni 'dir yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas pa lnga par 'jig rten pa'i bzo shes pa mngon par sgrub pa rnams ni 'dir yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The five states of his abode, in which he accomplishes the worldly skills, are perfected here.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po na gnas pa gong ma la @180b gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnams dang // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma gtogs pas slob dpon du bkur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po na gnas pa gong ma la @180b gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnams dang // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma gtogs pas slob dpon du bkur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is honored as a teacher by all beings in the great billion world universe, except by the bodhisattvas in the higher stages and the Tathagata himself.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba mtshungs pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba mtshungs pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: and there is no one equal to him in superior intention and application.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa'i rnam pas mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa'i rnam pas mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: The factors of enlightenment such as the meditative concentrations are actualized by the aspect of their cultivation.

original: gnas pa brgyad pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par smin pas gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa brgyad pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par smin pas gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he does not abide in the result of that actualization, as he did in the eighth stage.

original: de ltar zhugs pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'byed pa shin tu rnam par phye ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin 'bum phrag bcu mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'byed pa shin tu rnam par phye ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin 'bum phrag bcu mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: The bodhisattva who has thus entered attains a hundred thousand concentrations, such as the concentration of the bodhisattva’s discernment of the discernment of concentrations, and so on.

original: de dag thob pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thob pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: By attaining them, he transcends the domain of the concentrations of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nyon mongs pa thams cad la dben pa rtogs par dka' ba /
analyzed: de de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nyon mongs pa thams cad la dben pa rtogs par dka' ba /
translated: In that way, the bodhisattva’s physical, verbal, and mental actions are free from all afflictions and are difficult to fathom.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod pa thams cad dang bral bas gnas la sems can la lta ba dang / byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba la mngon par btson pa yang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod pa thams cad dang bral bas gnas la sems can la lta ba dang / byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba la mngon par btson pa yang mi gtong ngo //
translated: And because he is free from all conceptual activity, he never abandons his gaze on sentient beings, nor his intense effort to seek the special qualities that will perfect his enlightenment.

original: de'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa snang bar gyur pa tshad med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa snang bar gyur pa tshad med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: His actions of body, speech, and mind, free from all signs, are purified, and he attains immeasurable acceptance of the nonarising of things, which is a manifestation of the path of insight.

original: gnas pa 'di la ni rang gi blo'i yul yin pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa 'di la ni rang gi blo'i yul yin pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa yin te /
translated: In this stage, he transcends all the stages of the disciples and hermit buddhas, because he has the domain of his own mind.

original: de ma yin pa drug po dag la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la lhag par dmigs pas yin no //
analyzed: de ma yin pa drug po dag la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la lhag par dmigs pas yin no //
translated: In the other six stages, he transcends the stages of the disciples and hermit buddhas by his intense focus on the qualities of the Buddha.

original: gnas pa drug pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: gnas pa drug pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: In the sixth stage, the bodhisattva enters the absorption of cessation.

original: 'di la ni skad cig re re la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di la ni skad cig re re la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: In this, he enters into meditative concentration in every moment.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas par byed /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas par byed /
translated: He abides in the very limit of reality.

original: 'gog pa yang mngon du mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i shin tu rmad du byung ba'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa yang mngon du mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i shin tu rmad du byung ba'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: And he does not manifest cessation. This is his inconceivable and marvelous Dharma.

original: de thabs dang ye shes mngon par sgrub pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de thabs dang ye shes mngon par sgrub pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In this very context, he accomplishes the means and the knowledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin la /
translated: He practices the bodhisattva conduct that is not shared in common with any sentient being.

original: 'jig rten par yang snang zhig /
analyzed: 'jig rten par yang snang zhig /
translated: It appears in the world,

original: de'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa spyod de /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa spyod de /
translated: but it is not of its nature.

original: mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is as stated in the sutra itself.🔽The condensed meaning of this chapter is as follows. It begins with the practice of merit,

original: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni bsod nams bya ba las brtsams pa dang / chung ma dang 'khor yongs su 'dzin pa dang mngon par grub pa'i khyad par 'dod @181a * //
analyzed: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni bsod nams bya ba las brtsams pa dang / chung ma dang 'khor yongs su 'dzin pa dang mngon par grub pa'i khyad par 'dod @181a * //
translated: the acceptance of a wife and retinue, and the desire for the distinctive accomplishments.

original: pa yang dag par brtsams pa dang / rnam par thar pa gsum la gnas pa dang / theg pa dman pa la mos pa thabs kyis 'dul ba dang / 'dod pa yongs su spyod pa dang / 'dod pa'i khyad par don du gnyer ba dang /
analyzed: pa yang dag par brtsams pa dang / rnam par thar pa gsum la gnas pa dang / theg pa dman pa la mos pa thabs kyis 'dul ba dang / 'dod pa yongs su spyod pa dang / 'dod pa'i khyad par don du gnyer ba dang /
translated: the beginning of the true practice, the three liberations, the conversion of those who aspire to the Lesser Vehicle, the enjoyment of desires, the pursuit of special desires,

original: mu stegs can bzlog pa dang / gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par 'jug pa dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen po dang mthun par 'jug pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can bzlog pa dang / gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par 'jug pa dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen po dang mthun par 'jug pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: the refutation of the heterodox, the conformity with the minds of others, and the conformity with the great multitude.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there is this difference.

original: dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas nor bu rin po che byi dor byas pa thams cad kyis spras pa shin tu mdzes la de ma yin pa 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gser de nyid gser mgar mkhas pas nor bu rin po che byi dor byas pa thams cad kyis spras pa shin tu mdzes la de ma yin pa 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, that same gold, when it is adorned by a skillful goldsmith with all the gems of a jeweler, is very beautiful and cannot be surpassed by any ornament in Jambudvipa.🔽In the same way, the bodhisattva's virtue, when it is adorned with the perfections, the liberations, etc.,

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ches rnam par dag la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / de ma yin pa gnas ches dma' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ches rnam par dag la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / de ma yin pa gnas ches dma' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
translated: And his roots of virtue are very pure, and cannot be surpassed by the roots of virtue of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and also by the roots of virtue of bodhisattvas who are in lower stages.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od kyis ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi rlan phal cher yongs su skem par byed la /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od kyis ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi rlan phal cher yongs su skem par byed la /
translated: For example, the light of the sun completely dries up most of the moisture in Jambudvīpa.

original: de ma yin pa'i 'od thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i 'od thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa de bzhin du /
translated: And it cannot be surpassed by any other light.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab kyi 'od kyis ni sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad skem par byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab kyi 'od kyis ni sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad skem par byed la /
translated: In the same way, the light of the wisdom of these bodhisattvas dries up all the poison of the reactive emotions of sentient beings.

original: snga ma bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi 'od rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi 'od rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
translated: And, as before, it cannot be surpassed by the light of the wisdom of the śrāvakas, etc.

original: skye bas ni lha'i rgyal po dbang byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bas ni lha'i rgyal po dbang byed du 'gyur te /
translated: By birth, they become the king of the gods, the lord of Tuṣita Heaven.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa sgrub pa rnams la mkhas so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa sgrub pa rnams la mkhas so //
translated: He is skilled in the realization of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: mthu ni bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi grangs su bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mthu ni bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi grangs su bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: His power should be understood as being taught in the trillions.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa 'di ni thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i lam gzhan brtsams pa'i khyad par 'grub pa la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang dag par skyed pa khong du chud pa la rgyun du sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa 'di ni thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i lam gzhan brtsams pa'i khyad par 'grub pa la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang dag par skyed pa khong du chud pa la rgyun du sbyor ba dang /
translated: This is the path of accomplishment through method and wisdom, which is the entry to the accomplishment of the special qualities of the other stages of generation, the entry to the generation of the domain of the tathagatas, the constant application to the understanding of the generation of the domain of the tathagatas,

original: skad cig re re la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'i sbyong ba yongs su rdzogs par bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: skad cig re re la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'i sbyong ba yongs su rdzogs par bsdus pa dang /
translated: the generation of all the dharmas that are factors of enlightenment in every moment, the arrangement of the afflicted and unafflicted, the complete gathering of the training of application,

original: bsam pa dag pa'i las la 'jug pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo @181b dang las la sogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa 'thob pa dang /🔽skad cig re re la 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i 'jig rten pa'i spyad pa spyod pa dang ; dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //🔽rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /🔽sa ring du song ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i las la 'jug pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo @181b dang las la sogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa 'thob pa dang / skad cig re re la 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i 'jig rten pa'i spyad pa spyod pa dang ; dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o // rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste / sa ring du song ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is to be understood in brief as the entry into the activities of pure thought, the accomplishment of all mundane crafts and occupations, the attainment of immeasurable concentrations not held in common with the disciples and solitary sages,🔽the meditative absorption of cessation in every moment, the performance of mundane activities not held in common with all living beings, the purification of the roots of virtue, and the birth and power.🔽🔽This is to be understood in detail as before,🔽as in the stage Gone Afar.🔽
