original: don de nyid kyis gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don de nyid kyis gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this very fact is the abiding in the signless.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' spontaneous, effortless abiding in the signless?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa snga ma 'das ma thag pa la chos thams cad kyi don dam pa 'jug pa'i ye shes rnam pa bcu 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa snga ma 'das ma thag pa la chos thams cad kyi don dam pa 'jug pa'i ye shes rnam pa bcu 'thob ste /
translated: Here, immediately after the previous abiding, the bodhisattva attains ten kinds of gnosis that penetrate the ultimate truth of all phenomena:

original: dus gsum du ci rigs par gzod ma nas ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa las brtsams pa dang / de ma yin pa'i rgyu'i dngos po 'byung ba med cing rnam par 'jig pa med pa las brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: dus gsum du ci rigs par gzod ma nas ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa las brtsams pa dang / de ma yin pa'i rgyu'i dngos po 'byung ba med cing rnam par 'jig pa med pa las brtsams pa dang /
translated: the nonarising of all phenomena from the beginning, their nonproduction, their signlessness, their beginninglessness and endlessness, their equality in the three times, their nondifferentiation, their nonduality, their nondifferentiation in the two truths, their nondifferentiation in the two obscurations, and their nondifferentiation in the two kinds of gnosis.

original: don dam par brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po la brjod pa mngon par 'du byed par snang ba'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid dang rgyu'i dngos po med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa yang med la /🔽ldog pa yang med pa las brtsams pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po brjod du med pa de la de ma shes pa log par mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thog ma dang / re re dang / tha ma'i dus thams cad du mnyam pa nyid las brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: don dam par brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po la brjod pa mngon par 'du byed par snang ba'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid dang rgyu'i dngos po med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa yang med la / ldog pa yang med pa las brtsams pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po brjod du med pa de la de ma shes pa log par mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thog ma dang / re re dang / tha ma'i dus thams cad du mnyam pa nyid las brtsams pa dang /
translated: It is the fact that ultimately, in the nature of things, there is no such thing as the characteristics or causes of the nature that appears to be the formation of expressions in the inexpressible nature of things.🔽It is the fact that there is no beginning, middle, or end to the defilement aspect, which is the cause of the mistaken adherence of those who do not understand the inexpressible nature of things that exist.

original: de bzhin nyid la yang dag par zhugs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa de bsal ba las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la yang dag par zhugs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa de bsal ba las brtsams pa ste /
translated: It is the fact that the purification aspect is the same in the beginning, middle, and end, and that the nonconceptual sameness of those who have entered suchness eliminates that defilement.

original: de ltar de'i ye shes rnam pa bcu che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gnas pa brgyad pa yongs su dag pa dang / 'di la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar de'i ye shes rnam pa bcu che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gnas pa brgyad pa yongs su dag pa dang / 'di la 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, because of the greatness of the ten aspects of his intuition, and because of their completeness, the bodhisattva enters the eighth stage, the stage of the immoveable, which is completely pure.

original: 'di la gnas pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa mchog shin tu rnam par dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa mchog shin tu rnam par dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this stage attains the supreme, completely pure patience with the nonproduction of dharmas.

original: de yang gang zhe na byang chub sems dpa' des yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhis chos thams cad yongs su btsal nas /🔽gang gi tshe yang dag pa ji @182a * //
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na byang chub sems dpa' des yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhis chos thams cad yongs su btsal nas / gang gi tshe yang dag pa ji @182a * //
translated: What is that? Having sought all dharmas through the four investigations,

original: lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhis yongs su shes pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhis yongs su shes pa de'i tshe /
translated: when he has thoroughly understood them through the four thorough understandings, just as they are,

original: log par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa thams cad bsal ba na /
analyzed: log par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa thams cad bsal ba na /
translated: then, having dispelled all adherence to false notions,

original: tshe 'di la yang chos thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad mi skye ba dang mthun par mthong la /
analyzed: tshe 'di la yang chos thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad mi skye ba dang mthun par mthong la /
translated: in this life he sees the nonproduction of all the defilements of all dharmas as conformable to the nonproduction of dharmas.

original: tshe phyi ma la sngon gyi log par rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las yang dag par skyes pa'i chos de dag nyid ma lus par thams cad kyi thams cad du mi skye bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la sngon gyi log par rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las yang dag par skyes pa'i chos de dag nyid ma lus par thams cad kyi thams cad du mi skye bar mthong ngo //
translated: In the next life, he sees that all of those phenomena, which are produced by the causes of former adherence to false imagination, are not produced at all.

original: yongs su tshol ba bzhi po de dag dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po dag ni de kho na'i don gyi le'u las sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba bzhi po de dag dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po dag ni de kho na'i don gyi le'u las sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The four investigations and the four knowledges of reality as it is are as previously explained in the chapter on reality.

original: de dag mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa yan chad mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i bar du ni shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa yan chad mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i bar du ni shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin no //
translated: From the stage of action in faith up to the stage of added effort, they are not completely pure.

original: gnas pa 'di la ni yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa 'di la ni yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: But on this stage, they are completely pure.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva is said to have attained the tolerance of the non-production of dharmas.

original: des bzod pa de thob pas byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa zab mo thob pa yin te /
analyzed: des bzod pa de thob pas byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa zab mo thob pa yin te /
translated: By attaining this tolerance, the bodhisattva attains the profound stage.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa snga ma la de'i skyon rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag kyang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa snga ma la de'i skyon rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag kyang spangs pa yin te /
translated: The former abiding in the signless has abandoned the four faults mentioned above.

original: rtsol ba'i mngon par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de yang spangs pa yin /
analyzed: rtsol ba'i mngon par 'du shes pa gang yin pa de yang spangs pa yin /
translated: It has abandoned the notion of striving.

original: rnam par dag pa'i gnas pa gong ma la snying las su gyur pa yang spangs pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i gnas pa gong ma la snying las su gyur pa yang spangs pa yin /
translated: It has abandoned the difficulty of the higher pure abodes.

original: rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don bya nus pa la snying las su gyur pa yang spangs pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don bya nus pa la snying las su gyur pa yang spangs pa yin /
translated: It has abandoned the difficulty of being able to benefit sentient beings in every way.

original: 'du shes phra mo kun du 'byung ba yang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes phra mo kun du 'byung ba yang spangs pa yin te /
translated: It has abandoned the occurrence of subtle discriminations.

original: de lta bas na gnas pa de shin tu yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa de shin tu yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that abiding is called “extremely pure.”

original: zab mo'i gnas pa de la mngon par dga' ba de'i chos kyi sgo'i rgyun de la de bzhin gshegs pas bskul ba dang ; yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i las dpag tu med pa de nye bar bsgrub ste /
analyzed: zab mo'i gnas pa de la mngon par dga' ba de'i chos kyi sgo'i rgyun de la de bzhin gshegs pas bskul ba dang ; yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i las dpag tu med pa de nye bar bsgrub ste /
translated: The Tathagata encourages, introduces, and establishes that one in the door of Dharma that is the stream of that profound abiding, and in the immeasurable activities of knowledge and superknowledge that are the door of accomplishment.

original: de ltar bskul bas lus rnam par dbye ba shes pa tshad med pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / dbang bcu yang thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar bskul bas lus rnam par dbye ba shes pa tshad med pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / dbang bcu yang thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By that encouragement, one accomplishes the immeasurable knowledge of the analysis of the body, and one attains the ten masteries.

original: rgyas par mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know them in detail as they are described in the sutra itself.

original: dbang thob pa de ni ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang thob pa de ni ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained mastery, one remains for as long as one wishes.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa sems kyi gnas pa gang gis gnas par 'dod pa des gnas par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa sems kyi gnas pa gang gis gnas par 'dod pa des gnas par byed do //
translated: One remains by means of whatever mental abiding, such as concentration and liberation, one wishes to remain.

original: bsam pa tsam gyi mod la de'i kha zas la sogs pa yo @182b byad thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽bzo dang las kyi gnas thams cad la yang de ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa tsam gyi mod la de'i kha zas la sogs pa yo @182b byad thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro // bzo dang las kyi gnas thams cad la yang de ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the mere thought, all the articles he desires, such as food, are produced.🔽He can engage in all the arts and crafts just as he wishes.

original: skye bar 'gyur ba'i las thams cad dang / skye ba'i gnas thams cad la yang de dga' mgur skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba'i las thams cad dang / skye ba'i gnas thams cad la yang de dga' mgur skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He can be born in any place and in any form of life he wishes.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba thams cad kyang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba thams cad kyang /
translated: He can perform all the miracles

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du byed do //
translated: just as he wishes.

original: de'i smon lam thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i smon lam thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'grub po //
translated: All his wishes are fulfilled just as he wishes.

original: dngos po gang dang gang la ji ltar mos pa de yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang la ji ltar mos pa de yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Whatever thing he has an aspiration toward becomes just as he wishes, not otherwise.

original: shes bya gang shes par 'dod pa de la yang ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: shes bya gang shes par 'dod pa de la yang ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: He knows whatever he wishes to know.

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also obtain the collections of names, the collections of phrases, and the collections of letters, just as he wishes.

original: chos thams cad yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa la yang mkhas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa la yang mkhas te /
translated: He will also be skilled in the correct arrangement of all dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar dbang thob pa las byung ba'i phan yon gzhan ni rgyas par mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar dbang thob pa las byung ba'i phan yon gzhan ni rgyas par mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
translated: The other benefits that arise from the bodhisattva’s obtaining power should be understood in detail according to the sutra itself.

original: ; sangs rgyas mthong ba rags pa yang spangs nas /
analyzed: ; sangs rgyas mthong ba rags pa yang spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the coarse seeing of buddhas,

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral lo //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral lo //
translated: he will never be separated from seeing buddhas, uninterruptedly.

original: lhag ma dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa ni gser gyi dpe dang 'od kyi dpe dang bcas te /
analyzed: lhag ma dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa ni gser gyi dpe dang 'od kyi dpe dang bcas te /
translated: The remaining pure roots of virtue are explained together with the example of gold and the example of light.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood according to the sutra.

original: gnas pa de la byang chub sems dpa' de'i skye ba dang / mthu'i khyad par yang mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de la byang chub sems dpa' de'i skye ba dang / mthu'i khyad par yang mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's birth and special powers in that state should be understood as they are described in the sutra itself.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub pa 'di ni don dam pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes 'grub pa la 'jug pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa skyon thams cad dang bral ba zab pa thob pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub pa 'di ni don dam pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes 'grub pa la 'jug pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa skyon thams cad dang bral ba zab pa thob pa dang /
translated: This spontaneous presence in the signless state is the accomplishment of the gnosis that penetrates the ultimate, the attainment of patient acceptance of the fact that things are not produced, the attainment of the profound bodhisattva's state free of all defects,

original: chos kyi sgo'i rgyun las sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i las dpag tu med pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / lus rnam par dbye ba shes pa tshad med pa la 'jug pa dang dbang thob pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo'i rgyun las sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i las dpag tu med pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / lus rnam par dbye ba shes pa tshad med pa la 'jug pa dang dbang thob pa dang /
translated: the attainment of the door of the stream of Dharma, the accomplishment of the doors of the buddhas, the accomplishment of the activities of boundless gnosis and preternatural knowledge, the attainment of mastery in entering into the boundless knowledge of the analysis of the body,🔽and the attainment of the door of the stream of Dharma.

original: dbang gi phan yon so sor nyams su myong ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang / mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang gi phan yon so sor nyams su myong ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang / mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The benefits of empowerment should be understood as taught in the brief presentation of the benefits of empowerment.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows.

original: mdo'i sa mi g-yo ba las ji skad bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mdo'i sa mi g-yo ba las ji skad bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: It is as taught in the Sūtra on the Stage of Buddhahood.

original: snga ma'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir /🔽sa de la sems de lhun gyis grub cing mi @183a * //
analyzed: snga ma'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir / sa de la sems de lhun gyis grub cing mi @183a * //
translated: Because he is free from the previous effort,🔽on that stage his mind enters the path of spontaneous and effortless

original: g-yo bar 'jug pa'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: g-yo bar 'jug pa'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: activity.

original: de lta bas nas de la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas nas de la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore it is called the stage of Immovability.

original: don de nyid kyis 'di gnas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don de nyid kyis 'di gnas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: By this very meaning, it should be seen as the stage of Abiding.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ abiding in the analytical knowledges?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gnas pa zab mo des kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gnas pa zab mo des kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /
translated: Here the bodhisattva is not satisfied with that profound abiding.

original: gong du ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa'i rjes su 'gro la /
analyzed: gong du ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa'i rjes su 'gro la /
translated: The bodhisattva knows perfectly the way in which the Dharma is taught to others by the Dharma cognition that is the cause of the special transcendent wisdom mentioned above.

original: chos shes pa mngon par 'du byed pa gang gis byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bstan par bya ba dang / chos bstan pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos shes pa mngon par 'du byed pa gang gis byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bstan par bya ba dang / chos bstan pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows perfectly all the activities of teaching the Dharma.

original: de la chos yang dag par bstan pa'i bya ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la chos yang dag par bstan pa'i bya ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The activities of teaching the Dharma are as follows.

original: thibs po rgyu ba dag la gang dag kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: thibs po rgyu ba dag la gang dag kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: He knows the activities of those who are involved in the thicket, those who are defiled and those who are purified, those who are defiled and those who are purified by that, and those who are defiled and those who are purified through that.

original: rnam par byang ba gang yin pa dang / de'i gnas gcig tu ma nges pa gang yin pa dang / de'i gcig tu nges pa dang gcig tu ma nges pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba gang yin pa dang / de'i gnas gcig tu ma nges pa gang yin pa dang / de'i gcig tu nges pa dang gcig tu ma nges pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: He knows perfectly well what is purification, what is not determined as a single state of that, and what is determined as a single state of that, and what is not determined as a single state of that.

original: de ltar chos bstan pa la mkhas pa dang / bstan pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang / gzungs dpag tu med pa thob pa dang / tshig gi yan lag rnam par dbye ba thams cad la mkhas pa dang / spobs pa mi zad pa'i rnam pa thams cad du chos smra ba chen po nyid gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar chos bstan pa la mkhas pa dang / bstan pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang / gzungs dpag tu med pa thob pa dang / tshig gi yan lag rnam par dbye ba thams cad la mkhas pa dang / spobs pa mi zad pa'i rnam pa thams cad du chos smra ba chen po nyid gang yin pa dang /
translated: Thus, he is a great Dharma teacher in every way, skilled in teaching the Dharma, skilled in the activity of teaching, having attained immeasurable dhāraṇī, skilled in all the divisions of the parts of speech, and inexhaustible in eloquence.

original: chos 'dzin pa dang / len nus pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pas mngon par sgrub pa'i tshig gang yin pa dang / chos kyi stan ji lta bu la 'dug pa dang / gang du gang dag la chos ston pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa dang / len nus pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pas mngon par sgrub pa'i tshig gang yin pa dang / chos kyi stan ji lta bu la 'dug pa dang / gang du gang dag la chos ston pa dang /
translated: He is endowed with the ability to uphold and take up the Dharma, and with the words accomplished by the correct discrimination of the bodhisattvas. He sits on the Dharma seat in such a way, and he teaches the Dharma to such people in such a place.

original: chos kyi sgo ji snyed pa dang / gang gis sems can go bar byed cing /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo ji snyed pa dang / gang gis sems can go bar byed cing /
translated: All the doors of Dharma and all the activities that can cause sentient beings to understand and

original: mgu bar byed pa'i bya ba la yang dag par 'dzud nus pa dang ldan pa de dag thams cad ni rgyas par mdo nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mgu bar byed pa'i bya ba la yang dag par 'dzud nus pa dang ldan pa de dag thams cad ni rgyas par mdo nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: to be satisfied should be understood in detail according to the sutra itself.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang / mthu'i khyad par yang mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang / mthu'i khyad par yang mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The distinctions in the purity of the roots of virtue, in birth, and in power should be understood according to what appears in the sutra itself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa 'di ni zhi ba'i rnam par thar pas chog @183b par mi 'dzin pa la 'jug pa dang / chos yang dag par bstan pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa 'di ni zhi ba'i rnam par thar pas chog @183b par mi 'dzin pa la 'jug pa dang / chos yang dag par bstan pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa shes pa dang /
translated: This stage of the correct understanding of the bodhisattvas is the entry into not being satisfied with the peace of liberation, the knowledge of the performance of the correct teaching of the Dharma,

original: de'i bya ba shes pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos smra ba chen po nyid 'thob pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bya ba shes pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos smra ba chen po nyid 'thob pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu las mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that its function is to attain the great, inconceivable Dharma of the masters of the Dharma, the purity of the roots of virtue, and the power of birth.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows.

original: mdo nyid las legs pa'i blo gros las 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: mdo nyid las legs pa'i blo gros las 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: It is as it appears in the Sutra of Supreme Light.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i bro gros chen po yongs su dag pas chos yang dag par bstan pa'i skabs yin pas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i bro gros chen po yongs su dag pas chos yang dag par bstan pa'i skabs yin pas na /
translated: Because it is the occasion for the bodhisattvas to teach the Dharma with the great, pure wisdom of discernment in order to bring about the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings,

original: sa de la legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa de la legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ste /
translated: this bhumi is called Supreme Light.

original: don de nyid kyis 'di ni gnas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don de nyid kyis 'di ni gnas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: By this very meaning, it should be seen as the abode.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa mchog gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa mchog gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supreme abode of the bodhisattvas?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' so so yang dag par rig pa'i gnas pa rnam pa thams cad kyis yongs su dag pa la chos kyi rgyal por 'os shing chos la dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa la sogs pa dpag tu med pa thob cing /🔽de'i bya ba byed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par la dbang bskur ba'i tha ma'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pas sangs rgyas thams cad las de dang 'tsham pa'i stan dang lus dang 'khor thob pa dang / bdag nyid kyi 'od zer 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' so so yang dag par rig pa'i gnas pa rnam pa thams cad kyis yongs su dag pa la chos kyi rgyal por 'os shing chos la dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa la sogs pa dpag tu med pa thob cing / de'i bya ba byed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par la dbang bskur ba'i tha ma'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pas sangs rgyas thams cad las de dang 'tsham pa'i stan dang lus dang 'khor thob pa dang / bdag nyid kyi 'od zer 'gro ba dang /
translated: They have attained infinite concentrations such as the stainless concentration and so on,🔽and they have attained the seat, body and retinue that are appropriate to them from all the buddhas, since they have actualized the concentration of consecration into the special gnosis of omniscience, which is the performance of its function.🔽They have attained the consecration into the gnosis of omniscience in all its aspects, through the light rays of their own bodies that go out to the worlds and return.

original: phyir 'ong ba rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / dbang bskur nas kyang 'dul ba thams cad yang dag par sdud cing /
analyzed: phyir 'ong ba rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / dbang bskur nas kyang 'dul ba thams cad yang dag par sdud cing /
translated: And having been consecrated, they gather all those to be trained together.

original: de dag rnam par thar par bya ba'i thabs sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / mngon par shes pa dpag tu med pa thob pa dang / de'i dbang gis dran pa dang /
analyzed: de dag rnam par thar par bya ba'i thabs sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / mngon par shes pa dpag tu med pa thob pa dang / de'i dbang gis dran pa dang /
translated: The method of liberating them is to know the deeds of the Buddha, to attain the immeasurable liberation, concentration, retention, and superknowledges, and by their power, to establish the great memory and knowledge.

original: shes pa chen pos mngon par sgrub pa'i nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon par shes pa chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang / mthu'i khyad par las gnas pa mchog mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa chen pos mngon par sgrub pa'i nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon par shes pa chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang / mthu'i khyad par las gnas pa mchog mdor bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The great superknowledge, the purification of the roots of virtue, and the special birth and power are to be known as the brief teaching of the supreme stage.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive teaching is as follows:

original: mdo nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is as it appears in the sutra itself, in the Bodhisattvapitaka in the chapter on the Cloud of Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su @184a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su @184a * //
translated: The bodhisattva path is completely

original: rdzogs shing / byang chub kyi tshogs shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la chos kyi sprin lta bu shin tu rgya che zhing /
analyzed: rdzogs shing / byang chub kyi tshogs shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la chos kyi sprin lta bu shin tu rgya che zhing /
translated: The bodhisattva who is complete and perfect in the accumulations for enlightenment receives from the tathagatas the great Dharma rain, which is like a great cloud.

original: de ma yin pa'i sems can thams cad kyis bzod par dka' ba'i dam pa'i chos kyi char yang dag par nod do //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i sems can thams cad kyis bzod par dka' ba'i dam pa'i chos kyi char yang dag par nod do //
translated: And he receives the excellent Dharma rain, which is difficult for all other beings to bear.

original: bdag nyid byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na yang sprin chen po lta bu'i dam pa'i chos kyi char dpe med pas sems can dpag tu med pa dag gi nyon mongs pa'i rdul rnams rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na yang sprin chen po lta bu'i dam pa'i chos kyi char dpe med pas sems can dpag tu med pa dag gi nyon mongs pa'i rdul rnams rab tu zhi bar byed do //
translated: And when he himself has fully awakened to perfect buddhahood, he will, with the incomparable excellent Dharma rain, which is like a great cloud, completely pacify the dust of the afflictions of countless beings.

original: sa de la gnas nas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i lo tog rnam pa sna tshogs kyang skyed par byed /🔽rnam par 'phel bar byed /
analyzed: sa de la gnas nas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i lo tog rnam pa sna tshogs kyang skyed par byed / rnam par 'phel bar byed /
translated: Dwelling on this bhumi, he will also cause the various crops of roots of virtue to grow,🔽to increase,

original: yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: and to ripen.

original: de lta bas na sa de chos kyi sprin ces bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na sa de chos kyi sprin ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this stage is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: don de nyid kyis gnas pa mchog yin par blta'o //
analyzed: don de nyid kyis gnas pa mchog yin par blta'o //
translated: By this very meaning, it should be seen as the supreme abode.

original: gnas pa gong ma gong ma rnams su yan lag gang dag bstan pa de dag ni gnas pa snga ma rnams la thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gnas pa gong ma gong ma rnams su yan lag gang dag bstan pa de dag ni gnas pa snga ma rnams la thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: The branches taught in the higher and higher abodes are not completely absent in the previous abodes.

original: 'on kyang chung ba'i phyir grangs su mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chung ba'i phyir grangs su mi brtsi'o //
translated: However, because they are small, they are not counted.

original: de dag nyid 'bring dang che ba'i phyir ni de ma yin pa sa gong ma 'thob pa 'grub pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid 'bring dang che ba'i phyir ni de ma yin pa sa gong ma 'thob pa 'grub pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those very [branches] are medium and great, and it should be understood that they are established as accomplishing the attainment of the higher stages that are not [those].

original: de la gnas pa re re yang bskal pa chen po bye pa 'bum phrag du ma'am /
analyzed: de la gnas pa re re yang bskal pa chen po bye pa 'bum phrag du ma'am /
translated: There, each abode is attained and accomplished by many hundreds of thousands of great eons,

original: yang na de bas kyang ches mang bas 'thob cing 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na de bas kyang ches mang bas 'thob cing 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: or even more than that.

original: gnas pa de dag thams cad ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum gyis yang dag par 'grub ste /
analyzed: gnas pa de dag thams cad ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum gyis yang dag par 'grub ste /
translated: All those abodes are truly accomplished by three incalculable great eons.

original: bskal pa chen po grangs med pa dang pos ni mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: bskal pa chen po grangs med pa dang pos ni mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa 'thob ste /
translated: By the first great incalculable eon, the bodhisattva surpasses the stage of action in faith and attains the stage of joy.

original: de yang rtag tu 'bad pas 'thob kyi mi 'bad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtag tu 'bad pas 'thob kyi mi 'bad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is attained by constant effort, not without effort.

original: bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gnyis pas ni rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa nas /🔽mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i bar las 'das te /
analyzed: bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gnyis pas ni rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa nas / mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i bar las 'das te /
translated: By the second great incalculable eon, he surpasses the stage of joy up to the stage of direct realization of the Dharma.🔽By the third great incalculable eon, he surpasses the stage of direct realization of the Dharma up to the stage of certain conduct.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the fourth great incalculable eon, he surpasses the stage of certain conduct up to the stage of certain conduct with exertion and attains the stage of certain conduct without exertion.

original: de ni nges pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni nges pa kho na ste /
translated: That is certain,

original: 'di ltar bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni nges par 'bad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni nges par 'bad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that bodhisattva of pure attitude is definitely exerting himself.

original: bskal pa chen po grangs med pa'i gsum pas ni mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa dang / so so yang dag par @184b rig pa la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa chen po grangs med pa'i gsum pas ni mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa dang / so so yang dag par @184b rig pa la gnas pa las yang dag par 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the third of the great incalculable eons, he surpasses the stage of the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattva and attains the supreme stage of the bodhisattva, which is the spontaneous stage of signlessness.

original: de la bskal pa grangs med pa ni gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bskal pa grangs med pa ni gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The incalculable eon should be understood in two ways:

original: bskal pa chen po gang yin pa de yang nyin mtshan dang / zla ba dang / zla ba phyed du bgrang ba'i tshul gyis dus dpag tu med pa'i phyir ;🔽grangs med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa chen po gang yin pa de yang nyin mtshan dang / zla ba dang / zla ba phyed du bgrang ba'i tshul gyis dus dpag tu med pa'i phyir ; grangs med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The great eon is incalculable because it is an immeasurable length of time, in terms of days, nights, months, and half months.

original: bskal pa chen po de dag gi bgrang ba'i tshul gyis bgrang ba thams cad las 'das pa'i grangs gang yin pa de yang grangs med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bskal pa chen po de dag gi bgrang ba'i tshul gyis bgrang ba thams cad las 'das pa'i grangs gang yin pa de yang grangs med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The great eon is also incalculable because it is a number that is beyond all calculation.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa snga ma shos kyis ni bskal pa grangs med pa mi nyung ba zhig gis byang chub thob par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa snga ma shos kyis ni bskal pa grangs med pa mi nyung ba zhig gis byang chub thob par 'gyur ro//
translated: By the first incalculable eon, the bodhisattva attains enlightenment after a long period of time, not a short period of time.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa phyi ma shos kyis ni gsum kho nas 'thob kyi lhag pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa phyi ma shos kyis ni gsum kho nas 'thob kyi lhag pas ni ma yin te /
translated: By the final countless eon, one obtains in only three, not more.

original: su brtson 'grus rtsom pa chen po'i yang chen pos sbyor ba de'i nang na la la ni bar gyi bskal pa mang po zhig 'dums par byed do //
analyzed: su brtson 'grus rtsom pa chen po'i yang chen pos sbyor ba de'i nang na la la ni bar gyi bskal pa mang po zhig 'dums par byed do //
translated: One who applies himself with the greatest of great effort, among those who apply themselves, some reduce many intermediate eons.

original: la la ni bskal pa chen po dag gi bar du 'dums par byed kyi grangs med pa 'dums par byed pa ni 'ga' yang med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: la la ni bskal pa chen po dag gi bar du 'dums par byed kyi grangs med pa 'dums par byed pa ni 'ga' yang med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Some reduce great eons, but none reduce countless eons.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis po de dag gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum po de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis po de dag gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum po de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By these twelve bodhisattva stages, one abandons the negative tendencies that are the side of the afflictive obstructions in those three countless eons.

original: shes bya'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One abandons the negative tendencies that are the side of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la gnas pa gsum po de dag la ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len spong bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa gsum po de dag la ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len spong bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that in these three abodes, the negative reflex actions which are the side of the obscuration of moral defilement are eliminated.

original: rab tu dga' ba la ni ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la ni ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo //
translated: In the Joyous, all the negative reflex actions which are the side of the moral defilement of the unfortunate states of existence are eliminated in every way.

original: kun du spyod pa las ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chen po dang 'bring thams cad do //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa las ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chen po dang 'bring thams cad do //
translated: In the Practice, all the great and middling negative reflex actions which are the side of moral defilement are eliminated.

original: mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pa la ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rnam par dag pa la bgegs byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad kyi thams cad du spong bar rig par bya'o//
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pa la ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rnam par dag pa la bgegs byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad kyi thams cad du spong bar rig par bya'o//
translated: In the abode of the effortless signless, it should be understood that all the negative reflex actions which are the side of moral defilement that obstruct the purification of the acquiescence to the non-production of dharmas are eliminated in every way.

original: kun du spyod pa la ni nyon mongs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa la ni nyon mongs pa thams cad do //
translated: In the Practice, all moral defilement is eliminated.

original: gnas pa mchog la ni nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang / bag la nyal gyi sgrib pa thams cad spong bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa mchog la ni nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang / bag la nyal gyi sgrib pa thams cad spong bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The supreme abiding is to be known as the abandonment of all the obscurations of the afflictions, of the instincts, and of the dormant tendencies.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la 'jug pa'o //🔽shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len ni @185a * //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la 'jug pa'o // shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len ni @185a * //
translated: And that is the entry into the Tathagata's abiding.

original: rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The negative reflex action which is the side of the knowable obscuration is to be known as threefold:

original: lpags shun la yod pa dang / spri la yod pa dang / snying po la yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lpags shun la yod pa dang / spri la yod pa dang / snying po la yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: like that which is in the outer husk, like that which is in the inner kernel, and like that which is in the heart.

original: de la lpags shun la yod pa lta bu ni rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la spong ngo //
analyzed: de la lpags shun la yod pa lta bu ni rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la spong ngo //
translated: Of these, that which is like that in the outer husk is abandoned in the abiding of the Joyous.

original: spri la yod pa lta bu ni mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa la spong ngo //
analyzed: spri la yod pa lta bu ni mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa la spong ngo //
translated: That which is like that in the inner kernel is abandoned in the effortless signlessness.

original: snying po la yod pa lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la spong ste /
analyzed: snying po la yod pa lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la spong ste /
translated: That which is like that in the heart is abandoned in the Tathagata's abiding.

original: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i ye shes nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i ye shes nyid kyang yin no //
translated: And it is the very intuition of the purification of all obscurations.

original: gnas pa gsum po de dag la nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba de'i tshogs su gyur pa ni go rims bzhin du de ma yin pa'i gnas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa gsum po de dag la nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba de'i tshogs su gyur pa ni go rims bzhin du de ma yin pa'i gnas pa rnams yin no //
translated: The three abodes are the collections of the elimination of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, respectively.

original: gnas pa bcu gsum po de dag la rnam par dag pa ni mdor bsdus na bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa bcu gsum po de dag la rnam par dag pa ni mdor bsdus na bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The purities on the thirteen abodes should be understood as eleven in brief.

original: dang po la ni rigs rnam par dag go //
analyzed: dang po la ni rigs rnam par dag go //
translated: On the first, the lineage is pure.

original: gnyis pa la ni dad pas mos pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni dad pas mos pa rnam par dag go //
translated: On the second, faith and devotion are pure.

original: gsum pa la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag go //
translated: On the third, superior intention is pure.

original: bzhi pa la ni tshul khrims rnam par dag go //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni tshul khrims rnam par dag go //
translated: On the fourth, morality is pure.

original: lnga pa la ni sems rnam par dag go //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni sems rnam par dag go //
translated: On the fifth, mind is pure.

original: drug pa dang bdun pa dang brgyad pa la ni yang dag pa'i ye shes la kun du rtsom pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: drug pa dang bdun pa dang brgyad pa la ni yang dag pa'i ye shes la kun du rtsom pa rnam par dag go //
translated: On the sixth, seventh, and eighth, the performance of correct pristine wisdom is pure.

original: dgu pa la ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: dgu pa la ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par dag go //
translated: On the ninth, the completion of the conduct of application is pure.

original: bcu pa la ni de kho na shes pa'i mngon par shes pa sgrub pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: bcu pa la ni de kho na shes pa'i mngon par shes pa sgrub pa rnam par dag go //
translated: On the tenth, the superknowledge of knowing thatness is purified.

original: bcu gcig pa la ni de'i don yang dag par gzhan la bstan pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa la ni de'i don yang dag par gzhan la bstan pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par dag go //
translated: On the eleventh, the analytical knowledge of teaching thatness to others is purified.

original: bcu gnyis pa la ni rnam pa thams cad du shes bya thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i ye shes rnam par dag go //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la ni rnam pa thams cad du shes bya thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i ye shes rnam par dag go //
translated: On the twelfth, the gnosis that engages all objects of knowledge in all their aspects is purified.

original: bcu gsum pa ste /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa ste /
translated: On the thirteenth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa thams cad rnam par dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa thams cad rnam par dag go //
translated: on the level of the tathagatas, all afflictive obscurations and all cognitive obscurations along with their instincts are purified.

original: gnas pa bcu gsum po 'di dag ni sngar bstan pa'i theg pa chen po sdud pa'i chos brgyad po dag tu 'dus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa bcu gsum po 'di dag ni sngar bstan pa'i theg pa chen po sdud pa'i chos brgyad po dag tu 'dus par rig par bya'o //
translated: These thirteen levels should be understood as included in the above-mentioned eight dharmas that comprise the Great Vehicle.

original: gnas pa dang po dang gnyis pa la ni dad pa skyes shing mos par gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod nyan cing sems so //
analyzed: gnas pa dang po dang gnyis pa la ni dad pa skyes shing mos par gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod nyan cing sems so //
translated: On the first and second levels, one listens to and reflects on the Bodhisattva Collection with faith and interest.

original: gnas pa gsum po la ni bsgom pa'i rnam pa thob pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams su len to //
analyzed: gnas pa gsum po la ni bsgom pa'i rnam pa thob pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams su len to //
translated: In the three abodes, he practices the superior intention which is preceded by the attainment of the aspects of meditation.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gnas pa rnams la ni mtshan ma med pa'i rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i bar du sgom pa mang du byed do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnas pa rnams la ni mtshan ma med pa'i rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i bar du sgom pa mang du byed do //
translated: In the other abodes, he cultivates the meditation of the signless with effort.

original: de'i gong ma byang chub sems dpa'i gnas @185b pa spyod pa yongs su dag pas bsdus pa gsum po dag la ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i gong ma byang chub sems dpa'i gnas @185b pa spyod pa yongs su dag pas bsdus pa gsum po dag la ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub po //
translated: In the three higher abodes, which are included in the bodhisattva's pure conduct, he accomplishes the result of meditation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la ni gtan du nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du nyan thos kyi gnas pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la ni gtan du nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du nyan thos kyi gnas pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: In the Tathagata's abode, he should be known as having attained final deliverance.🔽These twelve abodes of the bodhisattva should be known as being like the abodes of the sravaka.

original: nyan thos kyi rang gi rigs la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa dang po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rang gi rigs la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa dang po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The first abode of the bodhisattva should be known as being like the sravaka's abode in his own family.

original: de'i yang dag par skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yang dag par skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Just as there is the first stage of the path of preparation for entry into the faultless, so here is the second stage of abiding.

original: de'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa gsum pa'o //
translated: Just as there is the stage of entry into the faultless, so here is the third stage of abiding.

original: de'i shes nas dad pa thob pa'i gong du zag pa zad par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa dgyes pa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes nas dad pa thob pa'i gong du zag pa zad par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa dgyes pa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Just as there is the stage of abiding in the higher morality pleasing to the Aryas for the sake of eliminating the defilements after attaining faith through knowledge, so here is the fourth stage of abiding.

original: de'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas /
translated: Based on that higher morality,

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa lnga pa'o //
translated: just as there is the stage of abiding in the higher mind training, so here is the fifth stage of abiding.

original: de'i ji ltar thob pa'i bden pa shes pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa drug pa dang bdun pa dang brgyad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ji ltar thob pa'i bden pa shes pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa drug pa dang bdun pa dang brgyad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as there is the stage of abiding in the higher wisdom training in the knowledge of the truths as attained, so here should be known the sixth, seventh, and eighth stages of abiding.

original: de'i shes bya shin tu brtags nas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes bya shin tu brtags nas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa dgu pa'o //
translated: Just as his ninth stage is the same as the bodhisattva's stage of the one who practices meditation on the signless, because he is engaged in the meditative concentration on the signless after having thoroughly investigated the knowable.

original: de'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yongs su grub pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yongs su grub pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa bcu pa'o //
translated: Just as his tenth stage is the same as the bodhisattva's stage of the one who practices the perfected meditative concentration on the signless.

original: de'i langs nas rnam par grol ba'i skye mched la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i langs nas rnam par grol ba'i skye mched la gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: Just as his eleventh stage is the same as the bodhisattva's stage of the one who has attained mastery over the liberations, because he has attained mastery over the liberations.

original: de'i rnam pa thams cad du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa bcu gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa thams cad du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni 'di'i gnas pa bcu gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las /
translated: Just as his twelfth stage is the same as the bodhisattva's stage of the one who has attained mastery over all aspects, because he has attained mastery over all aspects.

original: gnas pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: gnas pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter, on the stages, in this Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras: A commentary on the chapter on the stages.

original: // / rnal 'byor gyi gnas gnyis pa rdzogs te //
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor gyi gnas gnyis pa rdzogs te //
translated: The second part of the yoga section is complete.

original: / gnas pa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: / gnas pa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: In brief, they are of five kinds:

original: gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa dang / de @186a * //
analyzed: gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa dang / de @186a * //
translated: birth as the pacification of harm,🔽birth as a companion,🔽birth as a great being,🔽birth as a lord, and

original: dang skal ba mnyam par mthun par 'jug pa dang chen por skye ba dang / bdag por skye ba dang / tha ma'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: dang skal ba mnyam par mthun par 'jug pa dang chen por skye ba dang / bdag por skye ba dang / tha ma'i skye ba'o //
translated: birth as the last.

original: de la gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth as the pacification of harm?

original: 'di la ni byang chub sems dpa' ni mu ges phongs shing gnod pa chen po byung ba'i dus dag tu smon lam btab nas /
analyzed: 'di la ni byang chub sems dpa' ni mu ges phongs shing gnod pa chen po byung ba'i dus dag tu smon lam btab nas /
translated: Here a bodhisattva, having made aspirational prayers, is born at a time when famine has caused great harm and scarcity.

original: sems can rnams tshegs chung ngus 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams tshegs chung ngus 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur /
translated: He becomes a cause for sentient beings to live with little difficulty.

original: nya chen po la sogs pa'i skye gnas rnams su lus chen po dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nya chen po la sogs pa'i skye gnas rnams su lus chen po dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the great fish wombs and so on, he is born with a great body.

original: der skyes pa'i 'gro ba mtha' dag rang gi shas tshim par byed do //
analyzed: der skyes pa'i 'gro ba mtha' dag rang gi shas tshim par byed do //
translated: And he satisfies all the beings born there with his own flesh.

original: sems can nad kyis gnod pa rnams la nad de dag rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam btab nas /
analyzed: sems can nad kyis gnod pa rnams la nad de dag rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam btab nas /
translated: For beings afflicted by disease, he makes the aspiration to completely pacify those diseases.

original: rig sngags 'chang grub pa'i sman pa chen po'i lus yongs su 'dzin par byed do //🔽pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis shin tu gnod par gyur pa'i sems can dag la ni chos bzhin du snyoms par thabs mkhas pas pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyi gnod pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang grub pa'i sman pa chen po'i lus yongs su 'dzin par byed do // pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis shin tu gnod par gyur pa'i sems can dag la ni chos bzhin du snyoms par thabs mkhas pas pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyi gnod pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And he takes on the body of a master of spells, a great physician.

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: For beings who are greatly afflicted by hostile armies, he becomes a powerful king, in order to completely pacify the harm of hostile armies through skillful means, in accordance with Dharma.

original: sems can phan tshun mi mthun pa rnams la ni sdums bya ba dang / 'khon gyi bsam pa spang ba'i phyir tshig brtsan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can phan tshun mi mthun pa rnams la ni sdums bya ba dang / 'khon gyi bsam pa spang ba'i phyir tshig brtsan par 'gyur ro //
translated: For beings who are not in accord with each other, he becomes a judge, in order to reconcile them and eliminate their thoughts of hostility.

original: rgyal po 'bangs rnams la chad pa dang / bcing ba dang / gnod pa sna tshogs byed pa la zhugs pa dag la ni /🔽sems can gyi gnod pa de dag nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyal po 'bangs rnams la chad pa dang / bcing ba dang / gnod pa sna tshogs byed pa la zhugs pa dag la ni / sems can gyi gnod pa de dag nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: He is born in the royal palace of those kings who are engaged in various kinds of harm to their subjects, such as punishing and imprisoning them.

original: de lta bu'i rgyal po'i pho brang dag tu skye ste /🔽rgyal po chos dang ldan zhing sems can la snying brtse ba can du 'gyur ro //🔽sems can gang lha'i gnas 'ba' zhig la mos nas log par lta zhing sdig pa byed pa dag la ni /🔽de dag la snying brtse bas log par lta ba dang / nyes par spyod pa spang ba'i phyir /

analyzed: lha'i gnas de nyid du skye bar 'gyur te / smon lam dang dbang gi stobs kyis snying brtse ba'i sngon du 'gro ba 'di ni dpag tu med par rig par bya ste /
translated: He is born in the royal palace of those kings who are engaged in various kinds of harm to their subjects, such as punishing and imprisoning them.🔽He is born in the royal palace of those kings who are engaged in various kinds of harm to their subjects, such as punishing and imprisoning them.🔽He is born in the royal palace of those kings who are engaged in various kinds of harm to their subjects, such as punishing and imprisoning them.🔽He is born in the royal palace of those kings who are engaged in various kinds of harm to their subjects, such as punishing and imprisoning them.

analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni skye gnas rnam pa sna tshogs su de dang de dag tu skye ba ste /
translated: He is born in the royal palace of those kings who are engaged in various kinds of harm to their subjects, such as punishing and imprisoning them.🔽He is born in the royal palace of those kings who are engaged in various kinds of harm to their subjects, such as punishing and imprisoning them.

original: 'di ni de'i mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief presentation.

original: de dang skal ba mnyam par mthun par 'jug pa'i skye ba gang zhe na /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni smon lam gyis sam /
analyzed: de dang skal ba mnyam par mthun par 'jug pa'i skye ba gang zhe na / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni smon lam gyis sam /
translated: What is birth as a concordant superior?

original: dbang thob pas sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnam pa sna tshogs su skyes pa rnams dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod @186b sbyin dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa gcig la gcig 'khu zhing mi mthun pa rnams dang / de bzhin du bram ze log par lta ba rnams dang /
analyzed: dbang thob pas sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnam pa sna tshogs su skyes pa rnams dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod @186b sbyin dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa gcig la gcig 'khu zhing mi mthun pa rnams dang / de bzhin du bram ze log par lta ba rnams dang /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva, by means of a vow or by the attainment of power, is born as a superior being who is concordant with those sentient beings who are born in various animal wombs, or who are gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, and so on, who are hostile to each other and who are not in harmony, or who are brahmins with wrong views,

original: de bzhin du nyes par spyad pa spyod cing des 'tshol /🔽der mngon par dga' ba rnams dang / de bzhin du 'dod pa rnams la ha cang lhag par zhen cing 'dod pa la mos pa rnams la nyes pa de bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyes par spyad pa spyod cing des 'tshol / der mngon par dga' ba rnams dang / de bzhin du 'dod pa rnams la ha cang lhag par zhen cing 'dod pa la mos pa rnams la nyes pa de bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: or who are living by wrong livelihood,🔽or who are delighting in that, or who are excessively attached to sense pleasures and who are devoted to sense pleasures.

original: sems can de dag dang skal ba 'dra bar gtso bor skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can de dag dang skal ba 'dra bar gtso bor skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In order to turn them away from those faults, he is born as a superior being who is concordant with those sentient beings.

original: de gtso bor gyur nas /
analyzed: de gtso bor gyur nas /
translated: Having become a superior being,

original: sems can de dag gang kun du spyod pa de ni de kun du mi spyod do //
analyzed: sems can de dag gang kun du spyod pa de ni de kun du mi spyod do //
translated: Whatever those sentient beings do not practice, that they practice.

original: de dag dge ba gang kun du mi spyod pa de ni de kun du spyod de /
analyzed: de dag dge ba gang kun du mi spyod pa de ni de kun du spyod de /
translated: Whatever those sentient beings practice, that they do not practice.

original: dge ba kun du spyad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba kun du spyad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of practicing virtue,

original: yang de dag la chos ston te de dag kyang chos bstan pa de dang / mi mthun par kun du spyod pa de dang / thabs mkhas pa des /
analyzed: yang de dag la chos ston te de dag kyang chos bstan pa de dang / mi mthun par kun du spyod pa de dang / thabs mkhas pa des /
translated: they teach the Dharma to those sentient beings, and those sentient beings, by means of that teaching of the Dharma, that practice which is contrary to it, and that skillful means,

original: nyes pa de dag las ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa de dag las ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: turn away from those faults.

original: skye ba 'di yang dpag tu med de snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di yang dpag tu med de snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This rebirth is also immeasurable, as should be understood as stated previously.

original: de la chen por skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chen por skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is rebirth as a great person?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni skye ba na rang bzhin gyis 'jig rten thams cad khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshe dang kha dog dang rigs dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni skye ba na rang bzhin gyis 'jig rten thams cad khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshe dang kha dog dang rigs dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, when a bodhisattva is reborn, he naturally achieves a superior form of evolutionary development in all worlds, in terms of life span, appearance, family, power, and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa des kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las ji skad bstan pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa des kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las ji skad bstan pa'i las byed do //
translated: And by that evolutionary development, he performs the deeds taught in the chapters on the benefit of self and other.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba de yang dpag tu med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba de yang dpag tu med de /
translated: And that birth of the bodhisattva is immeasurable.

original: skye gnas de dang de dag tu skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye gnas de dang de dag tu skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that he is born in all the various wombs.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bdag por skye ba gang zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bdag por skye ba gang zhe na / byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: What is a bodhisattva's sovereign birth?

original: gnas pa bcu pa'i bar dag gi skye ba brjod pa 'dzam bu gling gi dbang phyug nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gnas pa bcu pa'i bar dag gi skye ba brjod pa 'dzam bu gling gi dbang phyug nas bzung ste /
translated: From the first stage, the stage of the joyous, up to the tenth stage,

original: 'og min las 'das nas skye ba'i gnas thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa gang du gnas pa mchog thob pa kho na'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye bar 'gyur ba dbang phyug chen po'i bar de dag ni bdag por skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'og min las 'das nas skye ba'i gnas thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa gang du gnas pa mchog thob pa kho na'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye bar 'gyur ba dbang phyug chen po'i bar de dag ni bdag por skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: the bodhisattva's birth as a sovereign of Jambudvipa up to a great lord of the universe is called sovereign birth.

original: de ni de dag gi las kyi dbang gis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi las kyi dbang gis grub pa yin no //
translated: That is accomplished by the power of his karma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tha ma'i skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tha ma'i skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s final birth?

original: skye ba gang du byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs nas /🔽mdun na 'don gyi khyim mam /
analyzed: skye ba gang du byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs nas / mdun na 'don gyi khyim mam /
translated: It is the birth in which the bodhisattva, having completed the accumulations of the factors of awakening,🔽is born in the house of a priest

original: rgyal po'i pho brang du skyes te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang du skyes te /
translated: or in the palace of a king,🔽and then awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /🔽sangs @187a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing / sangs @187a * //
translated: and🔽performs all the activities of a buddha.

original: rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad kyang mdzad pa 'di ni tha ma'i skye ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad kyang mdzad pa 'di ni tha ma'i skye ba yin te /
translated: This is the final birth,

original: phyi ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma zhes bya'o //
translated: the last one.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus dag tu dge ba dang / bzang ba dang shis pa'i skye ba rnams su skyes pa dang / skye bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba gang su dag kyang rung ba de dag thams cad kyang skye ba lnga po 'di dag tu skye bar zad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus dag tu dge ba dang / bzang ba dang shis pa'i skye ba rnams su skyes pa dang / skye bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba gang su dag kyang rung ba de dag thams cad kyang skye ba lnga po 'di dag tu skye bar zad de /
translated: The bodhisattvas of the past, present, and future are born in auspicious, good, and virtuous births, are born, will be born, and are born in these five births alone.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to this.

original: byis pa'i sar skye ba ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: byis pa'i sar skye ba ni ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for the stage of the foolish.

original: 'di ltar skye ba lnga po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba lnga po 'di dag ni /
translated: Because these five births

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa rnams kyi yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa rnams kyi yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are considered to be those of the wise bodhisattvas.

original: skye ba de dag ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu can yin te /
analyzed: skye ba de dag ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu can yin te /
translated: These births have the fruit of great enlightenment.

original: de dag la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las skye ba'i le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las skye ba'i le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: In dependence on them, the bodhisattvas quickly fully awaken to highest genuine full enlightenment.

original: // / bam po nyi shu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu pa /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, on birth, in this Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, a commentary on the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras.🔽The Bodhisattva’s Conduct

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief, all the bodhisattva deeds of a bodhisattva who is abiding in the bodhisattva’s way of abiding are included in the following four:

original: sems can thams cad yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya ste ;
translated: It should be understood that there are six kinds of complete acceptance of all sentient beings:

original: sems can thams cad cig car yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag pos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin pas yongs su 'dzin pa dang / yun ring po dang / yun ring po ma yin pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa tha ma'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad cig car yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag pos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin pas yongs su 'dzin pa dang / yun ring po dang / yun ring po ma yin pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa tha ma'o //
translated: complete acceptance of all sentient beings at once, complete acceptance as one’s own, complete acceptance through grasping, complete acceptance for a long time, complete acceptance for a short time, and complete acceptance as the final limit.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas ni thog ma sems bskyed pa'i tshe nyid du sems can gyi khams thams cad chung ma'i tshul du yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas ni thog ma sems bskyed pa'i tshe nyid du sems can gyi khams thams cad chung ma'i tshul du yongs su bzung ste /
translated: At the time of first generating the thought of enlightenment, the bodhisattva completely accepts the realm of sentient beings as his wife,

original: bdag gis 'di dag la ci nus ci lcogs kyis rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di dag la ci nus ci lcogs kyis rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: thinking, “I will accomplish benefit and happiness for them in every way, to the best of my ability and strength.”

original: de kho na nyid bzhin du yang byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad cig car yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzhin du yang byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad cig car yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: And he does just that. This is the bodhisattva’s complete acceptance of all sentient beings at once.

original: bdag por gyur pa na pha ma dang / bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rgyal por gyur pa na 'bangs la byang chub sems dpa'i bdag pos yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'du shes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag por gyur pa na pha ma dang / bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rgyal por gyur pa na 'bangs la byang chub sems dpa'i bdag pos yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'du shes 'byung ste /
translated: When he is a master, he takes care of his parents, children, wife, male and female servants, workers, and hired people. When he is a king, he takes care of his subjects with the attitude of a bodhisattva master.

original: de yang yongs su 'dzin pa @187b de la yongs su 'dzin pa dang 'tsham pa'i bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i tshul dang mthun pas 'jug go //
analyzed: de yang yongs su 'dzin pa @187b de la yongs su 'dzin pa dang 'tsham pa'i bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i tshul dang mthun pas 'jug go //
translated: And he engages in the activities appropriate to that attitude of care.

original: pha ma ni thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis dge ba la yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: pha ma ni thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis dge ba la yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
translated: He causes his parents to engage in virtue by various means.

original: thabs sna tshogs kyis dus dus su ma chod pa dang / rim gro yang byed do //
analyzed: thabs sna tshogs kyis dus dus su ma chod pa dang / rim gro yang byed do //
translated: From time to time, he provides them with necessities and service by various means.

original: byas pa gzo ba dang byas pa chor bar yang byed do //🔽pha ma'i sems dang mthun par yang byed do //
analyzed: byas pa gzo ba dang byas pa chor bar yang byed do // pha ma'i sems dang mthun par yang byed do //
translated: He is grateful and appreciative.🔽He acts in accord with the thoughts of his parents.

original: chos kyi don dag la yang de'i dbang du 'gyur bar yang byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi don dag la yang de'i dbang du 'gyur bar yang byed do //
translated: He is under the control of his parents with regard to the aims of the Dharma.

original: bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo la sogs pa la ni dus dus su zas dang gos la sogs pa legs par sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo la sogs pa la ni dus dus su zas dang gos la sogs pa legs par sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives food, clothing, and so on to his children, wife, male and female servants, and so on, in a timely way and in the proper manner.

original: de dag la las kyi mtha' rnams kyis gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag la las kyi mtha' rnams kyis gnod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not oppress them with work.

original: de dag ni nyes pa yang bzod par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni nyes pa yang bzod par byed do //
translated: He endures their faults.

original: na ba rnams la yang legs par nad g-yog byed do //
analyzed: na ba rnams la yang legs par nad g-yog byed do //
translated: He cares for them when they are sick.
