original: de dag dge ba la yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: de dag dge ba la yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
translated: He introduces them to virtue.

original: dus dus su lhag par bya dga' sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pas tshig 'jam par byed do //
analyzed: dus dus su lhag par bya dga' sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pas tshig 'jam par byed do //
translated: He gives them special gifts and speaks pleasantly to them from time to time.

original: de la bran dang bran mo'i 'du shes kyang mi skyed de /
analyzed: de la bran dang bran mo'i 'du shes kyang mi skyed de /
translated: He does not think of them as servants.

original: de dag la bdag nyid dang 'dra ba'am lhag par yongs su skyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag la bdag nyid dang 'dra ba'am lhag par yongs su skyong bar byed do //
translated: He cares for them as much as or more than himself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal por gyur pas ni rgyal srid dang 'bangs la chad pa med pa dang / mtshon cha med pas rgyal srid byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal por gyur pas ni rgyal srid dang 'bangs la chad pa med pa dang / mtshon cha med pas rgyal srid byed de /
translated: A bodhisattva king rules his kingdom and his subjects without punishment and without violence.

original: chos bzhin du longs spyod sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos bzhin du longs spyod sgrub par byed do //
translated: He enjoys his wealth in accordance with the Dharma.

original: rgyud kyis byung ba'i rgyal srid la spyod par byed kyi pha rol gyi yul 'khor gyi tshom du mthus 'phrog par mi byed do //
analyzed: rgyud kyis byung ba'i rgyal srid la spyod par byed kyi pha rol gyi yul 'khor gyi tshom du mthus 'phrog par mi byed do //
translated: He enjoys his kingdom in a way that is in accord with the Dharma, not by seizing through force the kingdom of another king.

original: ci nus ci lcogs kyis sems can rnams sdig pa las zlog par byed de /
analyzed: ci nus ci lcogs kyis sems can rnams sdig pa las zlog par byed de /
translated: To the best of his ability, he turns sentient beings away from evil.

original: 'bangs rnams kyi pha dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bangs rnams kyi pha dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: He is like a father to his subjects.

original: sems can gzhan dag la yang bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin na /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag la yang bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin na /
translated: He is disposed to share with other sentient beings,

original: bdag gi tshal za ba rnams la lta ci smos /
analyzed: bdag gi tshal za ba rnams la lta ci smos /
translated: let alone those who are his own dependents.

original: mi 'khu ba dang bden par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: mi 'khu ba dang bden par smra ba yin te /
translated: He is not deceitful and he speaks the truth.

original: bsad pa dang bcing ba dang chad pas gcod pa dang / gtub pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa sems can la gnod pa rnams rnam par spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsad pa dang bcing ba dang chad pas gcod pa dang / gtub pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa sems can la gnod pa rnams rnam par spangs pa yin no //
translated: He has completely rejected all violence toward sentient beings, such as killing, binding, mutilation, beating, and the like.

original: de la tshogs yang dag par sdud pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dzin pas yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshogs yang dag par sdud pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dzin pas yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this case, the gathering of a following is called the bodhisattva’s “grasping at ownership.”

original: de ni rgyu gnyis kyis 'khor legs par yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: de ni rgyu gnyis kyis 'khor legs par yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
translated: He holds the wheel well by two causes.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rang gi don la legs par 'dzud par byed de /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rang gi don la legs par 'dzud par byed de /
translated: He holds it with a mind free of material desires, and he leads them to their own goal.

original: log pa'i sbyor bas slu bar mi byed pa'o //🔽yongs su 'dzin @188a * //
analyzed: log pa'i sbyor bas slu bar mi byed pa'o // yongs su 'dzin @188a * //
translated: He does not deceive them by false practice.

original: pa thams cad la yang sems snyoms pa yin te /
analyzed: pa thams cad la yang sems snyoms pa yin te /
translated: He is impartial to all who hold the wheel,

original: phyogs 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyogs 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: and he does not take sides.

original: de dag la chos kyi ser sna yang mi byed la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag la chos kyi ser sna yang mi byed la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud kyang mi byed do //
translated: He does not practice stinginess with the Dharma, nor does he practice the miserliness of a teacher.

original: de dag las rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byed par yang mi re la /
analyzed: de dag las rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byed par yang mi re la /
translated: He does not expect service or honor from them.

original: dge ba 'dod pa'i phyir rang byed pa la yang de dag nyid kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs su gzhug pa'i phyir zlog par mi byed do //
analyzed: dge ba 'dod pa'i phyir rang byed pa la yang de dag nyid kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs su gzhug pa'i phyir zlog par mi byed do //
translated: He does not turn away those who want to practice virtue, so that they may accumulate merit.

original: dus la bab na bdag nyid de dag la rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur yang byed do //
analyzed: dus la bab na bdag nyid de dag la rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur yang byed do //
translated: When the time is right, he himself serves and honors them.

original: de dag gis ma rtogs pa'i don yang rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: de dag gis ma rtogs pa'i don yang rtogs par byed la /
translated: He also causes them to understand what they have not understood.

original: rtogs pa yang gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: rtogs pa yang gsal bar byed do //
translated: He makes clear what they have understood.

original: the tshom skyes so cog kyang sel bar byed do //
analyzed: the tshom skyes so cog kyang sel bar byed do //
translated: He removes all doubts that arise.

original: 'gyod pa yang sel bar byed de /
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang sel bar byed de /
translated: He also removes their regrets.

original: don zab mo'i tshig kyang shes rab kyis rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: don zab mo'i tshig kyang shes rab kyis rtogs par byas nas /
translated: Having understood the profound meaning with wisdom,

original: dus dus su ston par byed do //
analyzed: dus dus su ston par byed do //
translated: he teaches it to them from time to time.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang de dag dang mtshungs par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang de dag dang mtshungs par byed do //
translated: He shares their suffering and happiness.

original: bdag nyid las de dag gis zang zing thob par bya ba'i phyir yang lhag pa'i don du sgrub pa dang ldan no //🔽dus dus su de rnams kyi nyes pa yang legs par gleng bar byed de /
analyzed: bdag nyid las de dag gis zang zing thob par bya ba'i phyir yang lhag pa'i don du sgrub pa dang ldan no // dus dus su de rnams kyi nyes pa yang legs par gleng bar byed de /
translated: He is not motivated by material gain, but by the higher goal.🔽From time to time he also reproves their faults.

original: dus dus su rigs par smod par byed do //
analyzed: dus dus su rigs par smod par byed do //
translated: From time to time he reproves them in a reasonable way.

original: de dag na ba'am mi dga' bas thebs na yang nad zhi bar bya ba dang / yid mi dga' ba bsal ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du yal bar mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: de dag na ba'am mi dga' bas thebs na yang nad zhi bar bya ba dang / yid mi dga' ba bsal ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du yal bar mi 'dor ro //
translated: When they are afflicted by illness or unhappiness, he does not completely abandon them, in order to cure their illness and remove their unhappiness.

original: de dag gzugs dang dran pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shes pa la sogs pa dman pa la yang brnyas par mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag gzugs dang dran pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shes pa la sogs pa dman pa la yang brnyas par mi byed do //
translated: He does not despise those who are inferior in physical appearance, memory, effort, knowledge, etc.

original: dus dus su de dag la skyo ba dang du blangs te /
analyzed: dus dus su de dag la skyo ba dang du blangs te /
translated: From time to time he endures their depression and accepts it.

original: rigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: rigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston par byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to them in a reasonable way.

original: dus dus su de dag la dmigs pa'i yang dag pa'i gdams ngag kyang sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: dus dus su de dag la dmigs pa'i yang dag pa'i gdams ngag kyang sbyin par byed do //
translated: From time to time he gives them the right instructions for their objects.

original: de bzhin du 'khor rjes su bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir dkrugs pa yang bzod cing 'khrugs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de dag dang tshul dang kun du spyod pa mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor rjes su bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir dkrugs pa yang bzod cing 'khrugs par mi 'gyur ro // de dag dang tshul dang kun du spyod pa mtshungs pa'am /
translated: In the same way, he endures the disturbance of the retinue and is not disturbed, in order to protect the retinue and to progress himself.

original: lhag par byed de dman par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: lhag par byed de dman par yang mi byed do //
translated: He acts in a way that is similar to theirs or even better, but never worse.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yang chags par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yang chags par mi byed do //
translated: He is not attached to gain and honor.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is compassionate.

original: rgod bag med cing 'phyar ba ma yin la /
analyzed: rgod bag med cing 'phyar ba ma yin la /
translated: He is not agitated or arrogant.

original: tshul khrims dang lta ba dang spyod pa dang 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa yin no //🔽bzhin gyi mdangs ston cing khro gnyer med la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang lta ba dang spyod pa dang 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa yin no // bzhin gyi mdangs ston cing khro gnyer med la /
translated: He is perfect in morality, view, conduct, and livelihood.🔽He shows a cheerful face and is free of frowns.

original: nges pa dang snyan par smra ba dang / gsong por smra ba @188b dang ; 'dzum pa sngon du gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa dang snyan par smra ba dang / gsong por smra ba @188b dang ; 'dzum pa sngon du gtong ba yin no //
translated: He speaks with certainty and pleasantly, with a smile on his face.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par brtson te /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par brtson te /
translated: He is always and uninterruptedly devoted to the virtuous side.

original: bag med pa dang / le lo dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: bag med pa dang / le lo dang bral ba yin no //
translated: He is free of heedlessness and laziness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dus thams cad du 'khor yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dus thams cad du 'khor yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not always keep his retinue,

original: mi 'dzin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: mi 'dzin par yang mi byed do //
translated: nor does he not keep it.

original: gzhan du yang mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du yang mi byed do //
translated: He does not do otherwise.

original: de la sems can gang dag yongs su smin pa chung ngu la gnas pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i yun ring por 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag yongs su smin pa chung ngu la gnas pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i yun ring por 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those sentient beings who are in the lesser stage of development are said to be kept by the bodhisattva for a long time.

original: yun ring mo zhig gis rnam par dag par gyur pa'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring mo zhig gis rnam par dag par gyur pa'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are fortunate to be purified after a long time.

original: gang dag yongs su smin pa 'bring la gnas pa de dag ni yun ring po ma yin par 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag yongs su smin pa 'bring la gnas pa de dag ni yun ring po ma yin par 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who are abiding in middling maturity are called “those who will soon grasp”

original: ring por mi thogs par rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i skal pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring por mi thogs par rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i skal pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are destined to become purified before long.

original: sems can gang dag yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dzin pa'i tha ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dag yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dzin pa'i tha ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Those sentient beings who are abiding in great maturity are called “those who have the final grasping” of a bodhisattva

original: tshe 'di nyid la rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are destined to become purified in this very life.

original: de ltar na rnam pa drug po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can legs par yongs su 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa drug po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can legs par yongs su 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Thus, these six aspects are the bodhisattvas’ proper grasping of sentient beings.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa des 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams yongs su gzung ngo //🔽yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa des 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams yongs su gzung ngo // yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of this grasping, the bodhisattvas of the past, present, and future have grasped, are grasping, and shall grasp sentient beings.

original: yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
translated: They have grasped, are grasping, and shall grasp by means of this grasping.

original: de las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: de las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than that.

original: de las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: de las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to that.

original: de ltar sems can legs par yongs su 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gnod cing nyam nga ba bcu gnyis dang phrad par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems can legs par yongs su 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gnod cing nyam nga ba bcu gnyis dang phrad par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas who are engaged in the good protection of sentient beings encounter twelve kinds of harm and misfortune.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' mkhas par bya'o //
translated: The wise bodhisattva should understand them and not be discouraged.🔽When sentient beings are in conflict, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to do harm to one in order to protect the other, or to have to abandon one in order to protect the other.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.

original: sems can 'gal bar gnas pa rnams la yang na ni gnod pa bya dgos yang na ni yal bar 'dor dgos pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //🔽sems can la sbyor ba drag po yang kun du spyod la /
analyzed: sems can 'gal bar gnas pa rnams la yang na ni gnod pa bya dgos yang na ni yal bar 'dor dgos pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no // sems can la sbyor ba drag po yang kun du spyod la /
translated: When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.🔽When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.

original: bdag gi bsam pa'i nyon mongs pa yang srung bar byed pa ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi bsam pa'i nyon mongs pa yang srung bar byed pa ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: When sentient beings are engaged in violent actions, it is harmful and distressing for the bodhisattva to have to prevent them from doing harm to others, and to have to punish them.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i chos ni nyung ngu zhig yod la /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i chos ni nyung ngu zhig yod la /
translated: When sentient beings are engaged in

original: slong ba po ni mang po zhig slong du 'ongs pa ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: slong ba po ni mang po zhig slong du 'ongs pa ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: Many beggars come to him, and he is troubled by the difficulty of giving to them.

original: de ni gcig pu yin la sems can mang po zhig gis bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs @189a * //
analyzed: de ni gcig pu yin la sems can mang po zhig gis bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs @189a * //
translated: He is alone, and many beings ask him to help them with various tasks.

original: byung ba la grogs bya bar bcol ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //🔽sems las su mi rung zhing /🔽bag med pa'i gnas 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dge ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu len pa /
analyzed: byung ba la grogs bya bar bcol ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no // sems las su mi rung zhing / bag med pa'i gnas 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dge ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu len pa /
translated: He is troubled by the difficulty of helping them.🔽He is troubled by the difficulty of attaining the concentration of the worldly path, which is a state of mental ease.

original: lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba la sems las su mi rung ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //🔽sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod la /
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba la sems las su mi rung ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no // sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod la /
translated: He is troubled by the difficulty of attaining the result of concentration, which is rebirth in the celestial world.

original: sems can gyi don bya bar mi nus pa 'di gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya bar mi nus pa 'di gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: He is troubled by the difficulty of helping beings, although he wishes to do so.

original: sems can blun po dang / g-yon can dang / dmu rgod rnams la chos bstan ba'am /
analyzed: sems can blun po dang / g-yon can dang / dmu rgod rnams la chos bstan ba'am /
translated: He is troubled by the difficulty of teaching the Dharma to foolish, deceitful, and unruly beings.

original: yal bar 'dor ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: yal bar 'dor ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: To abandon them is to encounter harm and misfortune.

original: 'khor ba la rtag tu nyes par yang lta la /
analyzed: 'khor ba la rtag tu nyes par yang lta la /
translated: To always see faults in cyclic existence,

original: 'khor ba gtong bar yang mi byed pa ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba gtong bar yang mi byed pa ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: but not to abandon cyclic existence, is to encounter harm and misfortune.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par ma dag cing dran pa nyams bzhin du 'chi ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par ma dag cing dran pa nyams bzhin du 'chi ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: To die with a superior attitude that is impure and with a loss of mindfulness is to encounter harm and misfortune.

original: bsam pa rnam par ma dag bzhin du gzhan dag gis dam pa mchog tu sdug pa'i dngos po slong ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par ma dag bzhin du gzhan dag gis dam pa mchog tu sdug pa'i dngos po slong ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: To have a superior attitude that is impure and to be asked by others for things that are very dear and valuable is to encounter harm and misfortune.

original: sems can bsam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs can dang mos pa sna tshogs can dag la brda sprad par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: sems can bsam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs can dang mos pa sna tshogs can dag la brda sprad par bya ba 'am /
translated: To have to communicate with sentient beings who have various different attitudes and various different forms of devotion,

original: yal bar 'dor ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: yal bar 'dor ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: or to have to abandon them, is to encounter harm and misfortune.

original: shin tu bag yod par yang bya dgos la ;
analyzed: shin tu bag yod par yang bya dgos la ;
translated: One must be very careful.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyang thams cad du spang bar mi bya ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyang thams cad du spang bar mi bya ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin te /
translated: Also, the afflictions should not be completely abandoned, because that would be harmful and dangerous.

original: de ltar gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni kha cig tu gnod pa che chung brtags la de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni kha cig tu gnod pa che chung brtags la de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, when a bodhisattva encounters harm and danger, in some cases he should investigate the degree of harm and apply himself accordingly.

original: kha cig tu ni gang zag la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gang zag la brtag par bya'o //
translated: In some cases he should investigate the person.

original: kha cig tu ni brtan por dmigs shing rgyu yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni brtan por dmigs shing rgyu yang dag par blangs te /
translated: In some cases he should remain firm in his attention, and,

original: 'dug par byas la smon lam dag kyang legs par gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug par byas la smon lam dag kyang legs par gdab par bya'o //
translated: having taken up the cause, he should make good prayers.

original: kha cig tu ni sems 'jug par mi bya'o //🔽kha cig tu ni shas cher so sor brtags te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni sems 'jug par mi bya'o // kha cig tu ni shas cher so sor brtags te /
translated: In some cases he should not engage his mind.

original: gnas par byas la mi skyo ba dang / bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par byas la mi skyo ba dang / bzod par bya'o //
translated: In some cases he should remain, having investigated well, and he should not be discouraged or impatient.

original: kha cig tu ni btang snyoms su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni btang snyoms su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In some cases he should remain in equanimity.

original: kha cig tu ni brtson 'grus brtsam zhing brtul te bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni brtson 'grus brtsam zhing brtul te bya'o //
translated: In some cases he should apply himself with diligence and be resolute.

original: kha cig tu ni thabs la mkhas par bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni thabs la mkhas par bya ste /
translated: In some cases, he should be skilled in means.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i gnyen po la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gnod cing nyam nga ba thams cad dang phrad cing mngon sum du gyur kyang yi chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i gnyen po la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gnod cing nyam nga ba thams cad dang phrad cing mngon sum du gyur kyang yi chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is skilled in the true antidotes, even though he encounters and confronts all the dangers and difficulties, does not despair,

original: bdag nyid @189b kyang legs par srung bar byed do //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las /
analyzed: bdag nyid @189b kyang legs par srung bar byed do // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las /
translated: and he protects himself well.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the second chapter, concerning the embrace, of this Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, a treatise explaining the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / ji skad bstan pa'i gnas pa bcu gsum po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i sa bdun yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: // / ji skad bstan pa'i gnas pa bcu gsum po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i sa bdun yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The seven levels are to be known as the thirteen stations as taught,🔽the six bodhisattva levels,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'dren ma gcig ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'dren ma gcig ste /
translated: and the one mixed level of the bodhisattvas and tathagatas.

original: rigs kyi sa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa dang / spyod pa sgrub pa'i sa dang / nges pa'i sa dang / spyod pa nges pa'i sa dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa dang / spyod pa sgrub pa'i sa dang / nges pa'i sa dang / spyod pa nges pa'i sa dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'o //
translated: the stage of lineage, the stage of devoted engagement, the stage of pure superior intention, the stage of practicing practice, the stage of certain conduct, the stage of certain conduct, and the stage of going to the ultimate.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun yin te /
translated: These are the seven bodhisattva stages.

original: de dag las tha ma ni 'dren ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las tha ma ni 'dren ma yin no //
translated: The last of these is mixed.

original: de la rigs la gnas pa dang / mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa ni sa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la rigs la gnas pa dang / mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa ni sa gnyis so //
translated: Among these, the stage of lineage and the stage of devoted engagement are the two stages.

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of the joyous is the stage of pure superior intention.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gsum dang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa rtsol ba dang bcas pa ni spyod pa sgrub pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa gsum dang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa rtsol ba dang bcas pa ni spyod pa sgrub pa'i sa'o //
translated: The three stages of superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom, and the stage of practice with exertion in signlessness are the stage of practicing practice.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub pa ni nges pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub pa ni nges pa'i sa ste /
translated: The stage of effortless practice in signlessness is the stage of certainty.

original: sa de la byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'jug pa gsum pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa de la byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'jug pa gsum pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: On this spiritual level, the bodhisattva has entered the third entry into the certainty of liberation.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa ni spyod pa nges pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa ni spyod pa nges pa'i sa'o //
translated: The spiritual level of certain conduct is the spiritual level of the discriminations.

original: gnas pa mchog dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa mchog dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa ste /
translated: The spiritual level of the supreme abode and the spiritual level of the culmination of the Tathagata's abode are the spiritual levels of the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang sa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi gnas pa'i le'u las 'og nas 'chad do //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa las lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang sa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi gnas pa'i le'u las 'og nas 'chad do // de la byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa las lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug pa na /
translated: The spiritual level and abode of the Tathagata will be explained later in the chapter on the abode of the Buddha's qualities.

original: ngan song rnams las ji ltar yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ngan song rnams las ji ltar yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva, when entering the spiritual level of pure universal responsibility from the spiritual level of conduct by faith, transcend the evil destinies?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa'i yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa la byang chub kyi tshogs legs par brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa'i yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa la byang chub kyi tshogs legs par brtsams te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, on the basis of mundane pure meditative concentration, begins well the accumulation of merit and knowledge on the spiritual level of conduct by faith.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa brgya rtsa bcus gzhan yid la mi byed par sems can rnams la snying brtse ba sgom par byed de /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa brgya rtsa bcus gzhan yid la mi byed par sems can rnams la snying brtse ba sgom par byed de /
translated: With the one hundred and ten aspects indicated above, they cultivate compassion for sentient beings, without paying attention to anything else.

original: des bsgoms pa'i rgyus sems can rnams la de lta bu'i snying brtse ba'i bsam pa dang / snying rje ba'i bsam pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bsgoms pa'i rgyus sems can rnams la de lta bu'i snying brtse ba'i bsam pa dang / snying rje ba'i bsam pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Through their cultivation, they attain the attitude of compassion and the attitude of pity for sentient beings.

original: des na sems can rnams kyi don du ngan song rnams la khyim gyi gnas @190a * //🔽kyi tshul du gnas par byed de /
analyzed: des na sems can rnams kyi don du ngan song rnams la khyim gyi gnas @190a * // kyi tshul du gnas par byed de /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, they dwell in the lower realms as if in a home.

original: gal te bdag 'di dag nyid na gnas bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta na yang bdag sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar spro'o snyam ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag 'di dag nyid na gnas bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta na yang bdag sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar spro'o snyam ste /
translated: If I could attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening while remaining here, I would be happy to dispel the suffering of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi ngan song ba'i las thams cad bsam pa dag pa des bdag nyid la rnam par smin par 'dod la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ngan song ba'i las thams cad bsam pa dag pa des bdag nyid la rnam par smin par 'dod la /
translated: With that pure intention, they wish to experience the full consequences of all the lower-realm actions of sentient beings themselves.

original: mi dge ba'i las thams cad gtan du kun du mi spyod par yang yid la smon par byed do //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las thams cad gtan du kun du mi spyod par yang yid la smon par byed do //
translated: He also aspires to never again engage in any nonvirtuous actions.

original: des de ltar 'jig rten pa'i yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan de yongs su bsgoms pas ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len gnas las sel bar byed de /
analyzed: des de ltar 'jig rten pa'i yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan de yongs su bsgoms pas ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len gnas las sel bar byed de /
translated: By cultivating that mundane pure meditative absorption in this way, he eliminates the negative tendencies that are associated with the mental afflictions that lead to the lower realms.

original: de spangs pas sdig pa ngan song ba'i las gtan mi byed pa dang / ngan song du mi 'gro ba'i phyir ring po mi thogs par byang chub sems dpa' de'i gnas 'gyur te /
analyzed: de spangs pas sdig pa ngan song ba'i las gtan mi byed pa dang / ngan song du mi 'gro ba'i phyir ring po mi thogs par byang chub sems dpa' de'i gnas 'gyur te /
translated: Because he has eliminated them, he will not engage in any evil actions that lead to the lower realms and he will not go to the lower realms. Therefore, before long, that bodhisattva will have transformed his or her life.

original: de tsam gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' ngan song du 'gro ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing mos pas spyod pa'i sa las kyang yang dag par 'das la /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' ngan song du 'gro ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing mos pas spyod pa'i sa las kyang yang dag par 'das la /
translated: At that point, the bodhisattva has completely transcended all the lower realms and has also completely transcended the stage of conduct that is based upon devotion.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la yang zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la yang zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He or she has also entered the stage of a pure superior attitude.

original: gnas pa'i le'u las dad pa la sogs pa gnas pa rnam par sbyong ba'i chos bcu po gang dag bstan pa de dag ni 'dir yang sa rnam par sbyong ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i le'u las dad pa la sogs pa gnas pa rnam par sbyong ba'i chos bcu po gang dag bstan pa de dag ni 'dir yang sa rnam par sbyong ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The ten qualities that purify abiding, such as faith, which were taught in the chapter on abiding, should be understood here as purifying the stages.

original: de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are established as antidotes to their resistant tendencies.

original: don gyi mdo dang go rims kyang rig par bya'o //🔽de la bcu po 'di dag ni sa rnam par sbyong ba'i chos bcu po de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: don gyi mdo dang go rims kyang rig par bya'o // de la bcu po 'di dag ni sa rnam par sbyong ba'i chos bcu po de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos yin te /
translated: Their meaning and sequence should be understood.🔽There are ten qualities that purify the stages.

original: de dag gi gnyen por 'di dag rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por 'di dag rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: They are established as antidotes to the ten qualities that are their resistant tendencies.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du sems bskyed pa mi rtsom zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du sems bskyed pa mi rtsom zhing /
translated: Not generating the mind in any way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par mi len pa 'di ni dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par mi len pa 'di ni dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos yin te /
translated: and not taking up the bodhisattva precepts are qualities that are resistant to faith.

original: de'i gnyen po ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is their antidote.

original: sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba'i sems ni snying rje'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba'i sems ni snying rje'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The hostile mind toward sentient beings is the adversary of compassion.

original: de'i gnyen po ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni snying rje'o //
translated: Its antidote is compassion.

original: sems can rnams la gnod sems byed pa ni byams pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod sems byed pa ni byams pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The malice toward sentient beings is the adversary of love.

original: de'i gnyen po ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni byams pa'o //
translated: Its antidote is love.

original: longs spyod dang srog la lta ba ni sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod dang srog la lta ba ni sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The regard for wealth and life is the adversary of generosity.

original: @190b de'i gnyen po ni gtong ba'o //
analyzed: @190b de'i gnyen po ni gtong ba'o //
translated: Its antidote is relinquishment.

original: sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa dang / log par sgrub pa rnyed pa dang / bya ba mang po mi skyo ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa dang / log par sgrub pa rnyed pa dang / bya ba mang po mi skyo ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The harmfulness toward sentient beings and the discouragement from wrong practice, gain, and many activities are the adversaries of non-discouragement.

original: de'i gnyen po ni mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni mi skyo ba'o //
translated: Its antidote is non-discouragement.

original: thabs med pa'i sbyor ba ni bstan bcos shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: thabs med pa'i sbyor ba ni bstan bcos shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The application without skillful means is the adversary of knowledge of the treatises.

original: de'i gnyen po ni bstan bcos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni bstan bcos shes pa'o //
translated: Its antidote is knowledge of the treatises.

original: mi des shing gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par mi byed pa ni 'jig rten shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: mi des shing gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par mi byed pa ni 'jig rten shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The discordant class of the knowledge of the world is the failure to act in accordance with the minds of others.

original: de'i gnyen po ni 'jig rten shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni 'jig rten shes pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the knowledge of the world.

original: dge ba'i chos sgom pa la bag med cing le lo byed pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sgom pa la bag med cing le lo byed pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The discordant class of conscience and shame is the laziness and heedlessness in cultivating virtuous dharmas.

original: de'i gnyen po ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o //🔽'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yun ring po sna tshogs mi bzad cing /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o // 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yun ring po sna tshogs mi bzad cing /
translated: The antidote to that is conscience and shame.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa dag gis nyen pa ni brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa dag gis nyen pa ni brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The discordant class of the power of stability is the distress of the long, various, intense, and continuous sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: de'i gnyen po ni brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the power of stability.

original: ston pa la som nyi dang yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: ston pa la som nyi dang yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The discordant class of worship and service to the Tathagata is doubt, uncertainty, and skepticism about the Teacher.

original: de'i gnyen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is worship and service to the Tathagata.

original: de ltar na de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they are established as antidotes to the adverse side.

original: de dag gi don gyi mdo gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi don gyi mdo gang zhe na /
translated: What is the summary of their meaning?

original: mdor bsdu na chos bcu po 'di dag gis bsam pa dag pa dang / sbyor ba dag par yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na chos bcu po 'di dag gis bsam pa dag pa dang / sbyor ba dag par yongs su bstan te /
translated: In brief, these ten dharmas are taught as the purity of aspiration and the purity of application.

original: de la dang po gsum gyis ni bsam pa dag par bstan /
analyzed: de la dang po gsum gyis ni bsam pa dag par bstan /
translated: Among them, the first three are taught as the purity of aspiration.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sbyor ba ngag par bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sbyor ba ngag par bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest are to be known as the purity of application.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la mngon par dad pa ni sems can sdug bsngal pa rnams la snying rje'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la mngon par dad pa ni sems can sdug bsngal pa rnams la snying rje'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has faith in enlightenment has compassion for suffering beings.

original: snying rje bar gyur na bdag gis 'di dag yongs su bskyab par bya'o snyam du byams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje bar gyur na bdag gis 'di dag yongs su bskyab par bya'o snyam du byams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having become compassionate, he thinks, “I must protect these.” Thus, he becomes loving.

original: de ltar byams pa'i sems su gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar byams pa'i sems su gyur na /
translated: Having become loving,

original: longs spyod dang / srog la mi lta bas de dag la yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / srog la mi lta bas de dag la yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He gives them away without regard for wealth or life.

original: mi lta bas de dag gi don la sbyor ba na yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: mi lta bas de dag gi don la sbyor ba na yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
translated: He is not discouraged in working for their welfare because he is not concerned with his own welfare.

original: yongs su mi skyo na bstan bcos shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyo na bstan bcos shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is not discouraged, he will know the treatises.

original: bstan bcos shes na des ji ltar 'jig rten du 'jug par bya ba de bzhin du shes te /
analyzed: bstan bcos shes na des ji ltar 'jig rten du 'jug par bya ba de bzhin du shes te /
translated: If he knows the treatises, he will know how to act in the world.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten shes pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten shes pa yin //
translated: Thus he knows the world.

original: bdag nyid kyang nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas ngo tsha zhing khrel @191a * //🔽yod par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas ngo tsha zhing khrel @191a * // yod par byed do //
translated: He is ashamed and embarrassed by the indulgence of his own reactive emotions.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan zhing khrel yod pa dang ldan na nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur zhing brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan zhing khrel yod pa dang ldan na nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur zhing brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is ashamed and embarrassed, he will not fall under the power of reactive emotions, and he will attain the strength of steadfastness.

original: brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa thob na yang dag pa'i sbyor ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa thob na yang dag pa'i sbyor ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If he attains the strength of steadfastness, he will not fall away from right practice.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel la /
translated: He will grow in virtuous qualities.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They will make offerings to the Tathagata and serve him with the offering of practice, the offering of material things, and the offering of respect.

original: de ltar na 'di ni chos bcu po de dag go rims bzhin du yang dag par 'grub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni chos bcu po de dag go rims bzhin du yang dag par 'grub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that these ten dharmas are accomplished in their proper order.

original: chos bcu po 'di rnams kyis ni sa thams cad rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las /
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di rnams kyis ni sa thams cad rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las /
translated: These ten dharmas purify all the stages.🔽This concludes the third chapter, on the stages, in this Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, a treatise on the stages of practice of the profound perfection of wisdom.🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes

original: sa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: sa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes

original: // / mos pas spyod pa'i sa yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad la ni mdor bsdu na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: // / mos pas spyod pa'i sa yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad la ni mdor bsdu na / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes🔽The Stages of Cultivating the Mahāyāna Antidotes

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: The Stages of Cultivating the Mah

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of the perfections, the practice of the elements leading to enlightenment, the practice of the superknowledges, and the practice of bringing about the maturity of beings.

original: de la sngar bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de la sngar bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: The practice of the perfections is the six perfections taught above, the perfection of skill in means, the perfection of vows, the perfection of power, and the perfection of knowledge.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po 'di dag bsdus pa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po 'di dag bsdus pa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The practice of the perfections is the practice of these ten perfections.

original: de ltar sngar bstan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis ni thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngar bstan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis ni thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of skill in means is the twelve kinds of skill in means taught above.

original: sngar bstan pa'i smon lam rnam pa lnga ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i smon lam rnam pa lnga ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of vows is the five kinds of vows taught above.

original: stobs bcu'i sbyor ba rnam par dag pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i sbyor ba rnam par dag pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of power is the purification of the application of the ten powers.

original: chos thams cad la ci lta ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa shes pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la ci lta ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa shes pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the knowledge of the arrangement of all things as they are.

original: de la don dam par 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'i shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dam par 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'i shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the perfection of wisdom is the wisdom that is engaged in the apprehension of the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob 'dzin pa la zhugs pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob 'dzin pa la zhugs pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is that which is engaged in the apprehension of the conventional.

original: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang ye shes tshad med pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang ye shes tshad med pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Another formulation: The perfection of skillful means is immeasurable knowledge.

original: @191b gong nas gong du ye shes khyad par can don du gnyer ba ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: @191b gong nas gong du ye shes khyad par can don du gnyer ba ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of vows is the pursuit of the distinctive knowledge that is higher and higher.

original: bdud thams cad kyis lam mi chod pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis lam mi chod pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of power is the path that is not interrupted by any of the demons.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du shes bya rtogs pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽sngar ji skad bstan pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yan chad byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po de dag bsdus pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du shes bya rtogs pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // sngar ji skad bstan pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yan chad byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po de dag bsdus pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of intuitive wisdom is the realization of the knowable as it is.🔽The practice of the factors of enlightenment is the seven factors of enlightenment, beginning with mindfulness, as previously explained. The practice of the branches of the path is the eight branches of the holy eightfold path, beginning with right view. The practice of the aids to enlightenment is the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, beginning with the four foundations of mindfulness, as previously explained. The practice of the four investigations and the four knowledges of the way things are is the practice of the bodhisattvas.

original: mthu'i le'u las ji skad bstan pa'i mngon par shes pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //🔽sngar bstan pa'i dpag tu med pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mthu'i le'u las ji skad bstan pa'i mngon par shes pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //🔽sngar bstan pa'i dpag tu med pa gnyis te /
translated: The practice of the superknowledges is the six superknowledges as previously explained in the chapter on power.🔽The practice of the immeasurables is the four immeasurables, beginning with loving kindness.

original: 'dul ba dpag tu med pa dang / 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i le'u las ji skad bstan pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba thams cad bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba dpag tu med pa dang / 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i le'u las ji skad bstan pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba thams cad bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The conduct of bringing beings to maturity is the bodhisattvas' conduct of bringing beings to maturity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di bzhis ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di bzhis ni /
translated: By means of these four kinds of bodhisattva conduct,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that all the bodhisattvas' conduct is included.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag ni yun ring po bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis yang dag par 'grub pa dang / de ma yin pa'i 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag ni yun ring po bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis yang dag par 'grub pa dang / de ma yin pa'i 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: As for these ten qualities beginning with generosity, they are accomplished over a long period of time, three measureless kalpas, and they are superior to all the roots of virtue of mundane beings, of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, by their natural purity.

original: byang chub mchog gi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub mchog gi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they fully grasp the supreme result of enlightenment,

original: dus kyi mchog gis yang dag par 'grub pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i mchog gis rnam par dag pa dang / 'bras bu mchog sbyin par byed pas na /
analyzed: dus kyi mchog gis yang dag par 'grub pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i mchog gis rnam par dag pa dang / 'bras bu mchog sbyin par byed pas na /
translated: they are supreme in terms of time, supreme in terms of the purity of their nature, and supreme in terms of the result they bestow.

original: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni rgyu gsum gyis go rims su gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni rgyu gsum gyis go rims su gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfections are to be understood as being arranged in a certain order for three reasons.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: gnyen po dang / 'byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: gnyen po dang / 'byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus so //
translated: They are antidotes, sources, and results that are evolutionary.

original: de la ser sna dang / nyes par spyod pa dang / sems can rnams la 'khon gyis gnod par byed pa dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mod dma' zhing ha 'dang can dang / @192a * //
analyzed: de la ser sna dang / nyes par spyod pa dang / sems can rnams la 'khon gyis gnod par byed pa dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mod dma' zhing ha 'dang can dang / @192a * //
translated: Therein, stinginess, immorality, malice toward living beings, laziness, distraction, and lack of faith are the six obscurations to generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom, respectively.

original: chos drug po 'di dag ni zang zing dang / chos dang / byang chub la sgrib pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: chos drug po 'di dag ni zang zing dang / chos dang / byang chub la sgrib pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: These six obscurations are the bases of the obscurations to the enjoyment of material goods, the Dharma, and enlightenment.

original: chos drug po 'di dag gi gnyen por pha rol tu phyin pa drug ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: chos drug po 'di dag gi gnyen por pha rol tu phyin pa drug ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: The six perfections are the antidotes to these six faults.

original: de ma yin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang 'di dag nyid du 'dus te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang 'di dag nyid du 'dus te /
translated: The other perfections are included in these six.

original: de ltar na gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Thus they are established as antidotes.

original: 'byung bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they established as antidotes?

original: 'di la thog ma kho nar byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod la mi lta na /
analyzed: 'di la thog ma kho nar byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod la mi lta na /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva, from the very outset, not looking to his own enjoyment,

original: khyim gyi 'dod pa rnams btang nas /
analyzed: khyim gyi 'dod pa rnams btang nas /
translated: abandons the desires of the household life

original: tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: and takes up morality.

original: tshul khrims la gus na gzhan gyis rnam par mtho btsams pa bzod de gzhan la rnam par mtho mi btsams so //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gus na gzhan gyis rnam par mtho btsams pa bzod de gzhan la rnam par mtho mi btsams so //
translated: When he is respectful of morality, he endures the violence of others, and does not himself become violent.

original: de yang dag par len pa dang / bzod pas tshul khrims rnam par dag na mi 'gyur ba dang / rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas sbyor ro //
analyzed: de yang dag par len pa dang / bzod pas tshul khrims rnam par dag na mi 'gyur ba dang / rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas sbyor ro //
translated: By taking up and enduring, he purifies morality, and by perseverance he applies himself to virtue without turning back or breaking off.

original: de de ltar brtson 'grus kyis bag yod par gyur na /
analyzed: de de ltar brtson 'grus kyis bag yod par gyur na /
translated: When he is thus diligent and heedful,

original: sems rtse gcig pa dge ba la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa dge ba la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the mind becomes engaged in virtuous one-pointed concentration.

original: de de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes bya shes shing mthong bar bya ba mthong ste /
analyzed: de de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes bya shes shing mthong bar bya ba mthong ste /
translated: When the mind is thus concentrated, one sees and knows the objects of knowledge as they are and in their variety.

original: de ltar na de rnams 'byung ba'i go rims kyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de rnams 'byung ba'i go rims kyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the order of their occurrence should be understood as the order in which they are presented.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the ripened result?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos 'di yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos 'di yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa ni /
translated: In this life, the bodhisattva takes up and maintains these virtuous qualities such as generosity.

original: gzhi nges phyi ma la sbyin pa las gyur pa'i phyi rol gyi longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhi nges phyi ma la sbyin pa las gyur pa'i phyi rol gyi longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur la /
translated: As a consequence, in future lives, he obtains the perfection of external enjoyments that results from generosity.

original: de ma yin pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gyur pa'i nang gi lus kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gyur pa'i nang gi lus kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga thob par 'gyur te /
translated: And he obtains the perfection of the five inner aspects of the body that results from the other perfections such as morality.

original: lus kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fivefold excellence of the body?

original: bde 'gror gtogs pa'i lha dang / mi dang / de ma yin pa'i sems can rnams las tshe la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: bde 'gror gtogs pa'i lha dang / mi dang / de ma yin pa'i sems can rnams las tshe la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
translated: The first excellence is to be born in a happy realm of existence, among the gods or humans, and to have a body that is superior to other beings in terms of life span and so forth.

original: rang bzhin gyis dge ba la sbyor ba la mi skyo ba dang / gzhan gyi nyes pa bzod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa mi dga' ba 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dge ba la sbyor ba la mi skyo ba dang / gzhan gyi nyes pa bzod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa mi dga' ba 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second excellence is to be naturally virtuous, to be indefatigable in applying oneself to virtue, to be patient with the faults of others, and to take no pleasure in harming others.

original: rang bzhin gyis brtsams pa thams cad la 'bang pa brtan pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis brtsams pa thams cad la 'bang pa brtan pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third excellence is to be naturally firm in all one’s undertakings.

original: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa shas chung zhing don thams cad la mngon par shes @192b pa myur bar bya ba la rang gi sems la dbang zhing sems las su rung ba 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa shas chung zhing don thams cad la mngon par shes @192b pa myur bar bya ba la rang gi sems la dbang zhing sems las su rung ba 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth excellence is to have a body that is naturally free of strong afflictions, to have mastery over one’s own mind in order to quickly develop the superknowledges in all matters, and to have a pliant mind.

original: rang bzhin gyis blo rgya che ba dang / don thams cad la mkhas shing mdzangs pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa lnga pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis blo rgya che ba dang / don thams cad la mkhas shing mdzangs pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa lnga pa ste /
translated: This natural breadth of mind and skill and prudence in all matters is the fifth perfection.

original: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las gyur pa 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyi go rims su rnam par gzhag pa gzhan yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las gyur pa 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyi go rims su rnam par gzhag pa gzhan yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These are the other aspects of the six perfections that are to be known as being respectively established from the point of view of their evolutionary development.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi tshogs dang / rang bzhin dang 'khor dang / kun du bsrung ba dang bcas pas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi tshogs dang / rang bzhin dang 'khor dang / kun du bsrung ba dang bcas pas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o ;
translated: In this regard, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of patience, together with their respective collections, natures, retinues, and complete protections, should be known as the bodhisattvas’ complete training in superior morality.

original: ; bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: ; bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditative absorption is the training in superior mind.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the training in superior wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lam ni gsum las lhag pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lam ni gsum las lhag pa med do //
translated: There is no path of training for bodhisattvas beyond these three.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lam thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lam thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because all the paths of training of the bodhisattva are included in these,🔽

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni drug po kho nar rnam par gzhag pa yin te /🔽'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni drug po kho nar rnam par gzhag pa yin te / 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the perfections are established as only six in number, because they include all the bodhisattva's paths of learning.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this, nothing greater than this.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni mdor bsdu na bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni mdor bsdu na bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva's activities are, in brief, these four.

original: de dag gis de rnams kyi bya ba thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: de dag gis de rnams kyi bya ba thams cad bsdus te /
translated: They include all his activities,

original: byang chub kyi phyir dge ba la goms par byed pa dang / de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i de kho na'i don rtogs par byed pa dang / mthu yang dag par 'grub par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir dge ba la goms par byed pa dang / de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i de kho na'i don rtogs par byed pa dang / mthu yang dag par 'grub par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'o //
translated: namely, the cultivation of virtue for the sake of enlightenment, the realization of the meaning of reality which precedes that, the accomplishment of power, and the evolutionary development of living beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni bya ba bzhi po 'di dag spyod pa bzhi po dag gi go rims bzhin du byed cing rjes su sgrub po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni bya ba bzhi po 'di dag spyod pa bzhi po dag gi go rims bzhin du byed cing rjes su sgrub po //
translated: The bodhisattva practices these four activities of the bodhisattva in the same order in which they are undertaken and accomplished.

original: de lta bas na de'i gong du spyod pa rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i gong du spyod pa rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no higher stage of conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las spyod pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las spyod pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter, concerning conduct, in this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.🔽The Qualities of the Buddha

original: // / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa las brtsams te /
analyzed: // / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa las brtsams te /
translated: The qualities of the Buddha are now discussed, beginning with the stations of the tathagatas and the level of the tathagatas that is the ultimate destination.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu yod de /
translated: The Buddha has one hundred and forty unique qualities,🔽such as the thirty-two major marks of a supreme being,🔽the eighty minor marks,🔽the four kinds of perfect purity,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu @193a * //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu @193a * //
translated: and the ten powers of the tathagatas.

original: dang ; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par 'joms pa dang / rnam pa thams cad dang mchog mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par 'joms pa dang / rnam pa thams cad dang mchog mkhyen pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects and the supreme.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two marks of a great man?

original: skyes bu chen po'i zhabs shin tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i zhabs shin tu gnas pa ste /
translated: The great man has well-placed feet.

original: sa la mnyam par 'bab pa 'di ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan yin no //
analyzed: sa la mnyam par 'bab pa 'di ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan yin no //
translated: The soles of his feet are even on the ground - this is a mark of a great man.

original: phyag dang zhabs gnyis kyi mthil nas 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa mu khyud can lte ba dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa byung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i zhabs sor mo ring ba dang / zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs gnyis kyi mthil nas 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa mu khyud can lte ba dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa byung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i zhabs sor mo ring ba dang / zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang /
translated: On the soles of his hands and feet there are wheels with a thousand spokes, with rims and hubs, complete in every way. The great man has long fingers and toes, broad heels,

original: phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel pa dang / zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / byin pa ri dags aa na ya'i lta bu dang / sku ma btud pa dang / mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa dang /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel pa dang / zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / byin pa ri dags aa na ya'i lta bu dang / sku ma btud pa dang / mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa dang /
translated: His hands and feet are soft and youthful. His hands and feet are webbed. His feet are without protuberances. His legs are like those of the black antelope. His body is not bent over. His sexual organ is concealed in a sheath.

original: shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / spu re re ste de'i sku'i spu re re nas skye la 'jam zhing mthon mthing la lcang lo ltar g-yas su 'khyil pa dang / sku mdog gser 'dra zhing 'od 'dom gang dang ldan pa dang ;
analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / spu re re ste de'i sku'i spu re re nas skye la 'jam zhing mthon mthing la lcang lo ltar g-yas su 'khyil pa dang / sku mdog gser 'dra zhing 'od 'dom gang dang ldan pa dang ;
translated: His body is like a nyagrodha tree, with its width and height in proportion. The hairs on his body point upward. Each of his body hairs is dark blue, soft, and curls to the right in coils. His body is golden colored and has a halo one fathom wide.

original: pags pa srab ste pags pa srab pa'i phyir de'i sku la rdul dang dri ma mi chags pa dang / sku'i bdun mtho bas te /
analyzed: pags pa srab ste pags pa srab pa'i phyir de'i sku la rdul dang dri ma mi chags pa dang / sku'i bdun mtho bas te /
translated: His skin is smooth, and because of his smooth skin, dust and dirt do not stick to his body. His body has seven prominent parts.

original: de'i sku'i bdun mtho bar gyur pa ni phyag la gnyis dang / zhabs la gnyis dang / phrag pa la gnyis dang / mgul la gcig go //
analyzed: de'i sku'i bdun mtho bar gyur pa ni phyag la gnyis dang / zhabs la gnyis dang / phrag pa la gnyis dang / mgul la gcig go //
translated: His body has seven prominent parts: two hands, two feet, two shoulders, and the neck.

original: ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang / thal gong rgyas pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang /
analyzed: ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang / thal gong rgyas pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang /
translated: His upper body is like a lion’s, his shoulders are well-developed, his chest is broad, his body is large and straight, he has forty teeth, his teeth are even, his teeth are closely set, and his teeth are very white.

original: 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / ljags ring zhing srab pa dang / ljags ring bas zhal nas ljags brkyang na zhal thams cad dbu skra'i mtshams la thug par khebs pa dang / ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa brnyes pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / ljags ring zhing srab pa dang / ljags ring bas zhal nas ljags brkyang na zhal thams cad dbu skra'i mtshams la thug par khebs pa dang / ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa brnyes pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan te /
