translated: His jaws are like a lion’s, his tongue is long and slender, his long tongue can cover his entire face up to the hairline, he has attained the supreme taste, and he has the voice of Brahma.

original: bya ka la ping ka bzhin du gsung yid du 'ong zhing /
analyzed: bya ka la ping ka bzhin du gsung yid du 'ong zhing /
translated: His voice is pleasant like the kalaviṅka bird.

original: gsung gi gdangs rnga sgra lta bu dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / rdzi ma ba'i lta bu dang / dbu gtsug tor @193b dang ldan pa dang / de'i mdzod spu dung gi mdog 'dra ba la g-yas su 'khyil pa smin mtshams su byung ba 'di ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan yin no //
analyzed: gsung gi gdangs rnga sgra lta bu dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / rdzi ma ba'i lta bu dang / dbu gtsug tor @193b dang ldan pa dang / de'i mdzod spu dung gi mdog 'dra ba la g-yas su 'khyil pa smin mtshams su byung ba 'di ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan yin no //
translated: The sound of his voice is like a drum, his eyes are deep blue, his eyelashes are like those of a magnificent heifer, his head is crowned with a protuberance, and the hair between his eyebrows is the color of the dawn, curling to the right.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighty minor marks?

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo nyi shu tshigs dang bcas pa dang / sen mo dang bcas pa rnams dpe byad bzang po nyi shu dang ; phyag dang zhabs gnyis la mthil rgyab brgyad de /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo nyi shu tshigs dang bcas pa dang / sen mo dang bcas pa rnams dpe byad bzang po nyi shu dang ; phyag dang zhabs gnyis la mthil rgyab brgyad de /
translated: The twenty fingers and toes, with their joints and nails, are twenty minor marks. The two hands and two feet have eight surfaces,

original: phyag gnyis la bzhi dang / zhabs gnyis la bzhi ste dpe byad bzang po brgyad dang / long bu dang / pus mo dang / brla rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / phyag gi rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang /
analyzed: phyag gnyis la bzhi dang / zhabs gnyis la bzhi ste dpe byad bzang po brgyad dang / long bu dang / pus mo dang / brla rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / phyag gi rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang /
translated: four on each, which are the eight minor marks. The two ankles, two knees, and two thighs are six minor marks. The two forearms, two elbows, and two shoulders are six minor marks.

original: sta zur dang / rked pa dang / 'bras bu gnyis la dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mdoms dang / snam gtsos gnyis la dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dku do dang / phyal dang / lte ba dang / rtsib logs gnyis dang /🔽mchan khung gnyis dang / nu ma gnyis dang bsdus pa la dpe byad bzang po drug dang / brang dang / thugs ka dang / mgur dang / rgyab dang / dpe byad bzang po drug cu po 'di rnams ni mgur yan chad ma gtogs par sku man chad du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sta zur dang / rked pa dang / 'bras bu gnyis la dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mdoms dang / snam gtsos gnyis la dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dku do dang / phyal dang / lte ba dang / rtsib logs gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang / nu ma gnyis dang bsdus pa la dpe byad bzang po drug dang / brang dang / thugs ka dang / mgur dang / rgyab dang / dpe byad bzang po drug cu po 'di rnams ni mgur yan chad ma gtogs par sku man chad du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The two shoulders, the waist, and the two buttocks are the two excellent marks. The two genitals and the two thighs are the two excellent marks. The two hips, the two calves, the two ankles, and the two feet are the two excellent marks.🔽The two hands, the two arms, the two shoulders, the two eyes, the two ears, the two nostrils, the two eyebrows, the two forehead lines, the two temples, the two cheeks, the two lips, the two rows of teeth, the palate, the two lips, the two jaws, the two buttocks, the two thighs, the two calves, the two ankles, and the two feet are the thirty-two excellent marks.

original: tshems kyi phreng ba gnyis la dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / rkan thon kor dang bcas pa dang / sgros gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mkhur ba shin tu rgyas pa dang / 'gram pa rgyas shing dbyibs legs pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang /
analyzed: tshems kyi phreng ba gnyis la dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / rkan thon kor dang bcas pa dang / sgros gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mkhur ba shin tu rgyas pa dang / 'gram pa rgyas shing dbyibs legs pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang /
translated: The two rows of teeth are the two excellent marks. The palate and the two lips are the two excellent marks. The two jaws, the two buttocks, the two thighs, the two calves, the two ankles, and the two feet are the two excellent marks.

original: spyan gnyis thon kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / smin ma gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / shangs kyi bu ga gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dpral ba dang / spyan gyi grva gnyis dang / snyan gnyis ni dpe byad bzang po bzhi dang /
analyzed: spyan gnyis thon kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / smin ma gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / shangs kyi bu ga gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dpral ba dang / spyan gyi grva gnyis dang / snyan gnyis ni dpe byad bzang po bzhi dang /
translated: The two eyes and the two eye sockets are two of the excellent signs, the two eyebrows are two of the excellent signs, the two nostrils are two of the excellent signs, the forehead, the two corners of the eyes and the two ears are four of the excellent signs,🔽the hair of the head and the excellent signs are one of the excellent signs.

original: dbu skra dang bcas pa'i dpe byad bzang po dang / 'di rnams ni mgur yan chad kyi dpe byad bzang po nyi shu yin te /
analyzed: dbu skra dang bcas pa'i dpe byad bzang po dang / 'di rnams ni mgur yan chad kyi dpe byad bzang po nyi shu yin te /
translated: These are the twenty excellent signs above the collar bone.

original: snga ma'i drug cu dang / phyi ma'i nyi shu gcig tu bsdoms nas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur 'gyur te /
analyzed: snga ma'i drug cu dang / phyi ma'i nyi shu gcig tu bsdoms nas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur 'gyur te /
translated: The former sixty and the latter twenty are combined to make eighty excellent signs.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'di dag ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sa la zhugs pa ni skyes pas thob pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mtshan rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'di dag ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sa la zhugs pa ni skyes pas thob pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mtshan rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: These major and minor marks are obtained by those who have entered the stage of superior intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par smin pas 'thob po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par smin pas 'thob po //
translated: Bodhisattvas obtain them through karmic maturation.

original: de yan chad nas byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs pa'i bar du ni de dag gong nas @194a * //🔽gong du rnam par dag par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yan chad nas byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs pa'i bar du ni de dag gong nas @194a * // gong du rnam par dag par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: From that point on, up to the point of entering the stage of a bodhisattva, they become increasingly pure.

original: lhag ma ma 'dres pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa la sogs pa shin tu rnam par dag cing yongs su rdzogs pa rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ma 'dres pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa la sogs pa shin tu rnam par dag cing yongs su rdzogs pa rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The remaining perfections, which are pure in all respects, are obtained in their completely pure and perfected form.

original: ma rdzogs pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa yan chad nas sngon byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba na yang de dag dang ldan par yod do //
analyzed: ma rdzogs pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa yan chad nas sngon byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba na yang de dag dang ldan par yod do //
translated: The incomplete perfections are possessed by those who have not yet reached the stage of pure superior intention, but who have already become bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad ni bye brag med par mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po thams cad 'grub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad ni bye brag med par mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po thams cad 'grub par byed pa yin no //
translated: All the accumulations of enlightenment, without distinction, bring about the attainment of all the major and minor marks.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs de yang rnam pa gnyis te byang chub dang nye ba dang ring ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs de yang rnam pa gnyis te byang chub dang nye ba dang ring ba'o //
translated: The accumulations of enlightenment are of two kinds: distant and proximate.

original: de la ring ba ni rnam par smin pas ma thob pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams la gang yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la ring ba ni rnam par smin pas ma thob pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams la gang yod pa'o //
translated: The distant is that which exists in the major and minor marks that are not obtained through evolution.

original: nye ba ni rnam par smin pas dang po thob pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams dang / de las gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i khyad par du gyur pa'i tshe gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba ni rnam par smin pas dang po thob pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams dang / de las gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i khyad par du gyur pa'i tshe gang yin pa'o //
translated: The near is that which exists in the major and minor marks that are obtained through evolution, and that which exists in the special progress of purification beyond that.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'di dag ni las rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'di dag ni las rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: These major and minor marks are the result of the evolution of various actions.

original: 'dul bar 'dod pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dul bar 'dod pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Lord taught them for the sake of those who are to be disciplined.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can sdig pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs kun du spyod pa la dga' ba de dag ci ltar na sdig pa'i las mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa rnam pa sna tshogs de'i gnyen po dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'grub
analyzed: sems can sdig pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs kun du spyod pa la dga' ba de dag ci ltar na sdig pa'i las mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa rnam pa sna tshogs de'i gnyen po dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'grub
translated: How can those sentient beings who delight in engaging in various kinds of sinful actions be made to turn away from those various kinds of sinful actions, which are their adversaries, and to take up the various kinds of virtuous actions that are their antidotes, the actions that lead to the attainment of the marks and signs?

original: par byed pa'i las gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rnam pa sna tshogs de thos na /
analyzed: par byed pa'i las gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rnam pa sna tshogs de thos na /
translated: How can they be made to hear about the various kinds of benefits that are the fruits of those actions?

original: 'bras bu'i phan yon chen po de 'dod ches nas sdig pa de las kyang ldog par 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phan yon chen po de 'dod ches nas sdig pa de las kyang ldog par 'gyur zhing ;
translated: How can they be made to turn away from those sinful actions, having developed a strong desire for those great benefits that are their fruits?

original: dge ba de yang dag par blangs te gnas par 'gyur zhig gu snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba de yang dag par blangs te gnas par 'gyur zhig gu snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How can they be made to take up and maintain those virtuous actions?”

original: mtshan gyi mdo las ci skad gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mtshan gyi mdo las ci skad gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: As it is said in the Discourse on the Marks:

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtul zhugs dang / gtong ba rnams la shin tu gnas pas ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa brnyes so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtul zhugs dang / gtong ba rnams la shin tu gnas pas ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa brnyes so //
translated: “By abiding in morality, patience, effort, and generosity, he attained feet with ankles that do not protrude.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa yongs su g-yo ba las brten te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa yongs su g-yo ba las brten te /
translated: The marks of wheels on his hands and feet are acquired from having fully turned away from coming and going,

original: pha ma la bsnyen bkur sna tshogs byas pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems can gnod pa las bsrungs pa ni phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa brnyes so //
analyzed: pha ma la bsnyen bkur sna tshogs byas pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems can gnod pa las bsrungs pa ni phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa brnyes so //
translated: and from having served his parents in various ways and protected sentient beings from various harms.
